Text

ï»¿THE ROSARY

CHAPTER I

ENTER [THE DUCHESS]304-the duchess .

The peaceful stillness of an English summer afternoon brooded over [the park]305-the park and gardens at [Overdene]1-overdene . A hush of moving sunlight and lengthening shadows lay upon [the lawn]306-the lawn , and a promise of refreshing coolness made the shade of the great cedar tree a place to be desired .

[The old stone house]307-the old stone house , solid , substantial , and unadorned , suggested unlimited spaciousness and comfort within ; and was redeemed from positive ugliness without , by the fine ivy , magnolia trees , and wistaria , of many years ' growth , climbing its plain face , and now covering it with a mantle of soft green , large white blooms , and a cascade of purple blossom .

[A terrace]308-a terrace ran the full length of [the house]309-the house , bounded at one end by [a large conservatory]310-a large conservatory , at the other by [an aviary]311-an aviary . Wide stone steps , at intervals , led down from [the terrace]312-the terrace on to the soft springy turf of [the lawn]306-the lawn . Beyond [the wide park]314-the wide park ; clumps of old trees , haunted by shy brown deer ; and , through the trees , fitful gleams of [the river]315-the river , a narrow silver ribbon , winding gracefully in and out between long grass , buttercups , and cow - daisies .

The sun - dial pointed to four o'clock .

The birds were having [their]316-their hour of silence . Not a trill sounded from among the softly moving leaves , not a chirp , not a twitter . The stillness seemed almost oppressive . The one brilliant spot of colour in [the landscape]317-the landscape was a large scarlet macaw , asleep on [his]318-his stand under the cedar .

At last came the sound of an opening door . [A quaint old figure]319-a quaint old figure stepped out on to [the terrace]312-the terrace , walked its entire length to the right , and disappeared into [the rose - garden]321-the rose - garden . [The Duchess of [Meldrum]2-meldrum]322-the duchess of meldrum had gone to cut [her]322-the duchess of meldrum roses .

[She]322-the duchess of meldrum wore an ancient straw hat , of the early - Victorian shape known as " mushroom , "[322-the duchess of meldrum] tied with black ribbons beneath [her]322-the duchess of meldrum portly chin ; a loose brown holland coat ; a very short tweed skirt , and Engadine " gouties . "[322-the duchess of meldrum] [She]322-the duchess of meldrum had on some very old gauntlet gloves , and carried a wooden basket and a huge pair of scissors .

[A wag]323-a wag had once remarked that if [you]324-you met [her]322-the duchess of meldrum Grace of [Meldrum]2-meldrum returning from gardening or feeding [her]322-the duchess of meldrum poultry , and were in a charitable frame of mind , [you]324-you would very likely give [her]322-the duchess of meldrum sixpence . But , after [you]324-you had thus drawn [her]322-the duchess of meldrum attention to [yourself]324-you and [she]322-the duchess of meldrum looked at [you]324-you , [Sir Walter Raleigh]99-sir walter raleigh 's cloak would not be in it ! [Your]324-you one possible course would be to collapse into the mud , and let the ducal " gouties "[304-the duchess] trample on [you]324-you . This [the duchess]304-the duchess would do with gusto ; then accept [your]324-you apologies with good nature ; and keep [your]324-you sixpence , to show when [she]322-the duchess of meldrum told the story .

[The duchess]304-the duchess lived alone ; that is to say , [she]304-the duchess had no desire for the perpetual companionship of any of [her]304-the duchess own kith and [kin]327-kin , nor for the constant smiles and flattery of [a paid companion]328-a paid companion . [[Her]304-the duchess pale daughter]329-her pale daughter , whom [she]304-the duchess had systematically snubbed , had married ; [[her]304-the duchess handsome son]330-her handsome son , whom [she]304-the duchess had adored and spoiled , had prematurely died , before the death , a few years since , of [Thomas]100-tommy , [fifth Duke of [Meldrum]2-meldrum]331-fifth duke of meldrum . [He]100-tommy had come to a sudden and , as [the duchess]304-the duchess often remarked , very suitable end ; for , on [his]100-tommy sixty - second birthday , clad in all the splendours of [his]100-tommy hunting scarlet , top hat , and buff corduroy breeches , the mare [he]100-tommy was mercilessly putting at an impossible fence suddenly refused , and [Thomas]100-tommy , [Duke of [Meldrum]2-meldrum]333-duke of meldrum , shot into a field of turnips ; pitched upon [his]100-tommy head , and spoke no more .

This sudden cessation of [his]100-tommy noisy and fiery life meant a complete transformation in [the entourage of [the duchess]304-the duchess]334-the entourage of the duchess . Hitherto [she]304-the duchess had had to tolerate [the boon companions]336-the boon companions , congenial to [himself]100-tommy , with whom [he]100-tommy chose to fill [the house]309-the house ; or to invite [those of [[her]304-the duchess own friends]339-her own friends to whom [she]304-the duchess could explain [Thomas]100-tommy , and who suffered [Thomas]100-tommy gladly , out of friendship for [her]304-the duchess , and enjoyment of lovely Overdene]338-those of her own friends to whom she could explain thomas , and who suffered thomas gladly , out of friendship for her , and enjoyment of lovely overdene . But even then [the duchess]304-the duchess had no pleasure in [her]304-the duchess parties ; for , quaint rough diamond though [she]304-the duchess [herself]304-the duchess might appear , the bluest of blue blood ran in [her]304-the duchess veins ; and , though [her]304-the duchess manner had the off - hand abruptness and disregard of [other people]341-other people 's feelings not unfrequently found in [old ladies of high rank]342-old ladies of high rank , [she]304-the duchess was at heart [a true gentlewoman]343-a true gentlewoman , and could always be trusted to say and do the right thing in moments of importance : [The late duke]344-the late duke 's language had been sulphurous and [his]344-the late duke manners Georgian ; and when [he]344-the late duke had been laid in the unwonted quiet of [[his]344-the late duke ancestral vault]345-his ancestral vault ' so unlike [him]344-the late duke , [poor dear]346-poor dear , " as [the duchess]304-the duchess remarked , "[346-poor dear] that it is quite a comfort to know [he]344-the late duke is not really there " [[her]304-the duchess Grace]2042-her grace looked around [her]304-the duchess , and began to realise the beauties and possibilities of [Overdene]1-overdene .[304-the duchess]

At first [she]304-the duchess contented [herself]304-the duchess with gardening , making an aviary , and surrounding [herself]304-the duchess with all sorts of queer birds and beasts ; upon whom [she]304-the duchess lavished the affection which , of late years , had known no human outlet .

But after a while [her]304-the duchess natural inclination to hospitality , [her]304-the duchess humorous enjoyment of [other people]341-other people 's foibles , and a quaint delight in parading [her]304-the duchess own , led to constant succession of house - parties at [Overdene]1-overdene , which soon became known as [a Liberty Hall of varied delights]348-a liberty hall of varied delights where [you]349-you always met [the people [you]349-you most wanted to meet]350-the people you most wanted to meet , found every facility for enjoying [your]349-you favourite pastime , were fed and housed in perfect style , and spent some of the most ideal days of [your]349-you summer , or cheery days of [your]349-you winter , never dull , never bored , free to come and go as [you]349-you pleased , and everything seasoned [everybody]351-everybody with the delightful ' sauce piquante " of never being quite sure what [the duchess]304-the duchess would do or say next .[304-the duchess]

[She]304-the duchess mentally arranged [her]304-the duchess parties under three heads " freak parties , "[304-the duchess] " [mere people parties]2044-mere people parties , "[304-the duchess] and " best parties . "[304-the duchess] A " best party "[304-the duchess] was in progress on the lovely June day when [the duchess]304-the duchess , having enjoyed an unusually long siesta , donned what [she]304-the duchess called [her]304-the duchess " garden togs "[304-the duchess] and sallied forth to cut roses .

As [she]304-the duchess tramped along [the terrace]312-the terrace and passed through the little iron gate leading to [the rose - garden]321-the rose - garden , [Tommy]100-tommy , [the scarlet macaw]355-the scarlet macaw , opened one eye and watched [her]304-the duchess ; gave a loud kiss as [she]304-the duchess reached the gate and disappeared from view , then laughed to [himself]100-tommy and went to sleep again .

Of all the many pets , [Tommy]100-tommy was prime favourite . [He]100-tommy represented [the duchess]304-the duchess 's one concession to morbid sentiment . After the demise of [the duke]357-the duke [she]304-the duchess had found it so depressing to be invariably addressed with suave deference by every male voice [she]304-the duchess heard . If [the butler]358-the butler could have snorted , or [the rector]359-the rector have rapped out an uncomplimentary adjective , [the duchess]304-the duchess would have felt cheered . As it was , a fixed and settled melancholy lay upon [her]304-the duchess spirit until [she]304-the duchess saw in [a dealer]361-a dealer 's list an advertisement of a prize macaw , warranted [a grand talker]362-a grand talker , with a vocabulary of over five hundred words .

[The duchess]304-the duchess went immediately to [town]364-town , paid a visit to [the dealer]365-the dealer , heard a few of the macaw 's words and the tone in which [he]365-the dealer said them , bought [him]365-the dealer on the spot , and took [him]365-the dealer down to [Overdene]1-overdene . The first evening [he]100-tommy sat crossly on the perch of [his]100-tommy grand new stand , declining to say a single one of [his]100-tommy five hundred words , though [the duchess]304-the duchess spent [her]304-the duchess evening in [the hall]367-the hall , sitting in every possible place ; first close to [him]100-tommy ; then , away in a distant corner ; in an arm - chair placed behind a screen ; reading , with [her]304-the duchess back turned , feigning not to notice [him]100-tommy ; facing [him]100-tommy with concentrated attention . [Tommy]100-tommy merely clicked [his]100-tommy tongue at [her]304-the duchess every time [she]304-the duchess emerged from a hiding - place ; or , if [the rather worried butler]368-the rather worried butler or [nervous under - footman]369-nervous under - footman passed hurriedly through [the hall]367-the hall , sent showers of kisses after [them]371-them , and then went into fits of ventriloquial laughter . [The duchess]304-the duchess , in despair , even tried reminding [him]100-tommy in a whisper of the remarks [he]100-tommy had made in [the shop]373-the shop ; but [Tommy]100-tommy only winked at [her]304-the duchess and put [his]100-tommy claw over [his]100-tommy beak . Still , [she]304-the duchess enjoyed [his]100-tommy flushed and scarlet appearance , and retired to rest hopeful and in no wise regretting [her]304-the duchess bargain .

The next morning it became instantly evident to [[the house]309-the house - maid who swept [the hall]367-the hall]375-the house - maid who swept the hall , [the footman who sorted the letters]377-the footman who sorted the letters , and [the butler who sounded the breakfast gong]378-the butler who sounded the breakfast gong , that a good night 's rest had restored to [Tommy]100-tommy the full use of [his]100-tommy vocabulary . And when [the duchess]304-the duchess came sailing down the stairs , ten minutes after the gong had sounded , and [Tommy]100-tommy , flapping [his]100-tommy wings angrily , shrieked at [her]304-the duchess : " Now then , [old girl]2045-old girl ! Come on ! "[100-tommy] [she]304-the duchess went to breakfast in a more cheerful mood than [she]304-the duchess had known for months past .

CHAPTER II

INTRODUCES [THE HONOURABLE JANE]101-jane

The only one of [[her]304-the duchess relatives]380-her relatives who practically made [her]304-the duchess [home]381-home with [the duchess]304-the duchess was [[her]304-the duchess niece]383-her niece and [former ward]384-former ward , [the Honourable Jane Champion]101-jane ; and this consisted merely in the fact that [the Honourable Jane]101-jane was [the one person who might invite [herself]101-jane to [Overdene]1-overdene or [Portland Place]3-portland place]385-the one person who might invite herself to overdene or portland place , arrive when [she]101-jane chose , stay as long as [she]101-jane pleased , and leave when it suited [her]101-jane convenience . On the death of [[her]304-the duchess father]386-her father , when [her]304-the duchess lonely girlhood in [[her]304-the duchess Norfolk home]387-her norfolk home came to an end , [she]304-the duchess would gladly have filled the place of [[a daughter]388-a daughter to [the duchess]304-the duchess]389-a daughter to the duchess . But [the duchess]304-the duchess did not require [a daughter]388-a daughter ; and [a daughter with pronounced views]393-a daughter with pronounced views , plenty of back - bone of [her]393-a daughter with pronounced views own , a fine figure , and a plain face , would have seemed to [her]393-a daughter with pronounced views Grace of [Meldrum]2-meldrum a peculiarly undesirable acquisition . So [Jane]101-jane was given to understand that [she]101-jane might come whenever [she]101-jane liked , and stay as long as [she]101-jane liked , but on the same footing as [other people]341-other people . This meant liberty to come and go as [she]101-jane pleased ; and no responsibility towards [[her]101-jane aunt 's guests]395-her aunt 's guests . [The duchess]304-the duchess preferred managing [her]304-the duchess own parties in [her]304-the duchess oven way .

[Jane Champion]101-jane was now in [her]101-jane thirtieth year . [She]101-jane had once been described , by [one who saw below the surface]397-one who saw below the surface , as [a perfectly beautiful woman in an absolutely plain shell]398-a perfectly beautiful woman in an absolutely plain shell ; and [no man]399-no man had as yet looked beneath the shell , and seen [the woman]400-the woman in [her]101-jane perfection . [She]101-jane would have made [earth heaven]401-earth heaven for [a blind lover who , not having eyes for the plainness of [her]101-jane face or the massiveness of [her]101-jane figure , might have drawn nearer , and apprehended the wonder of [her]101-jane as [a woman]403-a woman , experiencing the wealth of tenderness of which [she]101-jane was capable , the blessed comfort of the shelter of [her]101-jane love]402-a blind lover who , not having eyes for the plainness of her face or the massiveness of her figure , might have drawn nearer , and apprehended the wonder of her as a woman , experiencing the wealth of tenderness of which she was capable , the blessed comfort of the shelter of her love , the perfect comprehension of [her]101-jane sympathy , the marvellous joy of winning and wedding [her]101-jane . But as yet , [no blind man with far - seeing vision]404-no blind man with far - seeing vision had come [her]101-jane way ; and it always seemed to be [her]101-jane lot to take a second place , on occasions when [she]101-jane would have filled the first to infinite perfection .

[She]101-jane had been [bridesmaid]405-bridesmaid at weddings where [the charming brides]406-the charming brides , notwithstanding [their]406-the charming brides superficial loveliness , possessed few of the qualifications for wifehood with which [she]101-jane was so richly endowed .

[She]101-jane was [godmother to [[her]101-jane friends]408-her friends ' babies]407-godmother to her friends ' babies , [she]101-jane [, whose motherhood would have been a thing for wonder and worship]409-, whose motherhood would have been a thing for wonder and worship .

[She]101-jane had a glorious voice , but [her]101-jane face not matching it , its existence was rarely suspected ; and as [she]101-jane accompanied to perfection , [she]101-jane was usually in requisition to play for the singing of [others]410-others .

In short , all [her]101-jane life long [Jane]101-jane had filled second places , and filled them very contentedly . [She]101-jane had never known what it was to be absolutely first with [any one]411-any one . [[Her]101-jane mother]412-her mother 's death had occurred during [her]101-jane infancy , so that [she]101-jane had not even the most shadowy remembrance of that maternal love and tenderness which [she]101-jane used sometimes to try to imagine , although [she]101-jane had never experienced it .

[[[Her]101-jane mother]412-her mother 's maid , [a faithful and devoted woman]415-a faithful and devoted woman , dismissed soon after the death of [[her]414-her mother 's maid , a faithful and devoted woman , dismissed soon after the death of her mistress mistress]416-her mistress]414-her mother 's maid , a faithful and devoted woman , dismissed soon after the death of her mistress , chancing to be in [the neighbourhood]417-the neighbourhood some twelve years later , called at [the manor]418-the manor , in the hope of finding some in [the household]419-the household who remembered [her]101-jane .

After tea , [Fraulein]102-fraulein and [Miss Jebb]103-miss jebb being out of the way , [she]101-jane was spirited up into [the schoolroom]420-the schoolroom to see [Miss Jane]104-jane , [her]104-jane heart full of memories of [the ' sweet babe " upon whom [she]104-jane and [[her]104-jane dear lady]2047-her dear lady had lavished so much love and care]2046-the ' sweet babe " upon whom she and her dear lady had lavished so much love and care .[104-jane]

[She]104-jane found awaiting [her]104-jane [a tall , plain girl with a frank , boyish manner and a rather disconcerting way]421-a tall , plain girl with a frank , boyish manner and a rather disconcerting way as [she]104-jane afterwards remarked , of " taking stock of a body the while one was a - talking , "[104-jane] which at first checked the flow of good [Sarah]105-sarah 's reminiscences , poured forth so freely in [[the housekeeper]422-the housekeeper 's room below]423-the housekeeper 's room below , and reduced [her]104-jane to looking tearfully around [the room]424-the room , remarking that [she]104-jane remembered choosing the blessed wall - paper with [[her]104-jane dear lady]2047-her dear lady now gone , whose joy had been so great when [the dear babe]426-the dear babe first took notice and reached up for the roses . " And [I]426-the dear babe can show [you]104-jane , [miss]2048-miss , if [you]104-jane care to know it just which bunch of roses it were . "[426-the dear babe]

But before [Sarah]105-sarah 's visit was over , [Jane]104-jane had heard many undreamed - of - things ; amongst others , that [[her]104-jane mother]412-her mother used to kiss [her]104-jane little hands , " ah , many a time [she]412-her mother , did , [miss]2048-miss ; called them little rose - petals , and covered them with kisses . "[412-her mother]

[The child]428-the child , utterly unused to any demonstrations of affection , looked at [her]428-the child rather ungainly brown hands and laughed , simply because [she]428-the child was ashamed of the unwonted tightening at [her]428-the child throat and the queer stinging of tears beneath [her]428-the child eyelids . Thus [Sarah]105-sarah departed under the impression that [Miss Jane]104-jane had grown up into [a rather a heartless young lady]429-a rather a heartless young lady . But [Fraulein]102-fraulein and [Jebbie]106-jebbie never knew why , from that day onward , the hands , of which [they]430-they had so often had cause to complain , were kept scrupulously clean ; and on [her]428-the child birthday night , unashamed in the quiet darkness , [the lonely little child]431-the lonely little child kissed [her]428-the child own hands beneath the bedclothes , striving thus to reach the tenderness of [[her]428-the child dead mother]432-her dead mother 's lips .

And in after years , when [she]104-jane became [[her]104-jane own mistress]433-her own mistress , one of [her]104-jane first actions was to advertise for [Sarah Matthews]105-sarah and engage [her]104-jane as [[her]104-jane own maid]434-her own maid , at a salary which enabled [the good woman]435-the good woman eventually to buy [herself]428-the child a comfortable annuity .

[Jane]104-jane saw but little of [[her]104-jane father]386-her father , who had found it difficult to forgive [her]104-jane , firstly , for being [a girl]437-a girl when [he]386-her father desired [a son]438-a son ; secondly , being [a girl]437-a girl , for having inherited [his]438-a son plainness rather than [[her]104-jane mother]412-her mother 's beauty . [Parents]441-parents are apt to see no injustice in the fact that [they]441-parents are often annoyed with [[their]441-parents offspring]442-their offspring for possessing attributes , both of character and appearance , with which [they]441-parents [themselves]441-parents have endowed [them]442-their offspring .

[The hero of [Jane]104-jane 's childhood]443-the hero of jane 's childhood , [the chum of [her]104-jane girlhood]444-the chum of her girlhood and [the close friend of [her]104-jane maturer years]445-the close friend of her maturer years , was [Deryck Brand]107-deryck , [only son of [the rector of [the parish]448-the parish]447-the rector of the parish]446-only son of the rector of the parish , and [her]104-jane senior by nearly ten years . But even in [their]449-their friendship , close though it was , [she]104-jane had never felt [herself]104-jane first to [him]107-deryck . As [a medical student]450-a medical student , at [home]381-home during vacations , [[his]107-deryck mother]452-his mother and [his]107-deryck profession took precedence in [his]107-deryck mind of [the lonely child]453-the lonely child , whose devotion pleased [him]107-deryck and whose strong character and original mental development interested [him]107-deryck . Later on [he]107-deryck married [a lovely girl]454-a lovely girl , as unlike [Jane]104-jane as [one woman]455-one woman could possibly be to another ; but still [their]449-their friendship held and deepened ; and now , when [he]107-deryck was rapidly advancing to the very front rank of [his]107-deryck profession , [her]104-jane appreciation of [his]107-deryck work , and sympathetic understanding of [his]107-deryck aims and efforts , meant more to [him]107-deryck than even the signal mark of royal favour , of which [he]107-deryck had lately been the recipient .

[Jane Champion]101-jane had [no close friends]456-no close friends amongst [the women of [her]101-jane set]457-the women of her set . [Her]101-jane lonely girlhood had bred in [her]101-jane an absolute frankness towards [herself]101-jane and other people which made it difficult for [her]101-jane to understand or tolerate the little artificialities of society , or the trivial weaknesses of [her]101-jane own sex . Women to whom [she]101-jane had shown special kindness and [they]457-the women of her set were [many]458-many maintained an attitude of grateful admiration in [her]101-jane presence , and of cowardly silence in [her]101-jane absence when [she]101-jane chanced to be under discussion .

But of [men friends]459-men friends [she]101-jane had many , especially among [a set of young fellows just through college]460-a set of young fellows just through college , of whom [she]101-jane made particular chums ; [nice lads , who wrote to [her]101-jane of [their]461-nice lads , who wrote to her of their college and mess - room scrapes , as they would never have dreamed of doing to their own mothers college and mess - room scrapes , as [they]461-nice lads , who wrote to her of their college and mess - room scrapes , as they would never have dreamed of doing to their own mothers would never have dreamed of doing to [[their]461-nice lads , who wrote to her of their college and mess - room scrapes , as they would never have dreamed of doing to their own mothers own mothers]462-their own mothers]461-nice lads , who wrote to her of their college and mess - room scrapes , as they would never have dreamed of doing to their own mothers . [Jane Champion]101-jane happened just now to be paying one of [her]101-jane long visits to [Overdene]1-overdene , and was playing golf with [a boy for whom [she]101-jane had long had a rod in pickle on this summer afternoon when [the duchess]304-the duchess]463-a boy for whom she had long had a rod in pickle on this summer afternoon when the duchess went to cut blooms in [[her]304-the duchess rose - garden]465-her rose - garden . Only , as [Jane]101-jane found out , [you]466-you can not decorously lead up to a scolding if [you]466-you are very keen on golf , and go golfing with [a person who is equally enthusiastic , and who all the way to the links]467-a person who is equally enthusiastic , and who all the way to the links explains exactly how [he]467-a person who is equally enthusiastic , and who all the way to the links played every hole the last time [he]467-a person who is equally enthusiastic , and who all the way to the links went round , and all the way back gloats over , in retrospection , the way [you]466-you and [he]467-a person who is equally enthusiastic , and who all the way to the links have played every hole this time .

So [Jane]101-jane considered [her]101-jane afternoon , didactically , a failure . But , in [the smoking - room]468-the smoking - room that night , [young Cathcart]108-billy explained the game all over again to a few choice spirits , and then remarked : " [Old Jane]101-jane was superb ! Fancy ! Such a drive as that , and doing number seven in three and not talking about it ! [I]108-billy 've jolly well made up [my]108-billy mind to send no more bouquets to [Tou - Tou]4-tou - tou . Hang it , [boys]2051-boys ! [You]466-you ca n't see [yourself]466-you at champagne suppers with [a dancing - woman]2052-a dancing - woman , when [you]466-you 've walked round the links , on a day like this , with the Honourable [Jane]101-jane . [She]101-jane drives like a rifle shot , and when [she]101-jane lofts , [you]466-you 'd think the ball was a swallow ; and beat [me]108-billy three holes up and never mentioned it . CHAPTER III

[THE SURPRISE PACKET

The sun - dial]469-the surprise packet the sun - dial pointed to half past four o'clock . The hour of silence appeared to be over . The birds commenced twittering ; and a cuckoo , in an adjacent wood , sounded [his]470-his note at intervals .

[The house]309-the house awoke to sudden life . There was an opening and shutting of doors . [Two footmen]472-two footmen , in the mulberry and silver of the Meldrum livery , hurried down from [the terrace]312-the terrace , carrying folding tea - tables , with which [they]472-two footmen supplemented those of rustic oak standing permanently under the cedar . [One]474-one , promptly returned to [the house]309-the house ; while [the other]476-the other remained behind , spreading snowy cloths over each table .

The macaw awoke , stretched [his]474-one wings and flapped them twice , then sidled up and down [his]474-one perch , concentrating [his]474-one attention upon [the footman]477-the footman .

" Mind ! "[474-one] [he]474-one exclaimed suddenly , in [the butler]358-the butler 's voice , as a cloth , flung on too hurriedly , fluttered to the grass .

" Hold [your]481-the macaw jaw ! "[479-the young footman] said [the young footman]479-the young footman irritably , flicking the bird with the table - cloth , and then glancing furtively at [the rose - garden]321-the rose - garden .

" [Tommy]100-tommy wants a gooseberry ! "[481-the macaw] shrieked [the macaw]481-the macaw , dodging the table - cloth and hanging , head downwards , from [his]481-the macaw perch .

" Do n't [you]481-the macaw wish [you]481-the macaw may get it ? "[477-the footman] said [the footman]477-the footman viciously .

" Give it [him]100-tommy , [somebody]2054-somebody , "[100-tommy] remarked [Tommy]100-tommy , in [the duchess]304-the duchess 's voice .

[The footman]477-the footman started , and looked over [his]477-the footman shoulder ; then hurriedly told [Tommy]100-tommy just what [he]477-the footman thought of [him]100-tommy , and where [he]477-the footman wished [him]100-tommy ; cuffed [him]100-tommy soundly , and returned to [the house]309-the house , followed by peals of laughter , mingled with exhortations and imprecations from the angry bird , who danced up and down on [his]481-the macaw perch until [[his]481-the macaw enemy]486-his enemy had vanished from view .

A few minutes later the tables were spread with the large variety of eatables considered necessary at an English afternoon tea ; the massive silver urn and teapots gleamed on the buffet - table , behind which [the old butler]487-the old butler presided ; muffins , crumpets , cakes , and every kind of sandwich supplemented the dainty little rolled slices of white and brown bread - and - butter , while heaped - up bowls of freshly gathered strawberries lent a touch of colour to the artistic effect of white and silver . When all was ready , [the butler]358-the butler raised [his]358-the butler hand and sounded an old Chinese gong hanging in the cedar tree . Before the penetrating boom had died away , voices were heard in the distance from all over [the grounds]489-the grounds .

Up from [the river]315-the river , down from [the tennis courts]491-the tennis courts , out from [house]492-house and [garden]493-garden , came [[the duchess]304-the duchess 's guests]495-the duchess 's guests , rejoicing in the refreshing prospect of tea , hurrying to the welcome shade of the cedar ; [charming women in white , carefully guarding [their]496-charming women in white , carefully guarding their complexions beneath shady hats and picturesque parasols complexions beneath shady hats and picturesque parasols]496-charming women in white , carefully guarding their complexions beneath shady hats and picturesque parasols ; [delightful girls]497-delightful girls , who had long ago sacrificed complexions to comfort , and now walked across [the lawn]306-the lawn bareheaded , swinging [their]497-delightful girls rackets and discussing the last hard - fought set ; [men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter ; praising [[their]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter partners]500-their partners , while remaining unobtrusively silent as to [their]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter own achievements .

[They]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter made [a picturesque group]501-a picturesque group as [they]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter gathered under the tree , subsiding with immense satisfaction into the low wicker chairs , or on to the soft turf , and helping [themselves]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter to what [they]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter pleased . When [all]502-all were supplied with tea , coffee , or iced drinks , to [their]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter liking , conversation flowed again .

" So [the duchess]304-the duchess 's concert comes off to - night , "[503-some one] remarked [some one]503-some one . " [I]503-some one wish to goodness [they]499-men in flannels , sunburned and handsome , joining in the talk and laughter would hang this tree with Chinese lanterns and , have it out here . But [they]2083-the poor complacent amateurs have forgotten all about it by the following year ; or a fresh contingent of [willing performers]2085-willing performers steps into the breach . [The duchess]304-the duchess 's little joke always comes off . "[112-lady ingleby]

" [The Honourable Jane]101-jane does not approve of it , "[117-ronnie] said [young Ronald Ingram]117-ronnie ; " therefore [she]101-jane is generally given marching orders and departs to [her]101-jane next visit before the event . [Jane]101-jane 's tall figure was seen , walking along [the terrace]312-the terrace , accompanied by [Billy Cathcart]108-billy , talking eagerly . [They]511-they put [their]511-they clubs away in [the lower hall]512-the lower hall ; then came down [the lawn]306-the lawn together to the tea - tables .

[Jane]101-jane wore a tailor - made coat and skirt of grey tweed , a blue and white cambric shirt , starched linen collar and cuffs , a silk tie , and a soft felt hat with a few black quills in it . [She]101-jane walked with the freedom of movement and swing of limb which indicate great strength and a body well under control . [Her]101-jane appearance was extraordinarily unlike that of all the pretty and [graceful women grouped beneath the cedar tree]514-graceful women grouped beneath the cedar tree . And yet it was in no sense masculine or , to use a more appropriate word , mannish ; for everything strong is masculine ; but [a woman who apes an appearance of strength which [she]515-a woman who apes an appearance of strength which she does not possess does not possess]515-a woman who apes an appearance of strength which she does not possess , is mannish ; rather was it so truly feminine that [she]515-a woman who apes an appearance of strength which she does not possess could afford to adopt a severe simplicity of attire , which suited admirably the decided plainness of [her]515-a woman who apes an appearance of strength which she does not possess features , and the almost massive proportions of [her]515-a woman who apes an appearance of strength which she does not possess figure .

[She]101-jane stepped into the circle beneath the cedar , and took one of the half - dozen places immediately vacated by [the men]516-the men , with the complete absence of self - consciousness which always characterised [her]101-jane .

" What did [you]101-jane go round in , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? "[517-one of the men] inquired [one of [the men]516-the men]517-one of the men .

" [My]101-jane ordinary clothes , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane ; quoting [Punch]120-punch , and evading the question .

But [Billy]108-billy burst out : " [She]101-jane went round in "[108-billy]

" Oh , be quiet , [Billy]108-billy , "[101-jane] interposed [Jane]101-jane . " [You]108-billy and [I]101-jane are practically [the only golf maniacs present]2097-the only golf maniacs present . Where is [[my]101-jane aunt]2102-my aunt ? [Poor Simmons]121-simmons was toddling all over [the place]2081-the place when [we]2100-we went in to put away [our]2100-we clubs , searching for [her]2102-my aunt with a telegram . "[101-jane]

" Why did n't [you]119-myra open it ? "[119-myra] asked [Myra]119-myra .

" Because [[my]119-myra aunt]2102-my aunt never allows [her]2102-my aunt telegrams to be opened . [She]2102-my aunt loves shocks ; and there is always the possibility of a telegram containing startling news . [She]2102-my aunt says it completely spoils it if [some one else]2105-some one else knows it first , and breaks it to [her]2102-my aunt gently . "[119-myra]

" Here comes [the duchess]304-the duchess , "[111-garth] said [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , who was sitting where [he]111-garth could see the little gate into [the rose - garden]321-the rose - garden .

" Do not mention the telegram , "[101-jane] cautioned [Jane]101-jane . " It would not please [her]304-the duchess that [I]101-jane should even know of its arrival . It would be a shame to take any of the bloom off the unexpected delight of a wire on this hot day , when nothing unusual seemed likely to happen . "[101-jane]

[They]520-they turned and looked towards [the duchess]304-the duchess as [she]304-the duchess bustled across [the lawn]306-the lawn ; [this quaint old figure , who had called [them]520-they together]523-this quaint old figure , who had called them together ; who owned [the lovely place where [they]520-they were spending such delightful days]524-the lovely place where they were spending such delightful days ; and whose odd whimsicalities had been so freely discussed while [they]520-they drank [her]304-the duchess tea and feasted off [her]304-the duchess strawberries . [The men]516-the men rose as [she]304-the duchess approached , but not quite so spontaneously as [they]516-the men had done for [[her]304-the duchess niece]383-her niece .

[The duchess]304-the duchess carried a large wooden basket filled to overflowing with exquisite roses . Every bloom was perfect , and each had been cut at exactly the right moment .

CHAPTER IV

JANE VOLUNTEERS

[The duchess]304-the duchess plumped down [her]304-the duchess basket in the middle of the strawberry table .

" There , [good people]2107-good people ! "[304-the duchess] [she]304-the duchess said , rather breathlessly . " Help [yourselves]2107-good people , and let [me]304-the duchess see [you]2107-good people all wearing roses to - night . And [the concert - room]2060-the concert - room is to be a bower of roses . [We]520-they will call it ' [LA FETE DES ROSES]2109-la fete des roses . ' ... No , thank [you]2107-good people , [Ronnie]117-ronnie . That tea has been made half an hour at least , and [you]2107-good people ought to love [me]304-the duchess too well to press it upon [me]304-the duchess . Besides , [I]304-the duchess never take tea . [I]304-the duchess have a whiskey and soda when [I]304-the duchess wake from [my]304-the duchess nap , and that sustains [me]304-the duchess until dinner . Oh yes , [[my]304-the duchess dear]2068-my dear [Myra]119-myra , [I]304-the duchess know [I]304-the duchess came to [your]119-myra interesting meeting , and signed that excellent pledge ' POUR ENCOURAGER LES AUTRES ' ; but [I]304-the duchess drove straight to [[my]304-the duchess doctor]2111-my doctor when [I]304-the duchess left [[your]119-myra house]2112-your house , and [he]2111-my doctor gave [me]304-the duchess a certificate to say [I]304-the duchess MUST take something when [I]304-the duchess needed it ; and [I]304-the duchess always need it when [I]304-the duchess wake from [my]304-the duchess nap .... Really , [Dal]116-dal , it is positively wicked for [any man]2113-any man , off the stage , to look as picturesque as [you]116-dal do , in that pale violet shirt , and dark violet tie , and those white flannels . If [I]304-the duchess were [[your]119-myra grandmother]2114-your grandmother [I]304-the duchess should send [you]119-myra in to take them off . If [you]119-myra turn the heads of [old dowagers]2115-old dowagers such as [I]304-the duchess am , what chance have all these chickens ? ... Hush , [Tommy]100-tommy ! That was a very naughty word ! And [you]119-myra need not be jealous of [Dal]116-dal . [I]304-the duchess admire [you]119-myra still more . [Dal]116-dal , will [you]116-dal paint [my]304-the duchess scarlet macaw ? "[304-the duchess]

[The young artist]529-the young artist , whose portraits in [that year 's Academy]530-that year 's academy had created much interest in the artistic world , and whose violet shirt had just been so severely censured , lay back in [his]529-the young artist lounge - chair , with [his]529-the young artist arms behind [his]529-the young artist head and a gleam of amusement in [his]529-the young artist bright brown eyes .

" No , [dear Duchess]2116-dear duchess , "[529-the young artist] [he]529-the young artist said . " [I]529-the young artist beg respectfully to decline the commission , [Tommy]100-tommy would require [a Landseer]2117-a landseer to do full justice to [his]100-tommy attitudes and expression . Besides , it would be demoralising to [an innocent and well - brought - up youth , such as [you]119-myra know [me]529-the young artist to be]2118-an innocent and well - brought - up youth , such as you know me to be , to spend long hours in [[Tommy]100-tommy 's society]2119-tommy 's society , listening to the remarks that sweet bird would make while [I]529-the young artist painted [him]100-tommy . But [I]529-the young artist will tell [you]119-myra what [I]529-the young artist will do . [I]529-the young artist will paint [you]119-myra , [dear Duchess]2116-dear duchess , only not in that hat ! Ever since [I]529-the young artist was quite [a small boy]2121-a small boy , a straw hat with black ribbons tied under the chin has made [me]529-the young artist feel ill . If [I]529-the young artist yielded to [my]529-the young artist natural impulses now , [I]529-the young artist should hide [my]529-the young artist face in [Miss Champion]118-miss champion 's lap , and kick and scream until [you]119-myra took it off . [I]529-the young artist will paint [you]119-myra in the black velvet gown [you]119-myra wore last night , with the Medici collar ; and the jolly arrangement of lace and diamonds on [your]119-myra head . And in [your]119-myra hand [you]119-myra shall hold an antique crystal mirror , mounted in silver . "[529-the young artist]

[The artist]531-the artist half closed [his]531-the artist eyes , and as [he]531-the artist described [his]531-the artist picture in a voice full of music and mystery , an attentive hush fell upon [the gay group around [him]531-the artist]532-the gay group around him . When [Garth Dalmain]111-garth described [his]111-garth pictures , [people]533-people saw [them]534-them . When [they]533-people walked into [the Academy]535-the academy or [the New Gallery]5-the new gallery the following year , [they]533-people would say : " Ah , there it is ! just as [we]533-people saw it that day , before a stroke of it was on the canvas . "[533-people]

" In [your]119-myra left hand , [you]119-myra shall hold the mirror , but [you]119-myra shall not be looking into it ; because [you]119-myra never look into mirrors , [dear Duchess]2116-dear duchess , excepting to see whether the scolding [you]119-myra are giving [[your]119-myra maid]2123-your maid , as [she]2123-your maid stands behind [you]119-myra , is making [her]2123-your maid cry ; and whether that is why [she]2123-your maid is being so clumsy in [her]2123-your maid manipulation of pins and things . If it is , [you]119-myra promptly promise [her]2123-your maid a day off , to go and see [[her]2123-your maid old mother]2124-her old mother ; and pay [her]2123-your maid journey there and back . If it is n't , [you]119-myra scold [her]2123-your maid some more . Were [I]533-people [the maid]2125-the maid , [I]533-people should always cry , large tears warranted to show in the glass ; only [I]533-people should not sniff , because sniffing is so intensely aggravating ; and [I]533-people should be most frightfully careful that [my]533-people tears did not run down [your]119-myra neck . "[533-people]

" [Dal]116-dal , [[you]116-dal ridiculous CHILD]2126-you ridiculous child ! "[304-the duchess] said [the duchess]304-the duchess . " [You]119-myra do not look into it , "[111-garth] continued [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , meditatively ; " because [we]2128-we KNOW that is a thing [you]119-myra never do . But [you]119-myra shall sit with it in [your]119-myra left hand , [your]119-myra elbow resting on an Eastern table of black ebony inlaid with mother - of - pearl . [You]119-myra will turn it from [you]119-myra , so that it reflects something exactly in front of [you]119-myra in the imaginary foreground . [You]119-myra will be looking at this unseen object with an expression of sublime affection . And in the mirror [I]111-garth will paint a vivid , brilliant , complete reflection , minute , but perfect in every detail , of [your]119-myra scarlet macaw on [his]111-garth perch . [We]2128-we will call it ' Reflections , ' because [one]474-one must always give a silly up - to - date title to pictures , and just now one nondescript word is the fashion , unless [you]119-myra feel it needful to attract to [yourself]119-myra the eye of [the public]2130-the public , in the catalogue , by calling [your]119-myra picture twenty lines of [Tennyson]122-tennyson . Amid a breathless and highly satisfactory silence , [the duchess]304-the duchess tore open the orange envelope .

Apparently the shock was of a thorough , though not enjoyable , kind ; for [the duchess]304-the duchess , at all times highly coloured , became purple as [she]304-the duchess read , and absolutely inarticulate with indignation . [Jane]101-jane rose quietly , looked over [[her]101-jane aunt]543-her aunt 's shoulder , read the long message , and returned to [her]101-jane seat .

[Jane Champion]101-jane was seated with [her]101-jane broad back half turned to [[her]101-jane aunt]543-her aunt , one knee crossed over the other , [her]101-jane large , capable hands clasped round it . [She]101-jane loosed [her]101-jane hands , turned slowly round , and looked into the keen eyes peering at [her]101-jane from under the mushroom hat . As [she]101-jane read the half - resentful , half - appealing demand in [them]564-them , a slow smile dawned in [her]101-jane own . "[101-jane]

Had the gathering under the tree been a party of " [mere people]2172-mere people , "[101-jane] it would have gasped . Had it been a " freak party , "[101-jane] it would have been loud - voiced in its expressions of surprise . Being a " best party , "[101-jane] it gave no outward sign ; but a sense of blank astonishment , purely mental , was in the air . [The duchess]304-the duchess [herself]304-the duchess was [the only person present who had heard [Jane Champion]101-jane]567-the only person present who had heard jane champion sing .

" Have [you]101-jane the song ? "[304-the duchess] asked [her]304-the duchess Grace of [Meldrum]2-meldrum , rising , and picking up [her]304-the duchess telegram and empty basket .

" [I]101-jane have , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [I]101-jane spent a few hours with [Madame Blanche]129-madame blanche when [I]101-jane was in [town]364-town last month ; and [she]129-madame blanche , who so rarely admires these modern songs , was immensely taken with it . Silence under the cedar .

[Most people]569-most people were watching [young Ronald]117-ronnie , holding the stand as much at arm 's length as possible ; while [Tommy]100-tommy , keeping [his]100-tommy balance wonderfully , sidled up close to [him]117-ronnie , evidently making confidential remarks into [Ronnie]117-ronnie 's terrified ear . [The duchess]304-the duchess walked on before , quite satisfied with the new turn events had taken .

[One or two people]571-one or two people were watching [Jane]101-jane .

" It is very brave of [you]101-jane , "[119-myra] said [Myra Ingleby]119-myra , at length . " [I]119-myra would offer to play [your]101-jane accompaniment , [dear]2179-dear ; but [I]119-myra can only manage Au clair de la lune , and [Three Blind Mice]2180-three blind mice , with one finger . "[119-myra]

" And [I]111-garth would offer to play [your]101-jane accompaniment , [dear]2179-dear , "[111-garth] said [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , " if [you]101-jane were going to sing [Lassen]130-lassen 's Allerseelen , for [I]111-garth play that quite beautifully with ten fingers ! It is an education only to hear the way [I]111-garth bring out the tolling of the cemetery chapel bell right through the song . The poor thing with the bunch of purple heather can never get away from it . Even in the grand crescendo , appassionata , fortissimo , when [they]2182-they discover that ' in death 's [dark valley]2183-dark valley this is Holy Day , ' [I]111-garth give then no holiday from that bell . [I]111-garth do n't know what it did ' once in May. ' It tolls all the time , with maddening persistence , in [my]111-garth accompaniment . But [I]111-garth have seen The Rosary , and [I]111-garth dare not face those chords . To begin with , [you]101-jane start in every known flat ; and before [you]101-jane have gone far [you]101-jane have gathered unto [yourself]101-jane handfuls of known and unknown sharps , to which [you]101-jane cling , not daring to let [them]2184-them go , lest [they]2184-them should be wanted again the next moment . Alas , no ! When it is a question of accompanying The Rosary , [I]111-garth must say , as [the old farmer at the tenants]2185-the old farmer at the tenants ' dinner the other day said to [the duchess]304-the duchess when [she]304-the duchess pressed upon [him]2185-the old farmer at the tenants a third helping of pudding : ' [Madam]131-madam , [I]111-garth CANNOT ! ' "[111-garth]

" Do n't be silly , [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [You]101-jane could accompany The Rosary perfectly , if [I]101-jane wanted it done . But , as it happens , [I]101-jane prefer accompanying [myself]101-jane . "[101-jane]

" Ah , "[112-lady ingleby] said [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby , sympathetically , " [I]112-lady ingleby quite understand that . It would be such a relief all the time to know that if things seemed going wrong , [you]101-jane could stop the other part , and give [yourself]101-jane the note . "[112-lady ingleby]

[The only two real musicians present]572-the only two real musicians present glanced at [each other]573-each other , and a gleam of amusement passed between [them]572-the only two real musicians present .

" It certainly would be useful , if necessary , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane .

" [I]111-garth would ' stop the other part ' and ' give [you]101-jane the note , ' "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , demurely .

" [I]101-jane am sure [you]111-garth would , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [You]111-garth are always so very kind . But [I]101-jane prefer to keep the matter in [my]101-jane own hands . "[101-jane]

" [You]101-jane realise the difficulty of making the voice carry in a place of that size unless [you]101-jane can stand and face [the audience]2082-the audience ? "[111-garth] [Garth Dalmain]111-garth spoke anxiously . [Jane]101-jane was [a special friend of [his]111-garth]574-a special friend of his , and [he]111-garth had [a man]575-a man 's dislike of the idea of [his]111-garth chum failing in anything , publicly .

The same quiet smile dawned in [Jane]101-jane 's eyes and passed to [her]101-jane lips as when [she]101-jane had realised that [[her]101-jane aunt]543-her aunt meant [her]101-jane to volunteer in [[Velma]113-velma 's place]2170-velma 's place . [She]101-jane glanced around . [Most of [the party]579-the party]578-most of the party had wandered off in twos and threes , some to [the house]309-the house , [others]410-others back to [the river]315-the river . [She]101-jane and [Dal]116-dal and [Myra]119-myra were practically alone . [Her]101-jane calm eyes were full of quiet amusement as [she]101-jane steadfastly met the anxious look in [Garth]111-garth 's , and answered [his]111-garth question .

" Yes , [I]101-jane know . But the acoustic properties of [the room]424-the room are very perfect , and [I]101-jane have learned to throw [my]101-jane voice . Perhaps [you]111-garth may not know in fact , how should [you]111-garth know ? but [I]101-jane have had the immense privilege of studying with [Madame Marchesi]132-madame marchesi in [Paris]7-paris , and of keeping up to the mark since by an occasional delightful hour with [[her]132-madame marchesi no less gifted daughter]2189-her no less gifted daughter in [London]6-london . So [I]101-jane ought to know all there is to know about the management of a voice , if [I]101-jane have at all adequately availed [myself]101-jane of such golden opportunities . "[101-jane]

These quiet words were Greek to [Myra]119-myra , conveying no more to [her]119-myra mind than if [Jane]101-jane had said : " [I]101-jane have been learning Tonic sol - fa . "[101-jane] In fact , not quite so much , seeing that [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby had [herself]112-lady ingleby once tried to master the Tonic sol - fa system in order to instruct [[her]112-lady ingleby men]583-her men and [maids]584-maids in part - singing . It was at a time when [she]112-lady ingleby owned [a distinctly musical household]585-a distinctly musical household . [The second footman possessed a fine barytone]586-the second footman possessed a fine barytone . [The butler]358-the butler could " do a little bass , "[358-the butler] which is to say that , while the other parts soared to higher regions , [he]358-the butler could stay on the bottom note if carefully placed there , and told to remain . [The head housemaid]588-the head housemaid sang what [she]588-the head housemaid called ' seconds " ; in other words , [she]588-the head housemaid followed along , slightly behind the trebles as regarded time , and a major third below them as regarded pitch . [The housekeeper]422-the housekeeper , [a large , dark person with a fringe on [her]422-the housekeeper upper lip , unshaven and unashamed]2191-a large , dark person with a fringe on her upper lip , unshaven and unashamed , produced a really remarkable effect by singing the air an octave below the trebles . [Unfortunately Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby was apt to confuse [her]422-the housekeeper with [the butler]358-the butler . [Myra]119-myra [herself]119-myra was the first to admit that [she]119-myra had not "[588-the head housemaid] much ear " ; but it was decidedly trying , at a moment when [she]119-myra dared not remove [her]119-myra eyes from the accompaniment of [Good King Wenceslas]133-good king wenceslas , to have called out : "[588-the head housemaid] Stay where [you]589-you are , [Jenkins]134-jenkins ! " and then find it was [Mrs. Jarvis]135-mrs. jarvis who had been travelling upwards . But when [a new footman]2193-a new footman , engaged by [Lord Ingleby]136-lord ingleby with no reference to [his]2193-a new footman musical gifts , chanced to possess a fine throaty tenor , [Myra]119-myra felt [she]119-myra really had material with which great things might be accomplished , and decided [herself]119-myra to learn the Tonic sol - fa system . [She]119-myra easily mastered mi , re , do , and so , fa , fa , mi , because these represented the opening lines of [Three Blind Mice]137-three blind mice , always a musical landmark to [Myra]119-myra . But when it came to the fugue - like intricacies in the theme of "[134-jenkins] [They]590-they all ran after [[the farmer]591-the farmer 's wife]592-the farmer 's wife , " [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby was lost without the words to cling to , and gave up the Tonic sol - fa system in despair .[591-the farmer]

So the name of [the greatest teacher of singing of this age]593-the greatest teacher of singing of this age did not convey much to [Myra]119-myra 's mind . But [Garth Dalmain]111-garth sat up .

" [I]111-garth say ! No wonder [you]101-jane take it coolly . Why , [Velma]113-velma [herself]113-velma was [a pupil of [the great madame]2195-the great madame]2194-a pupil of the great madame . "[111-garth]

" That is how it happens that [I]101-jane know [her]113-velma rather well , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [I]101-jane am here to - day because [I]101-jane was to have played [her]113-velma accompaniment . "[101-jane]

" [I]111-garth see , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . " And now [you]101-jane have to do both . ' Land 's sake ! ' as [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs says when [you]101-jane explain who 's who at a [Marlborough House garden party]2196-marlborough house garden party . But [you]101-jane prefer playing [other people]341-other people 's accompaniments , to singing [yourself]101-jane , do n't [you]101-jane ? "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane 's slow smile dawned again .

" [I]101-jane prefer singing , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " but accompanying is more useful . "[101-jane]

" Of course it is , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . " Heaps of [people]533-people can sing a little , but very few can accompany properly . "[111-garth]

" [Jane]101-jane , "[119-myra] said [Myra]119-myra , [her]119-myra grey eyes looking out lazily from under [their]594-their long black lashes , " if [you]101-jane have had singing lessons , and know some songs , why has n't [the duchess]304-the duchess turned [you]101-jane on to sing to [us]2200-our before this ? "[119-myra]

" For a sad reason , "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane replied . " [You]101-jane know [[her]304-the duchess only son]2201-her only son died eight years ago ? [He]2201-her only son was such [a handsome , talented fellow]2202-a handsome , talented fellow . [He]2201-her only son and [I]101-jane inherited [our]2200-our love of music from [[our]2200-our grandfather]2203-our grandfather . [[My]101-jane cousin]2204-my cousin got into a musical set at college , studied with enthusiasm , and wanted to take it up professionally . [He]2201-her only son had promised , one Christmas vacation , to sing at a charity concert in [town]364-town , and went out , when only just recovering from influenza , to fulfil this engagement . [He]2201-her only son had a relapse , double pneumonia set in , and [he]2201-her only son died in five days from heart failure . [[My]101-jane poor aunt]2206-my poor aunt was frantic with grief ; and since then any mention of [my]101-jane love of music makes [her]2206-my poor aunt very bitter . [I]101-jane , too , wanted to take it up professionally , but [she]2206-my poor aunt put [her]2206-my poor aunt foot down heavily . [I]101-jane scarcely ever venture to sing or play here . "[101-jane]

" Why not elsewhere ? "[111-garth] asked [Garth Dalmain]111-garth . " [We]2200-our have stayed about at [the same houses]2207-the same houses , and [I]111-garth had not the faintest idea [you]101-jane sang . "[111-garth]

" [I]101-jane do not know , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane slowly . " But music means so much to [me]101-jane . It is a sort of holy of holies in the tabernacle of [one]474-one 's inner being . And it is not easy to lift the veil . "[101-jane]

" The veil will be lifted to - night , "[119-myra] said [Myra Ingleby]119-myra .

" Yes , "[101-jane] agreed [Jane]101-jane , smiling a little ruefully , " [I]101-jane suppose it will . "[101-jane]

" And [we]2200-our shall pass in , "[111-garth] said [Garth Dalmain]111-garth .

CHAPTER V

CONFIDENCES

The shadows silently lengthened on [the lawn]306-the lawn .

The home - coming rooks circled and cawed around the tall elm trees .

The sun - dial pointed to six o'clock .

[Myra Ingleby]119-myra rose and stood with the slanting rays of the sun full in [her]119-myra eyes , [her]119-myra arms stretched over [her]119-myra head . [The artist]531-the artist noted every graceful line of [her]119-myra willowy figure .

" Ah , bah ! "[119-myra] [she]119-myra yawned . " It is so perfect out here , and [I]119-myra must go in to [[my]119-myra maid]2209-my maid . [Jane]101-jane , be advised in time . Do not ever begin facial massage . [You]101-jane become a slave to it , and it takes up hours of [your]101-jane day . Look at [me]119-myra . "[119-myra]

[They]597-i were both looking already . [Myra]119-myra was worth looking at .

" For ordinary dressing purposes , [I]597-i need not have gone in until seven ; and now [I]597-i must lose this last , perfect hour . "[597-i]

" What happens ? "[101-jane] asked [Jane]101-jane . " [I]101-jane know nothing of the process . "[101-jane]

" [I]112-lady ingleby ca n't go into details , "[112-lady ingleby] replied [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby , " but [you]101-jane know how sweet [I]112-lady ingleby have looked all day ? Well , if [I]112-lady ingleby did not go to [[my]112-lady ingleby maid]2209-my maid now , [I]112-lady ingleby should look less sweet by the end of dinner , and at the close of the evening [I]112-lady ingleby should appear ten years older . "[112-lady ingleby]

" [You]112-lady ingleby would always look sweet , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane , with frank sincerity ; " and why mind looking the age [you]112-lady ingleby are ? "[101-jane]

" [[My]119-myra dear]2068-my dear , ' [a man]575-a man is as old as [he]575-a man feels ; [a woman]403-a woman is as old as [she]403-a woman looks , ' "[119-myra] quoted [Myra]119-myra .

" [I]111-garth FEEL just seven , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth .

" And [you]600-dear lady LOOK seventeen , "[119-myra] laughed [Myra]119-myra .

" And [I]111-garth AM twenty - seven , "[111-garth] retorted [Garth]111-garth ; ' so [the duchess]304-the duchess should not call [me]0-i ' [a ridiculous child]599-a ridiculous child . ' And , [dear lady]600-dear lady , if curtailing this mysterious process is going to make [you]600-dear lady one whit less lovely to - night , [I]0-i do beseech [you]600-dear lady to hasten to [[your]600-dear lady maid]2123-your maid , or [you]600-dear lady will spoil [my]0-i whole evening . [I]0-i shall burst into tears at dinner , and [the duchess]304-the duchess hates scenes , as [you]600-dear lady very well know ! "[304-the duchess]

[Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby flapped [him]0-i with [her]112-lady ingleby garden hat as [she]112-lady ingleby passed .

" Be quiet , [[you]0-i ridiculous child]2126-you ridiculous child ! "[112-lady ingleby] [she]112-lady ingleby said . " [You]0-i had no business to listen to what [I]112-lady ingleby was saying to [Jane]101-jane . [You]0-i shall paint [me]112-lady ingleby this autumn . And after that [I]112-lady ingleby will give up facial massage , and go abroad , and come back quite old . "[112-lady ingleby]

[She]112-lady ingleby flung this last threat over [her]112-lady ingleby shoulder as [she]112-lady ingleby trailed away across [the lawn]306-the lawn .

" How lovely [she]112-lady ingleby is ! "[111-garth] commented [Garth]111-garth , gazing after [her]112-lady ingleby . " How much of that was true , do [you]101-jane suppose , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? "[111-garth]

" [I]101-jane have not the slightest idea , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane . " [I]101-jane am completely ignorant on the subject of facial massage . "[101-jane]

" Not much , [I]111-garth should think , "[111-garth] continued [Garth]111-garth , " or [she]112-lady ingleby would not have told [us]2215-us . "[111-garth]

" Ah , [you]111-garth are wrong there , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane , quickly . " [Myra]119-myra is extraordinarily honest , and always inclined to be frank about [herself]119-myra and [her]119-myra foibles . [She]119-myra had a curious upbringing . [She]119-myra is one of [a large family]2216-a large family , and was always considered [the black sheep]2217-the black sheep , not so much by [[her]119-myra brothers]2218-her brothers and [sisters]2219-sisters , as by [[her]119-myra mother]412-her mother . Nothing [she]119-myra was , or said , or did , was ever right . When [Lord Ingleby]136-lord ingleby met [her]119-myra , and [I]101-jane suppose saw [her]119-myra incipient possibilities , [she]119-myra was [a tall , gawky girl , with lovely eyes , a sweet , sensitive mouth , and a what - on - earth - am - I - going - to - do - next]2221-a tall , gawky girl , with lovely eyes , a sweet , sensitive mouth , and a what - on - earth - am - i - going - to - do - next expression on [her]119-myra face . [He]136-lord ingleby was twenty years [her]119-myra senior , but fell most determinedly in love with [her]119-myra and , though [[her]119-myra mother]412-her mother pressed upon [him]136-lord ingleby all [[her]412-her mother other daughters]2223-her other daughters in turn , [he]136-lord ingleby would have [Myra]119-myra or [nobody]2224-nobody . When [he]136-lord ingleby proposed to [her]119-myra it was impossible at first to make [her]119-myra understand what [he]136-lord ingleby meant . [His]136-lord ingleby meaning dawned on [her]119-myra at length , and [he]136-lord ingleby was not kept waiting long for [her]119-myra answer . [I]101-jane have often heard [him]136-lord ingleby tease [her]119-myra about it . [She]119-myra looked at [him]136-lord ingleby with an adorable smile , [her]119-myra eyes brimming over with tears , and said : ' Why , of course . [I]101-jane 'll marry [you]136-lord ingleby GRATEFULLY , and [I]101-jane think it is perfectly sweet of [you]136-lord ingleby to like [me]101-jane . But what a blow for [mamma]2225-mamma ! ' [They]2226-they were married with as little delay as possible , and [he]136-lord ingleby took [her]119-myra off to [Paris]7-paris , [Italy]8-italy , and [Egypt]9-egypt , had six months abroad , and brought [her]119-myra back this ! [I]101-jane was staying with [them]2226-they once , and [[her]119-myra mother]412-her mother was also [there]2228-there . [We]2226-they were sitting in [the morning room]2229-the morning room , [no men]2230-no men , just [half a dozen women]2231-half a dozen women , and [[her]119-myra mother]412-her mother began finding fault about something , and said : ' Has not [Lord Ingleby]136-lord ingleby often told [you]136-lord ingleby of it ? ' [Myra]119-myra looked up in [her]119-myra sweet , lazy way and answered : ' [Dear mamma]2233-dear mamma , [I]101-jane know it must seem strange to [you]2233-dear mamma , but , do [you]2233-dear mamma know , [[my]101-jane husband]2234-my husband thinks everything [I]101-jane do perfect . ' ' [[Your]412-her mother husband]2235-your husband is [a fool]2236-a fool ! ' snapped [[her]119-myra mother]412-her mother . ' From [YOUR]2233-dear mamma point of view , [dear mamma]2233-dear mamma , ' said [Myra]119-myra , sweetly . "[101-jane]

" [Old curmudgeon]101-jane ! "[111-garth] remarked [Garth]111-garth . " Why are [people of that sort]2239-people of that sort allowed to be called ' [mothers]2240-mothers ' ? [We]2241-we , who have had [tender , perfect mothers]2242-tender , perfect mothers , would like to make it law that the other kind should always be called ' [she]2243-she - [parents]441-parents , ' or ' [female progenitors]2245-female progenitors , ' or any other descriptive title , but not profane the sacred name of [mother]2246-mother ! "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane was silent . [She]101-jane knew the beautiful story of [Garth]111-garth 's boyhood with [[his]111-garth widowed mother]604-his widowed mother . [She]101-jane knew [his]111-garth passionate adoration of [her]101-jane sainted memory . [She]101-jane liked [him]111-garth best when [she]101-jane got a glimpse beneath the surface , and did not wish to check [his]111-garth mood by reminding [him]111-garth that [she]101-jane [herself]101-jane had never even lisped that name .

[Garth]111-garth rose from [his]111-garth chair and stretched [his]111-garth slim figure in the slanting sun - rays , much as [Myra]119-myra had done . [Jane]101-jane looked at [him]111-garth . As is often the case with [plain people]605-plain people , great physical beauty appealed to [her]101-jane strongly . [She]101-jane only allowed to that appeal its right proportion in [her]101-jane estimation of [[her]101-jane friends]408-her friends . [Garth Dalmain]111-garth by no means came first among [[her]101-jane particular chums]607-her particular chums . [He]111-garth was older than most of [them]607-her particular chums , and yet in some ways younger than any , and [his]111-garth remarkable youthfulness of manner and exuberance of spirits sometimes made [him]111-garth appear foolish to [Jane]101-jane , whose sense of humour was of a more sedate kind . But of the absolute perfection of [his]111-garth outward appearance , there was no question ; and [Jane]101-jane looked at [him]111-garth now , much as [[his]111-garth own mother]608-his own mother might have looked , with honest admiration in [her]608-his own mother kind eyes .

[Garth]111-garth , notwithstanding the pale violet shirt and dark violet tie , was quite unconscious of [his]111-garth own appearance ; and , dazzled by the golden sunlight , was also unconscious of [Jane]101-jane 's look .

" Oh , [I]111-garth say , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth cried , boyishly . " Is n't it nice that [they]607-her particular chums have all gone in ? [I]111-garth have been wanting a good jaw with [you]118-miss champion . Really , when [we]2247-we all get together [we]2247-we do drivel sometimes , to keep the ball rolling . It is like patting up air - balls ; and very often they burst , and [one]474-one realises that an empty , shrivelled little skin is all that is left after most conversations . Did [you]118-miss champion ever buy air - balls at [Brighton]10-brighton ? Do [you]118-miss champion remember the wild excitement of seeing [the man coming along [the parade]2250-the parade]2249-the man coming along the parade , with a huge bunch of them blue , green , red , white , and yellow , all shining in the sun ? And [one]474-one used to wonder how [he]111-garth ever contrived to pick them all up [I]111-garth do n't know how ! and what would happen if [he]111-garth put them all down . [I]111-garth always knew exactly which one [I]111-garth wanted , and it was generally on a very inside string and took a long time to disentangle . And how maddening it was if [the grown - ups]2252-the grown - ups grew tired of waiting , and walked on with the penny . Only [I]111-garth would rather have had none , than not have the one on which [I]111-garth had fixed [my]111-garth heart . Would n't [you]118-miss champion ? "[111-garth]

" [I]101-jane never bought air - balls at [Brighton]10-brighton , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane , without enthusiasm . [Garth]111-garth was feeling seven again , and [Jane]101-jane was feeling bored .

For once [he]111-garth seemed conscious of this . [He]111-garth took [his]111-garth coat from the back of the chair where [he]111-garth had hung it , and put it on .

" Come along , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said ; " [I]111-garth am so tired of doing nothing . Let [us]2253-we go down to [the river]315-the river and find [a boat]2255-a boat or two . Dinner is not until eight o'clock , and [I]111-garth am certain [you]118-miss champion can dress , even for the ROLE of [Velma]113-velma , in half an hour . [I]111-garth have known [you]118-miss champion do it in ten minutes , at a pinch . There is ample time for [me]111-garth to row [you]118-miss champion within sight of [the minster]2256-the minster , and [we]2253-we can talk as [we]2253-we go . Ah , fancy ! [the grey old minster with this sunset behind it]2257-the grey old minster with this sunset behind it , and [a field of cowslips in the foreground]2258-a field of cowslips in the foreground ! "[111-garth]

But [Jane]101-jane did not rise .

" [[My]101-jane dear]2068-my dear [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " [you]116-dal would not feel much enthusiasm for the minster or the sunset , after [you]116-dal had pulled [my]101-jane twelve stone odd up [the river]315-the river . [You]116-dal would drop exhausted among the cowslips . Surely [you]116-dal might know by now that [I]101-jane am not the sort of person to be told off to sit in the stern of [a tiny skiff and steer]2261-a tiny skiff and steer . If [I]101-jane am in [a boat]2255-a boat , [I]101-jane like to row ; and if [I]101-jane row , [I]101-jane prefer rowing stroke . But [I]101-jane do not want to row now , because [I]101-jane have been playing golf the whole afternoon . And [you]116-dal know perfectly well it would be no pleasure to [you]116-dal to have to gaze at [me]101-jane all the way up and all the way down [the river]315-the river ; knowing all the time , that [I]101-jane was mentally criticising [your]116-dal stroke and marking the careless way [you]116-dal feathered . "[101-jane]

[Garth]111-garth sat down , lay back in [his]111-garth chair , with [his]111-garth arms behind [his]111-garth sleek dark head , and looked at [her]609-you with [his]111-garth soft shining eyes , just as [he]111-garth had looked at [the duchess]304-the duchess .

" How cross [you]609-you are , [old chap]2264-old chap , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , gently . " What is the matter ? "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane laughed and held out [her]101-jane hand . " Oh , [[you]111-garth dear boy]2265-you dear boy ! [I]101-jane think [you]111-garth have the sweetest temper in [the world]2266-the world . [I]101-jane wo n't be cross any more . The truth is , [I]101-jane hate [[the duchess]304-the duchess 's concerts]2268-the duchess 's concerts , and [I]101-jane do n't like being [the duchess]304-the duchess 's ' surprise - packet . ' "[101-jane]

" [I]111-garth see , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , sympathetically . " But , that being so , why did [you]609-you offer ? "[111-garth]

" Ah , [I]101-jane had to , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [Poor old dear]2270-poor old dear ! [She]304-the duchess so rarely asks [me]101-jane anything , and [her]304-the duchess eyes besought . Do n't [you]111-garth know how [one]474-one longs to have something to do for [some one who belongs to [one]474-one]2272-some one who belongs to one ? [I]101-jane would black [her]304-the duchess boots if [she]304-the duchess wished it . But it is so hard to stay [here]2151-here , week after week , and be kept at arm 's length . This one thing [she]304-the duchess asked of [me]101-jane , and [her]304-the duchess proud old eyes pleaded . Could [I]101-jane refuse ? "[101-jane]

[Garth]111-garth was all sympathy . " No , [dear]2179-dear , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said thoughtfully ; " of course [you]2179-dear could n't . And do n't bother over that silly joke about the ' surprise packet . ' [You]2179-dear see , [you]2179-dear wo n't be that . [I]111-garth have no doubt [you]2179-dear sing vastly better than [most of [them]2276-most of them]2276-most of them , but [they]2276-most of them will not realise it . It takes [a Velma]113-velma to make [such people as these]2277-such people as these sit up . [They]2276-most of them will think THE ROSARY a pretty song , and give [you]2179-dear a mild clap , and there the thing will end . So do n't worry . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane sat and considered this . Then : " [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " [I]101-jane do hate singing before that sort of audience . It is like giving [them]2276-most of them [your]2179-dear soul to look at , and [you]2179-dear do n't want [them]2276-most of them to see it . It seems indecent . To [my]101-jane mind , music is the most REVEALING thing in [the world]2266-the world . [I]101-jane shiver when [I]101-jane think of that song , and yet [I]101-jane dare n't do less than [my]101-jane best . When the moment comes , [I]101-jane shall live in the song , and forget [the audience]2082-the audience . Let [me]101-jane tell [you]2179-dear a lesson [I]101-jane once had from [Madame Blanche]129-madame blanche . [I]101-jane was singing [Bemberg]138-bemberg 's CHANT HINDOU , the passionate prayer of [an Indian woman]2280-an indian woman to [Brahma]139-brahma . [I]101-jane began : ' [BRAHMA]139-brahma ! [DIEU DES CROYANTS]140-dieu des croyants , ' and sang it as [I]101-jane might have sung ' DO , RE , [MI]141-mi . ' [Brahma]139-brahma was nothing to [me]101-jane . ' Stop ! ' cried [Madame Blanche]129-madame blanche in [her]129-madame blanche most imperious manner . ' Ah , vous Anglais ! What are [you]2179-dear doing ? [BRAHMA]139-brahma , c'est un Dieu ! [He]139-brahma may not be [[YOUR]2179-dear God]2281-your god . [He]139-brahma may not be [[MY]101-jane God]2282-my god . But [he]139-brahma is [somebody 's God]2283-somebody 's god . [He]139-brahma is [the God of the song]2284-the god of the song . [Ecoutez]142-ecoutez ! ' And [she]129-madame blanche lifted [her]129-madame blanche head and sang : ' [Brahma]139-brahma ! ' with [her]129-madame blanche beautiful brow illumined , and a passion of religious fervour which thrilled [one]474-one 's soul . It was a lesson [I]101-jane never forgot . [I]101-jane can honestly say [I]101-jane have never sung a song tamely , since . "[101-jane]

" Fine ! "[111-garth] said [Garth Dalmain]111-garth . " [I]111-garth like enthusiasm in every branch of art . [I]111-garth never care to paint a portrait , unless [I]111-garth adore [the woman]400-the woman [I]111-garth am painting . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane smiled . The conversation was turning exactly the way [she]101-jane had hoped eventually to lead it .

" [Dal]116-dal , [dear]2179-dear , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " [you]2179-dear adore so many in turn , that [[we]2290-we old friends]2291-we old friends , who have [your]2179-dear real interest at heart , fear [you]2179-dear will never adore to any definite purpose . "[101-jane]

[Garth]111-garth laughed . " Oh bother ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " Are [you]2179-dear like [all the rest]2292-all the rest ? Do [you]2179-dear also think adoration and admiration must necessarily mean marriage . [I]111-garth should have expected [you]2179-dear to take a saner and more masculine view . "[111-garth]

" [[My]101-jane dear boy]2293-my dear boy , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane , " [[your]2179-dear friends]2294-your friends have decided that [you]2179-dear need [a wife]2295-a wife . "[101-jane]

[Garth]111-garth considered this in silence , [his]111-garth level brows knitted . At last [he]111-garth said : " Beauty is so much a thing of the surface . [I]111-garth see it , and admire it . [I]111-garth desire it , and paint it . When [I]111-garth have painted it , [I]111-garth have made it [my]111-garth own , and somehow [I]111-garth find [I]111-garth have done with it . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane was silent . The last things [she]101-jane wished to discuss were [other women]611-other women 's souls .

" There is just one who seems to [me]111-garth perfect , "[111-garth] continued [Garth]111-garth . " [I]111-garth am to paint [her]403-a woman this autumn . [I]111-garth believe [I]111-garth shall find [her]403-a woman soul as exquisite as [her]403-a woman body . "[111-garth]

" And [she]403-a woman is ? "[101-jane] inquired [Jane]101-jane .

" [Lady Brand]143-lady brand . "[111-garth]

" [Flower]144-flower ! "[101-jane] exclaimed [Jane]101-jane . " Are [YOU]111-garth so taken with [Flower]144-flower ? "[101-jane]

" Ah , [she]144-flower is lovely , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , with reverent enthusiasm . " It positively is not right for [any one]411-any one to be so absolutely flawlessly lovely . " No , [I]101-jane do n't , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane , shortly . " And [I]101-jane do not think [[other people]341-other people 's wives]2306-other people 's wives ought to have that effect upon [you]111-garth . "[101-jane]

" [[My]111-garth dear old chap]2307-my dear old chap , "[111-garth] exclaimed [Garth]111-garth , astonished ; " it has nothing to do with [wives]2308-wives or [no wives]2309-no wives .
