" From memory ? "[101-jane] questioned [Jane]101-jane .

" Yes , [I]101-jane paint a great deal from memory . Give [me]101-jane one look of a certain kind at a face , let [me]101-jane see it at a moment which lets one penetrate beneath the surface , and [I]101-jane can paint that face from memory weeks after . Lots of [my]101-jane best studies have been done that way . Ah , the delight of it ! Beauty the worship of beauty is to [me]101-jane a religion . "[101-jane]

" Rather a godless form of religion , "[101-jane] suggested [Jane]101-jane .

" Ah no , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth reverently . " All true beauty comes from [God]145-god , and leads back to [God]145-god . ' Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above , and cometh down from [the Father of lights]2310-the father of lights . ' [I]111-garth once met [an old freak who said all sickness came from the devil]2311-an old freak who said all sickness came from the devil . But [I]111-garth am , convinced all true beauty is God - given , and that is why the worship of beauty is to [me]111-garth a religion . Nothing bad was ever truly beautiful ; nothing good is ever really ugly . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane smiled as [she]101-jane watched [him]111-garth , lying back in the golden sunlight , [the very personification of manly beauty]612-the very personification of manly beauty . The absolute lack of self - consciousness , either for [himself]111-garth or for [her]101-jane , which allowed [him]111-garth to talk thus to [the plainest woman of [his]111-garth acquaintance]613-the plainest woman of his acquaintance , held a vein of humour which diverted [Jane]101-jane . It appealed to [her]101-jane more than buying coloured air - balls , or screaming because [the duchess]304-the duchess wore a mushroom hat .

" Then are [plain people]605-plain people to be denied [their]605-plain people share of goodness , [Dal]116-dal ? "[101-jane] [she]101-jane asked .

" Plainness is not ugliness , "[111-garth] replied [Garth Dalmain]111-garth simply . " [I]111-garth learned that when quite [a small boy]2121-a small boy . [[My]111-garth mother]2312-my mother took [me]111-garth to hear [a famous preacher]2318-a famous preacher . As [he]2318-a famous preacher sat on the platform during the preliminaries [he]2318-a famous preacher seemed to [me]111-garth quite [the ugliest man [I]111-garth had ever seen]2319-the ugliest man i had ever seen . [He]2318-a famous preacher reminded [me]111-garth of [a grotesque gorilla]2320-a grotesque gorilla , and [I]111-garth dreaded the moment when [he]2318-a famous preacher should rise up and face [us]2321-us and give out a text . It seemed to [me]111-garth there ought to be bars between , and that [we]2321-us should want to throw nuts and oranges . But when [he]2318-a famous preacher rose to speak , [his]2318-a famous preacher face was transfigured . Goodness and inspiration shone from it , making it as the face of [an angel]2322-an angel . [I]111-garth never again thought [him]2318-a famous preacher ugly . The beauty of [his]2318-a famous preacher soul shone through , transfiguring [his]2318-a famous preacher body . [Child]146-child though [I]111-garth was , [I]111-garth could differentiate even then between ugliness and plainness . When [he]2318-a famous preacher sat down at the close of [his]2318-a famous preacher magnificent sermon , [I]111-garth no longer thought [him]2318-a famous preacher a complicated form of chimpanzee . [I]111-garth remembered the divine halo of [his]2318-a famous preacher smile . Of course [his]2318-a famous preacher actual plainness of feature remained . It was not the sort of face [one]474-one could have wanted to live with , or to have day after day opposite to one at table . But then [one]474-one was not called to that sort of discipline , which would have been martyrdom to [me]111-garth . And [he]2318-a famous preacher has always stood to [my]111-garth mind since as a proof of the truth that goodness is never ugly ; and that divine love and aspiration shining through the plainest features may redeem them temporarily into beauty ; and , permanently , into a thing [one]474-one loves to remember . "[111-garth]

" [I]101-jane see , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " It must have often helped [you]2318-a famous preacher to a right view to have realised that so long ago . "[101-jane]

"[101-jane]

[Garth Dalmain]111-garth took out [his]111-garth cigarette case , carefully selected a cigarette , and sat with it between [his]111-garth fingers in absorbed contemplation .

" Smoke , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane .

" Thanks , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . [He]111-garth struck a match and very deliberately lighted [his]111-garth cigarette . As [he]111-garth flung away the vesta the breeze caught it and it fell on [the lawn]306-the lawn , flaming brightly . [Garth]111-garth sprang up and extinguished it , then drew [his]111-garth chair more exactly opposite to [Jane]101-jane 's and lay back , smoking meditatively , and watching the little rings [he]111-garth blew , mount into the cedar branches , expand , fade , and vanish .

[Jane]101-jane was watching [him]111-garth . The varied and characteristic ways in which [[her]101-jane friends]408-her friends lighted and smoked [their]408-her friends cigarettes always interested [Jane]101-jane . There were at least [a dozen young men of whom [she]101-jane could have given the names upon hearing a description of [their]408-her friends method]617-a dozen young men of whom she could have given the names upon hearing a description of their method . Also , [she]101-jane had learned from [Deryck Brand]107-deryck the value of silences in an important conversation , and the art of not weakening a statement by a postscript .

At last [Garth]111-garth spoke .

" [I]111-garth wonder why the smoke is that lovely pale blue as it curls up from the cigarette , and a greyish - white if one blows it out . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane knew it was because it had become impregnated with moisture , but [she]101-jane did not say so , having no desire to contribute [her]101-jane quota of pats to this air - ball , or to encourage the superficial workings of [his]111-garth mind just then . [She]101-jane quietly awaited the response to [her]101-jane appeal to [his]111-garth deeper nature which [she]101-jane felt certain would be forthcoming . Presently it came .

" It is awfully good of [you]101-jane , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , to take the trouble to think all this and to say it to [me]111-garth . May [I]111-garth prove [my]111-garth gratitude by explaining for once where [my]111-garth difficulty lies ? [I]111-garth have scarcely defined it to [myself]111-garth , and yet [I]111-garth believe [I]111-garth can express it to [you]101-jane . "[111-garth] Another long silence . [Garth]111-garth smoked and pondered .

[Jane]101-jane waited . It was a very comprehending , very companionable silence . [Garth]111-garth found [himself]111-garth parodying the last lines of an old sixteenth - century song :

" Then ever pray that heaven may send Such weeds , such chairs , and [such a friend]2334-such a friend . "[111-garth] Either the cigarette , or the chair , or [Jane]101-jane , or perhaps all three combined were producing in [him]111-garth a sublime sense of calm , and rest , and well - being ; an uplifting of spirit which made all good things seem better ; all difficult things , easy ; and all ideals , possible . The silence , like the sunset , was golden ; but at last [he]111-garth broke it .

" [Two women]2335-two women [the only two women who have ever really been in [my]111-garth life form for [me]111-garth a standard below which [I]111-garth can not fall , one , [[my]111-garth mother]2312-my mother , a sacred and ideal memory ; the other , [old Margery Graem]147-margery , [[my]111-garth childhood]2338-my childhood 's friend and [nurse]2339-nurse]2336-the only two women who have ever really been in my life form for me a standard below which i can not fall , one , my mother , a sacred and ideal memory ; the other , old margery graem , my childhood 's friend and nurse , now [[my]111-garth housekeeper]2340-my housekeeper and [general tender and mender]2341-general tender and mender . [Her]147-margery faithful heart and constant remembrance help to keep [me]111-garth true to the ideal of that sweet presence which faded from beside [me]111-garth when [I]111-garth stood on the threshold of manhood . [Margery]147-margery lives at [Castle Gleneesh]12-castle gleneesh . When [I]111-garth return [home]381-home , the sight which first meets [my]111-garth eyes as [the hall]367-the hall door opens is [old Margery]147-margery in [her]147-margery black satin apron , lawn kerchief , and lavender ribbons . [I]111-garth always feel seven then , and [I]111-garth always hug [her]147-margery . [You]2344-you , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , do n't like [me]111-garth when [I]111-garth feel seven ; but [Margery]147-margery does . And yet [I]111-garth shall know [she]147-margery knows the standard , just as [I]111-garth know it ; [I]111-garth shall know [she]147-margery remembers the ideal of gentle , tender , Christian womanhood , just as [I]111-garth remember it ; and [I]111-garth must not , [I]111-garth dare not , fall short . Believe [me]111-garth , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , more than once , when physical attraction has been strong , and [I]111-garth have been tempted in the worship of the outward loveliness to disregard or forget the essentials , the things which are unseen but eternal , then , all unconscious of exercising any such influence , [old Margery]147-margery 's clear eyes look into [mine]111-garth , [old Margery]147-margery 's mittened hand seems to rest upon [my]111-garth coat sleeve , and the voice which has guided [me]111-garth from infancy , says , in gentle astonishment : ` Is this [your]111-garth choice , [Master Garthie]148-master garthie , to fill [[my]111-garth dear lady]2348-my dear lady 's place ? ' No doubt , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , it will seem almost absurd to [you]118-miss champion when [you]118-miss champion think of [our]2349-our set and [our]2349-our sentiments , and the way [we]2349-our racket round that [I]111-garth should sit here on [[the duchess]304-the duchess 's lawn]2351-the duchess 's lawn and confess that [I]111-garth have been held back from proposing marriage to [the women [I]111-garth have most admired]2352-the women i have most admired , because of what would have been [[my]111-garth old nurse]2353-my old nurse 's opinion of [them]2352-the women i have most admired ! But [you]118-miss champion must remember [her]2353-my old nurse opinion is formed by a memory , and that memory is the memory of [[my]111-garth dead mother]2354-my dead mother . Moreover , [Margery]147-margery voices [my]111-garth best self , and expresses [my]111-garth own judgment when it is not blinded by passion or warped by [my]111-garth worship of the beautiful . Not that [Margery]147-margery would disapprove of loveliness ; in fact , [she]147-margery would approve of nothing else for [me]111-garth , [I]111-garth know very well . But [her]147-margery penetration rapidly goes beneath the surface . According to one of [Paul]149-paul 's sublime paradoxes , [she]147-margery looks at the things that are not seen . It seems queer that [I]111-garth can tell [you]118-miss champion all this , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , and really it is the first time [I]111-garth have actually formulated it in [my]111-garth own mind . But [I]111-garth think it so extremely friendly of [you]118-miss champion to have troubled to give [me]111-garth good advice in the matter . "[111-garth]

[Garth Dalmain]111-garth ceased speaking , and the silence which followed suddenly assumed alarming proportions , seeming to [Jane]101-jane like a high fence which [she]101-jane was vainly trying to scale . [She]101-jane found [herself]101-jane mentally rushing hither and thither , seeking a gate or any possible means of egress . And still [she]101-jane was confronted by the difficulty of replying adequately to the totally unexpected . And what added to [her]101-jane dumbness was the fact that [she]101-jane was infinitely touched by [Garth]111-garth 's confession ; and when [Jane]101-jane was deeply moved speech always became difficult . That [this young man]618-this young man adored by all [the girls]619-the girls for [his]618-this young man good looks and delightful manners ; pursued for [his]618-this young man extreme eligibility by [mothers]2240-mothers and [chaperons]621-chaperons ; famous already in the world of art ; flattered , courted , sought after in [society]622-society should calmly admit that [the only woman]623-the only woman really left IN [his]111-garth life was [[his]111-garth old nurse]624-his old nurse , and that [her]623-the only woman opinion and expectations held [him]111-garth back from a worldly , or unwise marriage , touched [Jane]101-jane deeply , even while in [her]101-jane heart [she]101-jane smiled at what [[their]625-their set]626-their set would say could [they]625-their realise the situation . It revealed [Garth]111-garth in a new light ; and suddenly [Jane]101-jane understood [him]111-garth , as [she]101-jane had not understood [him]111-garth before .

And yet the only reply [she]101-jane could bring [herself]101-jane to frame was : " [I]111-garth wish [I]111-garth knew [old Margery]147-margery . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth 's brown eyes flashed with pleasure .

" What grammar ! "[101-jane] laughed [Jane]101-jane . " But [I]101-jane know what [you]111-garth mean , and [I]101-jane am glad [you]111-garth think so highly of [Myra]119-myra . [She]119-myra is [a dear]2377-a dear ! Only do make haste and paint [her]119-myra and get [her]119-myra off [your]111-garth mind , so as to be free for [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister . "[101-jane]

The sun - dial pointed to seven o'clock . The rooks had circled round the elms and dropped contentedly into [their]627-their nests .

" Let [us]2378-we go in , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane , rising . " [I]101-jane am glad [we]2378-we have had this talk , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane added , as [he]628-he walked beside [her]101-jane across [the lawn]306-the lawn .

" Yes , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . " Air - balls were n't in it ! It was a football this time good solid leather . And [we]2378-we each kicked one goal , a tie , [you]111-garth know . For [your]111-garth advice went [home]381-home to [me]111-garth , and [I]111-garth think [my]111-garth reply showed [you]111-garth the true lie of things ; eh , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? "[111-garth]

[He]628-he was feeling seven again ; but [Jane]101-jane saw [him]628-he now through [old Margery]147-margery 's glasses , and it did not annoy [her]101-jane .

" Yes , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , smiling at [him]628-he with [her]101-jane kind , true eyes ; " [we]2380-we will consider it a tie , and surely it will prove a tie to [our]2380-we friendship . Thank [you]111-garth , [Dal]116-dal , for all [you]111-garth have told [me]101-jane . "[101-jane]

Arrived in [[her]101-jane room]630-her room , [Jane]101-jane found [she]101-jane had half an hour to spare before dressing . [She]101-jane took out [her]101-jane diary . [Her]101-jane conversation with [Garth Dalmain]111-garth seemed worth recording , particularly [his]111-garth story of [the preacher whose beauty of soul redeemed the ugliness of]631-the preacher whose beauty of soul redeemed the ugliness of [his]111-garth body . [She]101-jane wrote it down verbatim .

Then [she]101-jane rang for [[her]101-jane maid]632-her maid , and dressed for dinner , and the concert which should follow .

CHAPTER VI

THE VEIL IS LIFTED

" [MISS CHAMPION]118-miss champion ! Oh , here [you]118-miss champion are ! [Your]118-miss champion turn next , please . The last item of the local programme is in course of performance , after which [the duchess]304-the duchess explains [Velma]113-velma 's laryngitis let [us]2382-us hope [she]304-the duchess will not call it ' appendicitis ' and then [I]101-jane usher [you]118-miss champion up . Are [you]118-miss champion ready ? "[101-jane]

[Garth Dalmain]111-garth , as [master of ceremonies]633-master of ceremonies , had sought [Jane Champion]101-jane on [the terrace]312-the terrace , and stood before [her]101-jane in the soft light of the hanging Chinese lanterns . The crimson rambler in [his]111-garth button - hole , and [his]111-garth red silk socks , which matched it , lent an artistic touch of colour to the conventional black and white of [his]111-garth evening clothes .

[Jane]101-jane looked up from the comfortable depths of [her]101-jane wicker chair ; then smiled at [his]111-garth anxious face .

" [I]101-jane am ready , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , and rising , walked beside [him]111-garth . " Has it gone well ? "[101-jane] [she]101-jane asked . " Is it [a good audience]2383-a good audience ? "[101-jane]

" Packed , "[111-garth] replied [Garth]111-garth , " and [the duchess]304-the duchess has enjoyed [herself]304-the duchess . It has been funnier than usual . But now comes the event of the evening . [I]111-garth say , where is [your]111-garth score ? "[111-garth]

" Thanks , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [I]101-jane shall play it from memory . It obviates the bother of turning over . "[101-jane]

[They]635-they passed into [the concert - room]2060-the concert - room and stood behind screens and a curtain , close to the half - dozen steps leading , from the side , up on to [the platform]2165-the platform .

" Oh , hark to [the duchess]304-the duchess ! "[111-garth] whispered [Garth]111-garth . " [[My]111-garth NIECE]2386-my niece , [JANE CHAMPION]101-jane , HAS KINDLY CONSENTED TO STEP INTO THE BREACH ' Which means that [you]111-garth will have to step up on to [that platform]2387-that platform in another half - minute . Really it would be kinder to [you]111-garth if [she]304-the duchess said less about [Velma]113-velma . But never mind ; [they]635-they are prepared to like anything . There ! APPENDICITIS ! [I]111-garth told [you]111-garth so . [Poor Madame Velma]113-velma ! Let [us]635-they hope it wo n't get into the local papers . Oh , goodness ! [She]113-velma is going to enlarge on new - fangled diseases . Well , it gives [us]635-they a moment 's breathing space .... [I]111-garth say , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , [I]111-garth was chaffing this afternoon about sharps and flats . [I]111-garth can play that accompaniment for [you]111-garth if [you]111-garth like . No ? Well , just as [you]111-garth think best . But remember , it takes a lot of voice to make much effect in [this concert - room]2388-this concert - room , and [the place]2081-the place is crowded . Now [the duchess]304-the duchess has done . Come on . Mind the bottom step . Hang it all ! How dark it is behind this curtain ! "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth gave [her]638-her [his]111-garth hand , and [Jane]101-jane mounted the steps and passed into view of [the large audience assembled in [the Overdene concert - room]640-the overdene concert - room]639-the large audience assembled in the overdene concert - room . [Her]101-jane tall figure seemed taller than usual as [she]101-jane walked alone across [the rather high platform]641-the rather high platform . [She]101-jane wore a black evening gown of soft material , with old lace at [her]101-jane bosom and one string of pearls round [her]101-jane neck . When [she]101-jane appeared , [the audience]2082-the audience gazed at [her]101-jane and applauded doubtfully . [Velma]113-velma 's name on the programme had raised great expectations ; and here was [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , who certainly played very nicely , but was not supposed to be able to sing , volunteering to sing [Velma]113-velma 's song . [A more kindly audience]643-a more kindly audience would have cheered [her]101-jane to the echo , voicing [its]643-a more kindly audience generous appreciation of [her]101-jane effort , and sanguine expectation of [her]101-jane success . [This audience]644-this audience expressed [its]644-this audience astonishment , in the dubiousness of its faint applause .

[Jane]101-jane smiled at [them]2082-the audience good - naturedly ; sat down at the piano , a Bechstein grand ; glanced at the festoons of white roses and the cross of crimson ramblers ; then , without further preliminaries , struck the opening chord and commenced to sing .

The deep , perfect voice thrilled through [the room]424-the room .

A sudden breathless hush fell upon [the audience]2082-the audience .

Each syllable penetrated the silence , borne on a tone so tender and so amazingly sweet , that [casual hearts]647-casual hearts stood still and marvelled at [their]647-casual hearts own emotion ; and [those who felt deeply already]648-those who felt deeply already , responded with a yet deeper thrill to the magic of that music .

" The hours [I]650-the listening crowd spent with [thee]2391-thee , [dear heart]2392-dear heart , Are as a string of pearls to [me]650-the listening crowd ; [I]650-the listening crowd count them over , ev'ry one apart , [My]650-the listening crowd rosary , [my]650-the listening crowd rosary . "[650-the listening crowd] Softly , thoughtfully , tenderly , the last two words were breathed into the silence , holding a world of reminiscence [a large - hearted woman]649-a large - hearted woman 's faithful remembrance of tender moments in the past .

[The listening crowd]650-the listening crowd held [its]650-the listening crowd breath . This was not a song . This was the throbbing of a heart ; and it throbbed in tones of such sweetness , that tears started unbidden .

Then the voice , which had rendered the opening lines so quietly , rose in a rapid crescendo of quivering pain .

" Each hour a pearl , each pearl a prayer , To still a heart in absence wrung ; [I]101-jane tell each bead unto the end , and there A cross is hung ! "[101-jane] The last four words were given with a sudden power and passion which electrified the assembly . In the pause which followed , could be heard the tension of feeling produced . But in another moment the quiet voice fell soothingly , expressing a strength of endurance which would fail in no crisis , nor fear to face any depths of pain ; yet gathering to itself a poignancy of sweetness , rendered richer by the discipline of suffering .

" O memories that bless and burn ! O barren gain and bitter loss ! [I]101-jane kiss each bead , and strive at last to learn To kiss the cross ... to kiss the cross . "[101-jane] Only those who have heard [Jane]101-jane sing THE ROSARY can possibly realise how [she]101-jane sang " [I]657-men KISS EACH BEAD . "[657-men] The lingering retrospection in each word ; breathed out a love so womanly , so beautiful , so tender , that [her]101-jane identity was forgotten even by [those in the audience]651-those in the audience who knew [her]101-jane best in the magic of [her]101-jane rendering of the song .

The accompaniment , which opens with a single chord , closes with a single note .

[Jane]101-jane struck it softly , lingeringly ; then rose , turned from the piano , and was leaving [the platform]2165-the platform , when a sudden burst of wild applause broke from [the audience]2082-the audience . [Jane]101-jane hesitated , paused , looked at [[[her]101-jane aunt]543-her aunt 's guests]395-her aunt 's guests as if almost surprised to find [them]395-her aunt 's guests there . Then the slow smile dawned in [her]101-jane eyes and passed to [her]101-jane lips . [She]101-jane stood in the centre of [the platform]2165-the platform for a moment , awkwardly , almost shyly ; then moved on as [men]657-men 's voices began to shout " Encore ! ' core ! "[111-garth] and left [the platform]2165-the platform by the side staircase .

But there , behind the scenes , in the semi - darkness of screens and curtains , a fresh surprise awaited [Jane]101-jane , more startling than the enthusiastic tumult of [[her]101-jane audience]659-her audience .

At the foot of the staircase stood [Garth Dalmain]111-garth . [His]111-garth face was absolutely colourless , and [his]111-garth eyes shone out from it like burning stars . [He]111-garth remained motionless until [she]101-jane stepped from the last stair and stood close to [him]111-garth . Then with a sudden movement [he]111-garth caught [her]101-jane by the shoulders and turned [her]101-jane round .

" Go back ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , and the overmastering need quivering in [his]111-garth voice drew [Jane]101-jane 's eyes to [his]111-garth in mute astonishment . " Go back at once and sing it all over again , note for note , word for word , just as before . Ah , do n't stand here waiting ! Go back now ! Go back at once ! Do n't [you]111-garth know that [you]111-garth MUST ? "[304-the duchess]

[Jane]101-jane looked into those shining eyes . Something [she]101-jane saw in [them]660-them excused the brusque command of [his]111-garth tone . Without a word , [she]101-jane quietly mounted the steps and walked across [the platform]2165-the platform to the piano . [People]533-people were still applauding , and redoubled [their]533-people demonstrations of delight as [she]101-jane appeared ; but [Jane]101-jane took [her]101-jane seat at the instrument without giving [them]533-people a thought .

[She]101-jane was experiencing a very curious and unusual sensation . Never before in [her]101-jane whole life had [she]101-jane obeyed a peremptory command . In [her]101-jane childhood 's days , [Fraulein]102-fraulein and [Miss Jebb]103-miss jebb soon found out that [they]533-people could only obtain [their]533-people desires by means of carefully worded requests , or pathetic appeals to [her]101-jane good feelings and sense of right . An unreasonable order , or a reasonable one unexplained , promptly met with a point - blank refusal . And this characteristic still obtained , though modified by time ; and even [the duchess]304-the duchess , as a rule , said " please "[101-jane] to [Jane]101-jane .

But now [a young man with a white face and blazing eyes]664-a young man with a white face and blazing eyes had unceremoniously swung [her]101-jane round , ordered [her]101-jane up [the stairs]665-the stairs , and commanded [her]101-jane to sing a song over again , note for note , word for word , and [she]101-jane was meekly going to obey .

As [she]101-jane took [her]101-jane seat , [Jane]101-jane suddenly made up [her]101-jane mind not to sing The Rosary again . [She]101-jane had many finer songs in [her]101-jane repertoire . [The audience]2082-the audience expected another . Why should [she]101-jane disappoint those expectations because of the imperious demands of [a very highly excited boy]667-a very highly excited boy ?

[She]101-jane commenced the magnificent prelude to [Handel]153-handel 's " Where'er [you]2393-you walk , "[101-jane] but , as [she]101-jane played it , [her]101-jane sense of truth and justice intervened . [She]101-jane had not come back to sing again at the bidding of [a highly excited boy]668-a highly excited boy , but of [a deeply moved man]669-a deeply moved man ; and [his]669-a deeply moved man emotion was of no ordinary kind . That [Garth Dalmain]111-garth should have been so moved as to forget even momentarily [his]111-garth punctilious courtesy of manner , was the highest possible tribute to [her]101-jane art and to [her]101-jane song . While [she]101-jane played the Handel theme and played it so that a whole orchestra seemed marshalled upon the key - board under those strong , firm finger [she]101-jane suddenly realised , though scarcely understanding it , the MUST of which [Garth]111-garth had spoken , and made up [her]101-jane mind to yield to its necessity . So ; when the opening bars were ended , instead of singing the grand song from [Semele]17-semele [she]101-jane paused for a moment ; struck once more The Rosary 's ; opening chord ; and did as [Garth]111-garth had bidden [her]101-jane to do .

" The hours [I]0-i spent with [thee]2394-thee , [dear heart]2392-dear heart , Are as a string of pearls to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i count them over , ev'ry one apart , [My]0-i rosary , [my]0-i rosary . "[0-i] Each hour a pearl , each pearl a prayer , To still a heart in absence wrung ; [I]0-i tell each bead unto the end , and there A cross is hung ! " O memories that bless and burn ! O barren gain and bitter loss ! [I]111-garth kiss each bead , and strive at last to learn To kiss the cross ... to kiss the cross . "[111-garth] When [Jane]101-jane left [the platform]2165-the platform , [Garth]111-garth was still standing motionless at the foot of the stairs . [His]111-garth face was just as white as before , but [his]111-garth eyes had lost that terrible look of unshed tears , which had sent [her]101-jane back , at [his]111-garth bidding , without a word of question or remonstrance . A wonderful light now shone in [them]671-them ; a light of adoration , which touched [Jane]101-jane 's heart because [she]101-jane had never before seen anything quite like it . [She]101-jane smiled as [she]101-jane came slowly down the steps , and held out both hands to [him]111-garth with an unconscious movement of gracious friendliness . [Garth]111-garth stepped close to the bottom of the staircase and took them in [his]111-garth , while [she]101-jane was still on the step above [him]111-garth .

For a moment [he]111-garth did not speak . Then in a low voice , vibrant with emotion : " [[My]111-garth God]2282-my god ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , " Oh , [[my]101-jane God]2282-my god ! "[101-jane]

" Hush , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane ; " [I]111-garth never like to hear that name spoken lightly , [Dal]116-dal . "[111-garth]

" Spoken lightly ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth exclaimed . " No speaking lightly would be possible for [me]101-jane to - night . ' Every perfect gift is from above . ' When words fail [me]101-jane to speak of the gift , can [you]101-jane wonder if [I]101-jane apostrophise [the Giver]2398-the giver ? "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane looked steadily into [his]111-garth shining eyes , and a smile of pleasure illumined [her]101-jane own . " So [you]111-garth liked [my]111-garth song ? "[111-garth] [she]101-jane said .

" Liked liked [your]111-garth song ? "[111-garth] repeated [Garth]111-garth , a shade of perplexity crossing [his]111-garth face . " [I]101-jane do not know whether [I]101-jane liked [your]111-garth song . "[101-jane]

" Then why this flattering demonstration ? "[111-garth] inquired [Jane]101-jane , laughing .

" Because , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , very low , " [you]111-garth lifted the veil , and [I]101-jane [I]101-jane passed within . "[101-jane]

[He]111-garth was still holding [her]101-jane hands in [his]111-garth ; and , as [he]111-garth spoke the last two words , [he]111-garth turned them gently over and , bending , kissed each palm with an indescribably tender reverence ; then , loosing them , stood on one side , and [Jane]101-jane went out on to [the terrace]312-the terrace alone .

[CHAPTER VII

GARTH]111-garth FINDS [HIS]111-garth ROSARY

[Jane]101-jane spent but a very few minutes in [the drawing - room]673-the drawing - room that evening . The fun in progress there was not to [her]101-jane taste , and the praises heaped upon [herself]101-jane annoyed [her]101-jane . Also [she]101-jane wanted the quiet of [[her]101-jane own room]674-her own room in order to think over that closing episode of the concert , which had taken place between [herself]101-jane and [Garth]111-garth , behind the scenes . [She]101-jane did not feel certain how to take it . [She]101-jane was conscious that it held an element which [she]101-jane could not fathom , and [Garth]111-garth 's last act had awakened in [herself]101-jane feelings which [she]101-jane did not understand . [She]101-jane extremely disliked the way in which [he]111-garth had kissed [her]101-jane hands ; and yet [he]111-garth had put into the action such a passion of reverent worship that it gave [her]101-jane a sense of consecration of being , as it were , set apart to minister always to the hearts of [men]657-men in that perfect gift of melody which should uplift and ennoble . [She]101-jane could not lose the sensation of the impress of [his]111-garth lips upon the palms of [her]101-jane hands . It was as if [he]111-garth had left behind something tangible and abiding . [She]101-jane caught [herself]101-jane looking at them anxiously once or twice , and the third time this happened [she]101-jane determined to go to [[her]101-jane room]630-her room .

[The duchess]304-the duchess was at the piano , completely hidden from view by nearly the whole of [[her]304-the duchess house party]2070-her house party , crowding round in fits of delighted laughter . [Ronnie]117-ronnie had just broken through from the inmost circle to fetch [an antimacassar]679-an antimacassar ; and [Billy]108-billy , to dash to the writing - table for a sheet of note - paper . [Jane]101-jane knew the note - paper meant a clerical dog collar , and [she]101-jane concluded something had been worn which resembled an antimacassar .

[She]101-jane turned rather wearily and moved towards the door . Quiet and unobserved though [her]101-jane retreat had been , [Garth]111-garth was at the door before [her]101-jane . [She]101-jane did not know how [he]111-garth got [there]2228-there ; for , as [she]101-jane turned to leave [the room]424-the room , [she]101-jane had seen [his]111-garth sleek head close to [Myra Ingleby]119-myra 's on the further side of [[the duchess]304-the duchess 's crowd]683-the duchess 's crowd . [He]111-garth opened the door and [Jane]101-jane passed out . [She]101-jane felt equally desirous of saying two things to [him]111-garth , either : " How dared [you]111-garth behave in so unconventional a way ? "[101-jane] or : " Tell [me]101-jane just what [you]111-garth want [me]101-jane to do , and [I]101-jane will do it . "[101-jane]

[She]101-jane said neither .

[Garth]111-garth followed [her]101-jane into [the hall]367-the hall , lighted a candle , and threw the match at [Tommy]100-tommy ; then handed [her]101-jane the silver candlestick . [He]111-garth was looking absurdly happy . [Jane]101-jane felt annoyed with [him]111-garth for parading this gladness , which [she]101-jane had unwittingly caused and in which [she]101-jane had no share . Also [she]101-jane felt [she]101-jane must break this intimate silence . It was saying so much which ought not to be said , since it could not be spoken . [She]101-jane took [her]101-jane candle rather aggressively and turned upon the second step .

" Good - night , [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " And do [you]111-garth know that [you]111-garth are missing the curate ? "[111-garth]

[He]111-garth looked up at [her]101-jane . [His]111-garth eyes shone in the light of [her]101-jane candle .

" No , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [I]101-jane am neither missing nor missed . [I]101-jane was only waiting in [there]2228-there until [you]101-jane went up . [I]101-jane shall not go back . [I]101-jane am going out into [the park]305-the park now to breathe in the refreshing coolness of the night breeze . And [I]101-jane am going to stand under the oaks and tell [my]101-jane beads . [I]101-jane did not know [I]101-jane had a rosary , until to - night , but [I]101-jane have [I]101-jane have ! "[101-jane]

" [I]111-garth should say [you]111-garth have a dozen , "[111-garth] remarked [Jane]101-jane , dryly .

" Then [you]101-jane would be wrong , "[111-garth] replied [Garth]111-garth . " [I]101-jane have just one . But it has many hours . [I]101-jane shall be able to call [them]2401-them all to mind when [I]101-jane get out there alone . [I]101-jane am going to ' count each pearl . ' "[101-jane]

" How about the cross ? "[111-garth] asked [Jane]101-jane .

" [I]111-garth have not reached that yet , "[111-garth] answered [Garth]111-garth . " There is no cross to [my]101-jane rosary . "[101-jane]

" [I]101-jane fear there is a cross to every true rosary , [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane gently , " and [I]111-garth also fear it will go hard with [you]116-dal when [you]116-dal find [yours]116-dal . "[111-garth]

But [Garth]111-garth was confident and unafraid .

" When [I]111-garth find [mine]111-garth , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , " [I]111-garth hope [I]111-garth shall be able to "[111-garth] Involuntarily [Jane]101-jane looked at [her]101-jane hands . [He]111-garth saw the look and smiled , though [he]111-garth had the grace to colour beneath [his]111-garth tan , " to FACE the cross , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said .

[Jane]101-jane turned and began to mount the stairs ; but [Garth]111-garth arrested [her]101-jane with an eager question .

" Just one moment , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ! There is something [I]101-jane want to ask [you]118-miss champion . May [I]101-jane ? Will [you]118-miss champion think [me]101-jane impertinent , presuming , inquisitive ? "[101-jane]

" [I]101-jane have no doubt [I]101-jane shall , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " But [I]111-garth am thinking [you]111-garth all sorts of unusual things to - night ; so three adjectives more or less will not matter much . [You]118-miss champion may ask . "[111-garth]

" [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , have [YOU]111-garth a rosary ? "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane looked at [him]111-garth blankly ; then suddenly understood the drift of [his]111-garth question .

" [[My]101-jane dear boy]2293-my dear boy , NO ! "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " Thank goodness , [I]111-garth have kept clear of ' memories that bless and burn . ' None of these things enter into [my]111-garth rational and well - ordered life , and [I]111-garth have no wish that they should . "[111-garth]

" Then , "[111-garth] deliberated [Garth]111-garth , " how came [you]101-jane to sing THE ROSARY as if each line were [your]101-jane own experience ; each joy or pain a thing long passed , perhaps but [your]101-jane own ? "[101-jane]

" Because , "[101-jane] explained [Jane]101-jane , " [I]111-garth always live in a song when [I]111-garth sing it . Did [I]111-garth not tell [you]111-garth the lesson [I]111-garth learned over the CHANT [HINDOU]155-hindou ? Therefore [I]111-garth had a rosary undoubtedly when [I]111-garth was singing that song to - night . But , apart from that , in the sense [you]111-garth mean , no , thank goodness , [I]111-garth have none . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth mounted two steps , bringing [his]111-garth eyes on a level with the candlestick .

" But IF [you]101-jane cared , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , speaking very low , " that is how [you]101-jane would care ? that is as [you]101-jane would feel ? "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane considered . " Yes , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " IF [I]101-jane cared , [I]101-jane suppose [I]101-jane should care just so , and feel as [I]101-jane felt during those few minutes . "[101-jane]

" Then it was [YOU]101-jane in the song , although the circumstances are not [yours]101-jane ? "[101-jane]

" Yes , [I]101-jane suppose so , "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane replied , " if [we]2403-we can consider [ourselves]2403-we apart from [our]2403-we circumstances . But surely this is rather an unprofitable ' air - ball . ' Goodnight , ' [Master Garthie]148-master garthie ! ' "[685-you]

" [I]101-jane say , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ! Just one thing more . Will [you]101-jane sing for [me]101-jane to - morrow ? Will [you]101-jane come to [the music - room]2404-the music - room and sing all the lovely things [I]101-jane want to hear ? And promise to sing whatever [I]101-jane ask , and [I]101-jane wo n't bother [you]101-jane any more now . "[101-jane]

[He]685-you stood looking up at [her]101-jane , waiting for [her]101-jane promise , with such adoration shining in [his]685-you eyes that [Jane]101-jane was startled and more than a little troubled . Then suddenly it seemed to [her]101-jane that [she]101-jane had found the key , and [she]101-jane hastened to explain it to [herself]101-jane and to [him]685-you .

" Oh , [[you]685-you dear boy]2265-you dear boy ! "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " What [an artist]2406-an artist [you]685-you are ! And how difficult it is for [[us]2407-us commonplace , [matter - of - fact people]2409-matter - of - fact people]2408-us commonplace , matter - of - fact people to understand the artistic temperament . Here [you]685-you go , almost turning [my]101-jane steady old head by [your]685-you rapture over what seemed to [you]685-you perfection of sound which has reached [you]685-you through the ear ; just as , again and again , [you]685-you worship at the shrine of perfection of form , which reaches [you]685-you through the eye . [I]101-jane begin to understand how it is [you]685-you turn the heads of [women]2410-women when [you]685-you paint [them]2410-women . However , [you]685-you are very delightful in [your]685-you delight , and [I]101-jane want to go up to bed . So [I]101-jane promise to sing all [you]685-you want and as much as [you]685-you wish to - morrow . Now keep [your]685-you promise and do n't bother [me]101-jane any more to - night . Do n't spend the whole night in [the park]305-the park , and try not to frighten the deer . No , [I]101-jane do not need any assistance with [my]101-jane candle , and [I]101-jane am quite used to going [upstairs]2412-upstairs by [myself]101-jane , thank [you]685-you . Ca n't [you]685-you hear what personal and appropriate remarks [Tommy]100-tommy is making down there ? Now do run away , [Master Garthie]148-master garthie , and count [your]685-you pearls . And if [you]685-you suddenly come upon a cross remember , the cross can , in all probability , be persuaded to return to [Chicago]14-chicago ! "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane was still smiling as [she]101-jane entered [[her]101-jane room]630-her room and placed [her]101-jane candlestick on the dressing - table .

Overdene was lighted solely by lamps and candles . [The duchess]304-the duchess refused to modernise [it]688-it by the installation of electric light . But candles abounded , and [Jane]101-jane , who liked a brilliant illumination , proceeded to light both candles in the branches on either side of the dressing - table mirror , and in the sconces on the wall beside the mantelpiece , and in the tall silver candlesticks upon the writing - table . Then [she]101-jane seated [herself]101-jane in a comfortable arm - chair , reached for [her]101-jane writing - case , took out [her]101-jane diary and a fountain pen , and prepared to finish the day 's entry . [She]101-jane wrote , " SANG ' THE ROSARY ' AT [AUNT ' GINA]18-aunt ' gina 'S CONCERT IN [PLACE OF VELMA]19-place of velma , FAILED LARYNGITIS , "[101-jane] and came to a full stop .

Somehow the scene with [Garth]111-garth was difficult to record , and the sensations which still remained therefrom , absolutely unwritable . [Jane]101-jane sat and pondered the situation , content to allow the page to remain blank .

Before [she]101-jane rose , locked [her]101-jane book , and prepared for rest , [she]101-jane had , to [her]101-jane own satisfaction , clearly explained the whole thing . [Garth]111-garth 's artistic temperament was the basis of the argument ; and , alas , the artistic temperament is not a very firm foundation , either for a theory , or for the fabric of a destiny . However , [FAUTE DE MIEUX]156-faute de mieux , [Jane]101-jane had to accept it as main factor in [her]101-jane mental adjustment , thus : This vibrant emotion in [Garth]111-garth , so strangely disturbing to [her]101-jane own solid calm , was in no sense personal to [herself]101-jane , excepting in so far as [her]101-jane voice and musical gifts were concerned . Just as the sight of paintable beauty crazed [him]111-garth with delight , making [him]111-garth wild with alternate hope and despair until [he]111-garth obtained [his]111-garth wish and had [his]111-garth canvas and [[his]111-garth sitter]689-his sitter arranged to [his]111-garth liking ; so now , [his]111-garth passion for the beautiful had been awakened , this time through the medium , not of sight , but of sound . When [she]101-jane had given [him]111-garth [his]111-garth fill of song , and allowed [him]111-garth to play some of [her]101-jane accompaniments , [he]111-garth would be content , and that disquieting look of adoration would pass from those beautiful brown eyes . Meanwhile it was pleasant to look forward to to - morrow , though it behooved [her]101-jane to remember that all this admiration had in it nothing personal to [herself]101-jane . [He]111-garth would have gone into even greater raptures over [Madame Blanche]129-madame blanche , for instance , who had the same timbre of voice and method of singing , combined with a beauty of person which delighted the eye the while [her]129-madame blanche voice enchanted the ear . Certainly [Garth]111-garth must see and hear [her]101-jane , as music appeared to mean so much to [him]111-garth . [Jane]101-jane began planning this , and then [her]101-jane mind turned to [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister , [the lovely American girl , whose name had been coupled with [Garth Dalmain]111-garth 's all the season]690-the lovely american girl , whose name had been coupled with garth dalmain 's all the season . [Jane]101-jane felt certain [she]101-jane was just [the wife [he]111-garth needed]691-the wife he needed . [Her]101-jane loveliness would content [him]111-garth , [her]101-jane shrewd common - sense and straightforward , practical ways would counterbalance [his]111-garth somewhat erratic temperament , and [her]101-jane adaptability would enable [her]101-jane to suit [herself]101-jane to [his]111-garth surroundings , both in [[his]111-garth northern home]692-his northern home and amongst [[his]111-garth large circle of [friends]2139-friends [down south]695-down south]693-his large circle of friends down south . Once married , [he]111-garth would give up raving about [Flower]144-flower and [Myra]119-myra , and kissing [people]533-people 's hands in that " absurd way , "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane was going to say , but [she]101-jane was invariably truthful , even in [her]101-jane thoughts , and substituted " extraordinary "[101-jane] as the more correct adjective in that extraordinary way .

[She]101-jane sat forward in [her]101-jane chair with [her]101-jane elbows on [her]101-jane knees , and held [her]101-jane large hands before [her]101-jane , palms upward , realising again the sensations of that moment . Then [she]101-jane pulled [herself]101-jane up sharply . " [Jane Champion]101-jane , do n't be [a fool]2236-a fool ! [You]101-jane would wrong [that dear , beauty - loving boy]2414-that dear , beauty - loving boy , more than [you]101-jane would wrong [yourself]101-jane , if [you]101-jane took [him]2414-that dear , beauty - loving boy for one moment seriously . [His]2414-that dear , beauty - loving boy homage to - night was no more personal to [you]101-jane than [his]2414-that dear , beauty - loving boy appreciation of the excellent dinner was personal to [[Aunt Georgina]157-aunt georgina 's chef]2415-aunt georgina 's chef . Be gratified at the success of [your]101-jane art , and do not spoil that success by any absurd sentimentality . Now wash [your]101-jane very ungainly hands and go to bed . "[697-his] Thus [Jane]101-jane to [herself]101-jane .

And under the oaks , with soft turf beneath [his]697-his feet , stood [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , the shy deer sleeping around unconscious of [his]697-his presence ; the planets above , hanging like lamps in the deep purple of the sky . And [he]697-his , also , soliloquised .

" [I]697-his have found [her]101-jane , "[697-his] [he]697-his said , in low tones of rapture , " [the ideal woman]2417-the ideal woman , the crown of womanhood , the perfect mate for the spirit , soul , and body of [the man who can win [her]101-jane]2418-the man who can win her . [Jane]101-jane ! [Jane]101-jane ! Ah , how blind [I]101-jane have been ! To have known [her]101-jane for years , and yet not realised [her]101-jane to be this . But [she]101-jane lifted the veil , and [I]101-jane passed in . [Ah grand , noble heart]2419-ah grand , noble heart ! [She]101-jane will never be able to draw the veil again between [her]101-jane soul and [mine]101-jane . And [she]101-jane has no rosary . [I]101-jane thank [God]145-god for that . [No other man]2420-no other man possesses , or has ever possessed , that which [I]101-jane desire more than [I]101-jane ever desired anything upon [this earth]2421-this earth , [Jane]101-jane 's love , [Jane]101-jane 's tenderness . But one thing [I]101-jane know : whereas [I]101-jane was blind , now [I]101-jane see . And it will always be [Jane]101-jane from this night onward through time and - please God into eternity . "[101-jane]

The night breeze stirred [his]698-his thick dark hair , and [his]698-his eyes , as [he]698-his raised them , shone in the starlight .

And [Jane]101-jane , almost asleep , was roused by the tapping of [her]101-jane blind against the casement , and murmured " Anything [you]698-his wish , [Garth]111-garth , just tell [me]101-jane , and [I]101-jane will do it . "[101-jane] Then awakening suddenly to the consciousness of what [she]101-jane had said , [she]101-jane sat up in the darkness and scolded [herself]101-jane furiously . CHAPTER VIII

ADDED PEARLS

The days which followed were golden days to [Jane]101-jane . There was nothing to spoil the enjoyment of a very new and strangely sweet experience .

[Garth]111-garth 's manner the next morning held none of the excitement or outward demonstration which had perplexed and troubled [her]101-jane the evening before . [He]111-garth was very quiet , and seemed to [Jane]101-jane older than [she]101-jane had ever known [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth had very few lapses into [his]111-garth seven - year - old mood , even with [the duchess]304-the duchess ; and when [someone]509-someone chaffingly asked [him]111-garth whether [he]111-garth was practising the correct deportment of [a soon - to - be - married man]701-a soon - to - be - married man ,

" Yes , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth quietly , " [I]117-ronnie am . "[117-ronnie]

" Will [she]304-the duchess be at [Shenstone]16-shenstone ? "[111-garth] inquired [Ronald]117-ronnie ; for [several of [the duchess]304-the duchess 's party]702-several of the duchess 's party were due at [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby 's for the following week - end .

" Yes , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , ' [she]304-the duchess will . "[108-billy]

" Oh , lor ' ! "[108-billy] cried [Billy]108-billy , dramatically . " [Prithee]158-prithee , [Benedict]159-benedict , are [we]2428-we to take this seriously ? "[101-jane]

But [Jane]101-jane who , wrapped in the morning paper , sat near where [Garth]111-garth was standing , came out from behind it to look up at [him]111-garth and say , so that only [he]111-garth heard it " Oh , [Dal]116-dal , [I]111-garth am so glad ! Did [you]116-dal make up [your]116-dal mind last night ? "[111-garth]

" Yes , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , turning so that [he]111-garth spoke to [her]101-jane alone , " last night . "[101-jane]

" Did [our]704-our talk in the afternoon have something to do with it ? "[111-garth]

" No , nothing whatever . "[101-jane]

" Was it THE ROSARY ? "[111-garth]

[He]111-garth hesitated ; then said , without looking at [her]101-jane : " The revelation of THE ROSARY ? Yes . "[710-they]

To [Jane]101-jane [his]111-garth mood of excitement was now fully explained , and [she]101-jane could give [herself]101-jane up freely to the enjoyment of this new phase in [their]704-our friendship , for the hours of music together were a very real delight . [Garth]111-garth was more of [a musician]705-a musician than [she]101-jane had known , and [she]101-jane enjoyed [his]111-garth clean , masculine touch on the piano , unblurred by slur or pedal ; more delicate than [her]101-jane own , where delicacy was required . What [her]101-jane voice was to [him]111-garth during those wonderful hours [he]111-garth did not express in words , for after that first evening [he]111-garth put a firm restraint upon [his]111-garth speech . Under the oaks [he]111-garth had made up [his]111-garth mind to wait a week before speaking , and [he]111-garth waited .

But the new and strangely sweet experience to [Jane]101-jane was that of being absolutely first to some one . In ways known only to [himself]111-garth and to [her]101-jane Garth made [her]101-jane feel this . There was nothing for [any one else]706-any one else to notice , and yet [she]101-jane knew perfectly well that [she]101-jane never came into [the room]424-the room without [his]111-garth being instantly conscious that [she]101-jane was there ; that [she]101-jane never left [a room]708-a room , without being at once missed by [him]111-garth . [His]111-garth attentions were so unobtrusive and tactful that [no one else]709-no one else realised them . [They]710-they called forth no chaff from [friends]2139-friends and no " Hoity - toity ! What now ? "[726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene] from [the duchess]304-the duchess . And yet [his]111-garth devotion seemed always surrounding [her]101-jane . For the first time in [her]101-jane life [Jane]101-jane was made to feel [herself]101-jane FIRST in the whole thought of another . It made [him]111-garth seem strangely [her]101-jane own . [She]101-jane took a pleasure and pride in all [he]111-garth said , and did , and was ; and in the hours [they]713-they spent together in [the music - room]2404-the music - room [she]101-jane learned to know [him]111-garth and to understand that enthusiastic beauty - loving , irresponsible nature , as [she]101-jane had never understood it before .

The days were golden , and the parting at night was sweet , because it gave an added zest to the pleasure of meeting in the morning . And yet during these golden days the thought of love , in the ordinary sense of the word , never entered [Jane]101-jane 's mind . [Her]101-jane ignorance in this matter arose , not so much from inexperience , as from too large an experience of the travesty of the real thing ; an experience which hindered [her]101-jane from recognising love [itself]715-itself , now that love in its most ideal form was drawing near .

[Jane]101-jane had not come through a dozen seasons without receiving nearly a dozen proposals of marriage . [An heiress]716-an heiress , independent of [parents]441-parents and [guardians , of good blood and lineage]718-guardians , of good blood and lineage , a few proposals of a certain type were inevitable . [Middle - aged men]719-middle - aged men becoming bald and grey ; tired of racketing about [town]364-town ; with [beautiful old country places]721-beautiful old country places and an unfortunate lack of the wherewithal to keep [them]719-middle - aged men up proposed to [the Honourable Jane Champion]101-jane in a business - like way , and [the Honourable Jane]101-jane looked [them]719-middle - aged men up and down , and through and through , until [they]719-middle - aged men felt very cheap , and then quietly refused [them]719-middle - aged men , in an equally business - like way .

[Two or three nice boys]722-two or three nice boys , whom [she]101-jane had pulled out of scrapes and set on [their]722-two or three nice boys feet again after hopeless croppers , had thought , in a wave of maudlin gratitude , how good it would be for [a fellow]2053-a fellow always to have [her]101-jane at hand to keep [him]2053-a fellow straight and tell [him]2053-a fellow what [he]2053-a fellow ought to do , do n't [you]724-you know ? and er well , yes pay [his]2053-a fellow debts , and be [a sort of mother - who - doesn't scold kind of person to [him]2053-a fellow]725-a sort of mother - who - doesn't scold kind of person to him ; and had caught hold of [her]101-jane kind hand , and implored [her]101-jane to marry [them]722-two or three nice boys . [Jane]101-jane had slapped [them]722-two or three nice boys if [they]722-two or three nice boys ventured to touch [her]101-jane , and recommended [them]722-two or three nice boys not to be silly .

One solemn proposal [she]101-jane had had quite lately from [the bachelor rector of [a parish adjoining [Overdene]1-overdene]727-a parish adjoining overdene]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene . [He]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene had often inflicted wearisome conversations upon [her]101-jane ; and when [he]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene called , intending to put the momentous question , [Jane]101-jane , who was sitting at [her]101-jane writing - table in [the Overdene drawing - room]728-the overdene drawing - room , did not see any occasion to move from [it]729-it . If [the rector]359-the rector became too prosy , [she]101-jane could surreptitiously finish a few notes . [He]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene sank into a deep arm - chair close to the writing - table , crossed [his]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene somewhat bandy legs one over the other , made the tips of [his]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene fingers meet with unctuous accuracy , and intoned the opening sentences of [his]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene proposition . [Jane]101-jane , sharpening pencils and sorting nibs , apparently only caught the drift of what [he]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene was saying , for when [he]726-the bachelor rector of a parish adjoining overdene had chanted the phrase , " Not alone from selfish motives , [[my]101-jane dear]2068-my dear [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ; but for the good of [[my]101-jane parish]2430-my parish ; for the welfare of [[my]101-jane flock]2431-my flock , for the advancement of the work of [the church]2432-the church in [our]2433-our midst , "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane opened a despatch - box and drew out [her]101-jane cheque - book .

" [I]101-jane shall be delighted to subscribe , [Mr. Bilberry]160-mr. bilberry , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " Is it for a font , a pulpit , new hymn - books , or what ? "[359-the rector]

" [[My]359-the rector dear lady]2348-my dear lady , "[359-the rector] said [the rector]359-the rector tremulously , " [you]2348-my dear lady misunderstand [me]101-jane . [My]101-jane desire is to lead [you]2348-my dear lady to the altar . "[101-jane]

" [Dear Mr. Bilberry]160-mr. bilberry , "[101-jane] said [Jane Champion]101-jane , " that would be quite unnecessary . From any part of [[your]160-mr. bilberry church]2435-your church the fact that [you]160-mr. bilberry need a new altar - cloth is absolutely patent to [all comers]2436-all comers . [I]101-jane will , with the greatest pleasure , give [you]160-mr. bilberry a cheque for ten pounds towards it . [I]101-jane have attended [[your]160-mr. bilberry church]2435-your church rather often lately because [I]101-jane enjoy a long , quiet walk by [myself]101-jane through [the woods]2438-the woods . And now [I]101-jane am sure [you]160-mr. bilberry would like to see [[my]101-jane aunt]2102-my aunt before [you]160-mr. bilberry go . [She]2102-my aunt is in the aviary , feeding [her]2102-my aunt foreign birds . If [you]160-mr. bilberry go out by that window and pass along [the terrace]312-the terrace to [your]160-mr. bilberry left , [you]160-mr. bilberry will find the aviary and [the duchess]304-the duchess . [I]101-jane would suggest the advisability of not mentioning this conversation to [[my]101-jane aunt]2102-my aunt . [She]2102-my aunt does not approve of elaborate altar - cloths , and would scold [us]2443-us both , and insist on the money being spent in providing boots for [the school children]2444-the school children . No , please do not thank [me]101-jane . [I]101-jane am really glad of an opportunity of helping on [your]160-mr. bilberry excellent work in [this neighbourhood]2445-this neighbourhood . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane wondered once or twice whether the cheque would be cashed . [She]101-jane would have liked to receive it back by post , torn in half ; with a few wrathful lines of manly indignation . But when it returned to [her]101-jane in due course from [her]101-jane bankers , it was indorsed [P. BILBERRY]161-p. bilberry , in a neat scholarly hand , without even a dash of indignation beneath it ; and [she]101-jane threw it into the waste - paper basket , with rather a bitter smile .

These were [Jane]101-jane 's experiences of offers of marriage . [She]101-jane had never been loved for [her]101-jane own sake ; [she]101-jane had never felt [herself]101-jane really first in the heart and life of another . And now , when the adoring love of [a man]575-a man 's whole being was tenderly , cautiously beginning to surround and envelop [her]101-jane , [she]101-jane did not recognise the reason of [her]101-jane happiness or of [his]575-a man devotion . [She]101-jane considered [him]575-a man [the avowed lover of [another woman]734-another woman , with whose youth and loveliness [she]101-jane would not have dreamed of competing]733-the avowed lover of another woman , with whose youth and loveliness she would not have dreamed of competing ; and [she]101-jane regarded this closeness of intimacy between [herself]101-jane and [Garth]111-garth as a development of a friendship more beautiful than [she]101-jane had hitherto considered possible .

Thus matters stood when Tuesday arrived and the Overdene party broke up . [Jane]101-jane went to [town]364-town to spend a couple of days with [the Brands]736-the brands . [Garth]111-garth went straight to [Shenstone]16-shenstone , where [he]111-garth had been asked expressly to meet [Miss Lister]151-miss lister and [[her]151-miss lister aunt]543-her aunt , [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs . [Jane]101-jane was due at [Shenstone]16-shenstone on Friday for the week - end .

CHAPTER IX

[LADY INGLEBY]112-lady ingleby 'S HOUSE PARTY

As [Jane]101-jane took [her]101-jane seat and [the train]738-the train moved out of the [London]6-london terminus [she]101-jane leaned back in [her]101-jane corner with a sigh of satisfaction . Somehow these days in [town]364-town had seemed insufferably long . [Jane]101-jane reviewed them thoughtfully , and sought the reason . [They]740-they had been filled with interests and engagements ; and the very fact of being in [town]364-town , as a rule , contented [her]101-jane . Why had [she]101-jane felt so restless and dissatisfied and lonely ?

From force of habit [she]101-jane had just stopped at [the railway book - stall]742-the railway book - stall for [her]101-jane usual pile of literature . [[Her]101-jane friends]408-her friends always said [Jane]101-jane could not go even the shortest journey without at least half a dozen papers . But now [they]740-they lay unheeded on the seat in front of [her]101-jane . [Jane]101-jane was considering [her]101-jane Tuesday , Wednesday , and Thursday , and wondering why [they]740-they had merely been weary stepping - stones to Friday . And here was Friday at last , and once in [the train]738-the train en route for [Shenstone]16-shenstone , [she]101-jane began to feel happy and exhilarated . What had been the matter with these three days ? [Flower]144-flower had been charming ; [Deryck]107-deryck , [his]107-deryck own friendly , interesting self ; [little Dicky]162-dicky , delightful ; and [Baby Blossom]163-baby blossom , as sweet as only [Baby Blossom]163-baby blossom could be . What was amiss ?

" [I]101-jane know , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " Of course ! Why did [I]101-jane not realise it before ? [I]101-jane had too much music during those last days at [Overdene]1-overdene ; and SUCH music ! With a happy little smile of pleasurable anticipation , [Jane]101-jane took up [the SPECTATOR]745-the spectator , and was soon absorbed in an article on the South African problem .

[Myra]119-myra met [her]101-jane at [the station]746-the station , driving ponies tandem . [The fields]752-the fields and woods were an exquisite restful green in the afternoon sunshine . Wild roses clustered in the hedges . The last loads of hay were being carted in . There was an ecstasy in the songs of the birds and a transporting sense of sweetness about all the sights and scents of [the country]753-the country , such as [Jane]101-jane had never experienced so vividly before . [She]101-jane drew a deep breath and exclaimed , almost involuntarily : " Ah ! it is good to be here ! "[112-lady ingleby]

" [[You]101-jane dear]2447-you dear ! " Play up , [Dal]116-dal ! "[111-garth] cried a voice , amid the general hubbub .

[Garth]111-garth knew that dear voice . [He]111-garth did not look in its direction , but [he]111-garth smiled . The next moment [his]111-garth arm shot out like a flash of lightning . [They]785-their walked off the ground together , [their]785-their rackets under [their]785-their arms , the flush of a well - contested fight on [their]785-their handsome faces . It had been so near a thing that [both]786-both could sense the thrill of victory .

[Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister had been sitting with [Garth]111-garth 's coat on [her]152-pauline lister lap , and [his]111-garth watch and chain were in [her]152-pauline lister keeping . [He]111-garth paused a moment to take [them]787-them up and receive [her]152-pauline lister congratulations ; then , slipping on [his]111-garth coat , and pocketing [his]111-garth watch , came straight to [Jane]101-jane .

" How do [you]101-jane do , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? "[101-jane]

[His]111-garth eyes sought [hers]101-jane eagerly ; and the welcoming gladness [he]111-garth saw in them filled [him]111-garth with certainty and content . [He]111-garth had missed [her]101-jane so unutterably during these days . Tuesday , Wednesday , and Thursday had just been weary stepping - stones to Friday . It seemed incredible that [one person]788-one person 's absence could make so vast a difference . And yet how perfect that it should be so ; and that [they]789-they should both realise it , now the day had come when [he]111-garth intended to tell [her]101-jane how desperately [he]111-garth wanted [her]101-jane always . Yes , that [they]789-they should BOTH realise it for [he]111-garth felt certain [Jane]101-jane had also experienced the blank . A thing so complete and overwhelming as the miss of [her]101-jane had been to [him]111-garth could not be one - sided . And how well worth the experience of these lonely days if [they]789-they had thereby learned something of what TOGETHER meant , now the words were to be spoken which should insure forever no more such partings .

All this sped through [Garth]111-garth 's mind as [he]111-garth greeted [Jane]101-jane with that most commonplace of English greetings , the everlasting question which never receives an answer . But from [Garth]111-garth , at that moment , it did not sound commonplace to [Jane]101-jane , and [she]101-jane answered it quite frankly and fully . [She]101-jane wanted above all things to tell [him]111-garth exactly how [she]101-jane did ; to hear all about [himself]111-garth , and compare notes on the happenings of these three interminable days ; and to take up [their]789-they close comradeship again , exactly where it had left off . [Her]101-jane hand went home to [his]111-garth with that firm completeness of clasp , which always made a hand shake with [Jane]101-jane such a satisfactory and really friendly thing .

" Very fit , thank [you]111-garth , [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane answered . " At least [I]111-garth am every moment improving in health and spirits , now [I]111-garth have arrived [here]2151-here at last . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth stood [his]111-garth racket against the arm of [her]101-jane chair and deposited [himself]111-garth full length on the grass beside [her]101-jane , leaning on [his]111-garth elbow .

" Was anything wrong with [London]6-london ? "[101-jane] [he]111-garth asked , rather low , not looking up at [her]101-jane , but at the smart brown shoe , planted firmly on the grass so near [his]111-garth hand . " Nothing was wrong with [London]6-london , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane frankly ; " it was hot and dusty of course , but delightful as usual . Something was wrong with [ME]124-mrs. parker bangs ; and [you]111-garth will be ashamed of [me]124-mrs. parker bangs , [Dal]116-dal , if [I]124-mrs. parker bangs confess what it was . "[124-mrs. parker bangs]

[Garth]111-garth did not look up , but assiduously picked little blades of grass and laid them in a pattern on [Jane]101-jane 's shoe . This conversation would have been exactly to the point had [they]790-they been alone . But was [Jane]101-jane really going to announce to [the assembled company]791-the assembled company , in that dear , resonant , carrying voice of [hers]101-jane , the sweet secret of [their]790-they miss of one another ?

" [Liver]170-liver ? "[108-billy] inquired [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs suddenly .

" Muffins ! "[101-jane] exclaimed [Billy]108-billy instantly , and , rushing for [them]792-them , almost shot them into [her]101-jane lap in the haste with which [he]111-garth handed [them]792-them , stumbling headlong over [Garth]111-garth 's legs at the same moment .

[Jane]101-jane stared at [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs and [her]124-mrs. parker bangs muffins ; then looked down at the top of [Garth]111-garth 's dark head , bent low over the grass .

" [I]101-jane was dull , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " intolerably dull . And [Dal]116-dal always says ' only a dullard is dull . ' But [I]101-jane diagnosed [my]101-jane dulness in [the train]738-the train just now and found it was largely [his]116-dal fault . Do [you]116-dal hear , [Dal]116-dal ? "[101-jane]

[Garth]111-garth lifted [his]111-garth head and looked at [her]101-jane , realising in that moment that it was , after all , possible for a complete and overwhelming experience to be one - sided . [Jane]101-jane 's calm grey eyes were full of gay friendliness .

" It was [your]111-garth fault , [[my]111-garth dear boy]2293-my dear boy , "[111-garth] said [Jane]101-jane .

" How so ? "[111-garth] queried [Garth]111-garth ; and though there was a deep flush on [his]111-garth sunburned face , [his]111-garth voice was quietly interrogative .

" Because , during those last days at [Overdene]1-overdene , [you]101-jane led [me]119-myra on into a time of musical dissipation such as [I]119-myra had never known before , and [I]119-myra missed it to a degree which was positively alarming . [I]119-myra began to fear for the balance of [my]119-myra well - ordered mind . "[119-myra]

" Well , "[119-myra] said [Myra]119-myra , coming out from behind [her]119-myra red parasol , " [you]101-jane and [Dal]116-dal can have orgies of music here if [you]101-jane want them . [You]101-jane will find a piano in [the drawing - room]673-the drawing - room and another in [the hall]367-the hall , and a Bechstein grand in [the billiard - room]2512-the billiard - room . That is where [I]101-jane hold the practices for [the men]516-the men and [maids]584-maids . [I]101-jane could not make up [my]101-jane mind which makers [I]101-jane really preferred , [Erard]171-erard , [Broadwood]172-broadwood , [Collard]173-collard , or [Bechstein]174-bechstein ; so by degrees [I]101-jane collected one of each . " Thank [you]101-jane , [Myra]119-myra , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane . " [I]112-lady ingleby fancy [Dal]116-dal and [I]112-lady ingleby will like [the Bechstein]174-bechstein . "[112-lady ingleby]

" And if [you]101-jane want something really exciting in the way of music , "[112-lady ingleby] continued [Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby , " [you]101-jane might attend some of the rehearsals for this ' service of song ' [they]2519-they are getting up in aid of the organ deficit fund . [I]101-jane believe [they]2519-they are attempting great things . "[101-jane]

" [I]111-garth would sooner pay off the whole deficit , than go within a mile of a ' service of song , ' "[111-garth] said [Jane]101-jane emphatically .

" Oh , no , "[119-myra] put in [Garth]111-garth quickly , noting [Myra]119-myra 's look of disappointment . " It is so good for [people]533-people to work off [their]533-people own debts and earn the things [they]533-people need in [[their]533-people churches]2521-their churches . And ' services of song ' are delightful if well done , as [I]101-jane am sure this will be if [[Lady Ingleby]112-lady ingleby 's people]2522-lady ingleby 's people are in it . " Shall [I]101-jane ? " [Pauline]152-pauline lister will just love to go with [you]793-you , "[124-mrs. parker bangs] said [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs . " [She]152-pauline lister dotes on rural music . "[151-miss lister]

" Rubbish , [aunt]2166-aunt ! "[151-miss lister] said [Miss Lister]151-miss lister , who had slipped into an empty chair near [Myra]119-myra . " [I]101-jane agree with [Miss Champion]118-miss champion about ' services of song , ' and [I]101-jane do n't care for any music but the best . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane turned to [her]793-you quickly , with a cordial smile and [her]101-jane most friendly manner . " Ah , but [you]793-you must come , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " [We]2527-we will be victimised together . And perhaps [Dal]116-dal and [Lawson]165-lawson will succeed in converting [us]2527-we to the cult of the ' service of song . " Talking of something ' really exciting in the way of music , ' "[152-pauline lister] said [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister , " [we]2527-we had it on board when [we]2527-we came over . There was [a nice friendly crowd]2528-a nice friendly crowd on board [the Arabic]2529-the arabic , and [they]2528-a nice friendly crowd arranged a concert for half - past eight on the Thursday evening . [We]2527-we were about two hundred miles off [the coast of [Ireland]22-ireland]2530-the coast of ireland , and when [we]2527-we came up from dinner [we]2527-we had run into a dense fog . At eight o'clock [they]2528-a nice friendly crowd started blowing the fog - horn every half - minute , and while the fog - horn was sounding [you]2531-you could n't hear [yourself]2531-you speak . However , all the programmes were printed , and it was [our]2527-we last night on board , so [they]2528-a nice friendly crowd concluded to have the concert all the same . Down [we]2527-we all trooped into [the saloon]2532-the saloon , and each item of that programme was punctuated by the stentorian BOO of the fog - horn every thirty seconds . [You]2531-you never heard anything so cute as the way it came in , right on time . [A man with a deep bass voice]2533-a man with a deep bass voice sang ROCKED IN THE CRADLE OF [THE DEEP]23-the deep , and each time [he]2533-a man with a deep bass voice reached the refrain , ' And calm and peaceful is [my]111-garth sle - eep , ' [BOO]177-boo went the fog - horn , casting a certain amount of doubt on [our]2527-we expectations of peaceful sleep that night , anyway . Then [a man with a sweet tenor]2534-a man with a sweet tenor sang OFT IN THE STILLY NIGHT , and [the fog - horn]2535-the fog - horn showed [us]2527-we just how oft , namely , every thirty seconds . But the queerest effect of all was when [a girl]437-a girl had to play a piano - forte solo . It was something of [Chopin]178-chopin 's , full of runs and trills and little silvery notes . [She]437-a girl started all right ; but when [she]437-a girl was half - way down the first page , [BOO]177-boo went the fog - horn , a longer blast than usual . [We]2527-we saw [her]437-a girl fingers flying , and the turning of the page , but not a note could [we]2527-we hear ; and when the old horn stopped and [we]2527-we could hear the piano again , [she]437-a girl had reached a place half - way down the second page , and [we]2527-we had n't heard what led to it . [My]111-garth ! it was funny . That went on all through . [She]437-a girl was [a plucky girl to stick to it]2537-a plucky girl to stick to it . [We]2527-we gave [her]437-a girl a good round of applause when [she]437-a girl had finished , and [the fog - horn]2535-the fog - horn joined in and drowned [us]2527-we . It was the queerest concert experience [I]111-garth ever had . But [we]2527-we all enjoyed it . Only [we]2527-we did n't enjoy that noise keeping right on until five o'clock next morning . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane had turned in [her]101-jane chair , and listened with appreciative interest while [the lovely American girl]794-the lovely american girl talked , watching , with real delight , [her]794-the lovely american girl exquisite face and graceful gestures , and thinking how [Dal]116-dal must enjoy looking at [her]794-the lovely american girl when [she]794-the lovely american girl talked with so much charm and animation . [She]101-jane glanced down , trying to see the admiration in [his]116-dal eyes ; but [his]116-dal head was bent , and [he]116-dal was apparently absorbed in the occupation of tracing the broguing of [her]101-jane shoes with the long stalk of a chestnut leaf . For a moment [she]101-jane watched [the slim brown hand , as carefully intent on this useless task]795-the slim brown hand , as carefully intent on this useless task , as if working on a canvas ; then [she]101-jane suddenly withdrew [her]101-jane foot , feeling almost vexed with [him]116-dal for [his]116-dal inattention and apparent indifference .

[Garth]111-garth sat up instantly . " It must have been awfully funny , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " And how well [you]101-jane told it . [One]474-one could hear the fog - horn , and see the dismayed faces of [the performers]2540-the performers . Like an earthquake , a fog - horn is the sort of thing [you]2541-you do n't ever get used to . It sounds worse every time . Let 's each tell the funniest thing [we]2542-we remember at a concert . [I]111-garth once heard [a youth]2543-a youth recite [Tennyson]122-tennyson 's Charge of the Light Brigade with much dramatic action . But [he]116-dal was extremely nervous , and got rather mixed . In describing the attitude of mind of [the noble six hundred]2544-the noble six hundred , [he]116-dal told [us]2542-we impressively that it was "[111-garth]

" ' [Theirs]2544-the noble six hundred not to make reply ; [Theirs]2544-the noble six hundred not to do or die ; [Theirs]2544-the noble six hundred BUT TO REASON WHY . ' "[111-garth] " The tone and action were all right , and [I]117-ronnie doubt whether [many of [the audience]2082-the audience]2545-many of the audience noticed anything wrong with the words . "[117-ronnie]
