[Jane]101-jane sat on [her]101-jane window - sill , enjoying the sunset and the exquisite view , and glad of a quiet half - hour before [she]101-jane need think of summoning [[her]101-jane maid]632-her maid . Immediately below [her]101-jane ran [the terrace]312-the terrace , wide and gravelled , bounded by a broad stone parapet , behind which was a drop of eight or ten feet to [the old - fashioned garden]806-the old - fashioned garden , with quaint box - bordered flower - beds , winding walks , and stone fountains . Beyond , a stretch of smooth lawn sloping down to [the lake]2458-the lake , which now lay , a silver mirror , in the soft evening light . The stillness was so perfect ; the sense of peace , so all - pervading . [Jane]101-jane held a book on [her]101-jane knee , but [she]101-jane was not reading . [She]101-jane was looking away to [the distant woods]808-the distant woods beyond [the lake]2458-the lake ; then to the pearly sky above , flecked with rosy clouds and streaked with gleams of gold ; and a sense of content , and gladness , and well - being , filled [her]101-jane .

Presently [she]101-jane heard a light step on the gravel below and leaned forward to see to whom it belonged . [Garth]111-garth had come out of [the smoking - room]468-the smoking - room and walked briskly to and fro , once or twice . Then [he]111-garth threw [himself]111-garth into a wicker seat just beneath [her]101-jane window , and sat there , smoking meditatively . The fragrance of [his]111-garth cigarette reached [Jane]101-jane , up among the magnolia blossoms . " ' Zenith , ' [Marcovitch]181-marcovitch , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said to [herself]101-jane , and smiled . " Packed in jolly green boxes , twelve shillings a hundred ! [I]111-garth must remember in case [I]111-garth want to give [him]111-garth a Christmas present . By then it will be difficult to find anything which has not already been showered upon [him]111-garth . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth flung away the end of [his]111-garth cigarette , and commenced humming below [his]111-garth breath ; then gradually broke into words and sang softly , in [his]111-garth sweet barytone :

" ' It is not [mine]111-garth to sing the stately grace , [The great soul]2561-the great soul beaming in [[my]111-garth lady]2562-my lady 's face . ' "[111-garth] The tones , though quiet , were so vibrant with passionate feeling , that [Jane]101-jane felt [herself]101-jane an eavesdropper . [She]101-jane hastily picked a large magnolia leaf and , leaning out , let it fall upon [his]111-garth head . [Garth]111-garth started , and looked up . " Hullo ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [YOU]101-jane up there ? "[101-jane]

" Yes , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane , laughing down at [him]111-garth , and speaking low lest other casements should be open , " [I]111-garth up here . [You]111-garth are serenading the wrong window , [[dear]2179-dear ' devout lover]2564-dear ' devout lover . ' "[111-garth]

" What a lot [you]101-jane know about it , "[101-jane] remarked [Garth]111-garth , rather moodily .

" Do n't [I]101-jane ? "[101-jane] whispered [Jane]101-jane . " But [you]111-garth must not mind , [Master Garthie]148-master garthie , because [you]111-garth know how truly [I]111-garth care . In [old Margery]147-margery 's absence , [you]111-garth must let [me]111-garth be [mentor]2565-mentor . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth sprang up and stood erect , looking up at [her]101-jane , half - amused , half - defiant .

" Shall [I]111-garth climb the magnolia ? "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [I]101-jane have heaps to say to [you]101-jane which can not be shouted to the whole front of [the house]309-the house . "[101-jane]

" Certainly not , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane . " [I]111-garth do n't want [any Romeos]2567-any romeos coming in at [my]111-garth window . ' Hoity - toity ! What next ? ' as [Aunt]2568-aunt ' [Gina]126-gina would say . Run along and change [your]111-garth pinafore , [Master Garthie]148-master garthie . " All right , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , " all right . But [you]101-jane will come out here this evening , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? And [you]101-jane will give [me]101-jane as long as [I]101-jane want ? "[101-jane]

" [I]101-jane will come as soon as [we]2569-we can possibly escape , "[101-jane] replied [Jane]101-jane ; " and [you]111-garth can not be more anxious to tell [me]101-jane everything than [I]101-jane am to hear it . Oh ! the scent of these magnolias ! And just look at the great white trumpets ! Would [you]101-jane like one for [your]101-jane buttonhole ? "[101-jane]

[He]111-garth gave [her]101-jane a wistful , whimsical little smile ; then turned and went indoors .

" Why do [I]101-jane feel so inclined to tease [him]111-garth ? "[101-jane] mused [Jane]101-jane , as [she]101-jane moved , from the window . " Really it is [I]101-jane who have been silly this time ; and [he]111-garth , staid and sensible . [Myra]119-myra is quite right . [He]111-garth is taking it very seriously . And how about [her]119-myra ? Ah ! [I]101-jane hope [she]119-myra cares enough , and in the right way . Come in , [Matthews]105-sarah ! And [you]101-jane can put out the gown [I]101-jane wore on the night of the concert at [Overdene]1-overdene , and [we]2570-we must make haste . [We]2570-we have just twenty minutes . What a lovely evening ! Before [you]101-jane do anything else , come and see this sunset on [the lake]2458-the lake . Ah ! it is good to be [here]2151-here ! "[101-jane]

CHAPTER X

THE REVELATION

All the impatience in [the world]2266-the world could not prevent dinner at [Shenstone]16-shenstone from being a long function , and [two of the most popular people in the party]812-two of the most popular people in the party could not easily escape afterwards unnoticed . So a distant clock in [the village]758-the village was striking ten , as [Garth]111-garth and [Jane]101-jane stepped out on to [the terrace]312-the terrace together . [Garth]111-garth caught up a rug in passing , and closed the door of [the lower hall]512-the lower hall carefully behind [him]111-garth .

[They]816-they were quite alone . It was the first time [they]816-they had been really alone since these days apart , which had seemed so long to [both]786-both .

[They]816-they walked silently , side by side , to the wide stone parapet overlooking [the old - fashioned garden]806-the old - fashioned garden . The silvery moonlight flooded the whole scene with radiance . [They]816-they could see the stiff box - borders , the winding paths , the queerly shaped flower - beds , and , beyond , [the lake]2458-the lake , like a silver mirror , reflecting the calm loveliness of the full moon .

[Garth]111-garth spread the rug on the coping , and [Jane]101-jane sat down . [He]111-garth stood beside [her]101-jane , one foot on the coping , [his]111-garth arms folded across [his]111-garth chest , [his]111-garth head erect . [Jane]101-jane had seated [herself]101-jane sideways , turning towards [him]111-garth , [her]101-jane back to an old stone lion mounting guard upon the parapet ; but [she]101-jane turned [her]101-jane head still further , to look down upon [the lake]2458-the lake , and [she]101-jane thought [Garth]111-garth was looking in the same direction .

But [Garth]111-garth was looking at [Jane]101-jane .

[She]101-jane wore the gown of soft trailing black material [she]101-jane had worn at the Overdene concert , only [she]101-jane had not on the pearls or , indeed , any ornament save a cluster of crimson rambler roses . They nestled in the soft , creamy old lace which covered the bosom of [her]101-jane gown . There was a quiet strength and nobility about [her]101-jane attitude which thrilled the soul of [the man who stood watching [her]101-jane]821-the man who stood watching her . All the adoring love , the passion of worship , which filled [his]111-garth heart , rose to [his]111-garth eyes and shone there . No need to conceal it now . [His]111-garth hour had come at last , and [he]111-garth had nothing to hide from [the woman [he]111-garth loved]822-the woman he loved .

Presently [she]101-jane turned , wondering why [he]111-garth did not begin [his]111-garth confidences about [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister . Looking up inquiringly , [she]101-jane met [his]111-garth eyes .

" [Dal]116-dal ! "[101-jane] cried [Jane]101-jane , and half rose from [her]101-jane seat . " Oh , [Dal]116-dal , do n't ! "[111-garth]

[He]111-garth gently pressed [her]101-jane back . " Hush , [dear]2179-dear , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [I]824-i must tell [you]2179-dear everything , and [you]2179-dear have promised to listen , and to advise and help . Ah , [Jane]101-jane , [Jane]101-jane ! [I]824-i shall need [your]2179-dear help . [I]824-i want it so greatly , and not only [your]2179-dear help , [Jane]101-jane but [YOU]2179-dear [you]2179-dear , [yourself]2179-dear . Ah , how [I]824-i want [you]2179-dear ! These three days have been one continual ache of loneliness , because [you]2179-dear were not [there]2228-there ; and life began to live and move again , when [you]2179-dear returned . And yet it has been so hard , waiting all these hours to speak . [I]824-i have so much to tell [you]2179-dear , [Jane]101-jane , of all [you]2179-dear are to [me]824-i all [you]2179-dear have become to [me]824-i , since the night of the concert . Ah , how can [I]824-i express it ? [I]824-i have never had any big things in [my]824-i life ; all has been more or less trivial on the surface . This need of [you]2179-dear this wanting [you]2179-dear is so huge . It dwarfs all that went before ; it would overwhelm all that is to come , were it not that it will be the throne , the crown , the summit , of the future . Oh , [Jane]101-jane ! [I]824-i have admired [so many women]2575-so many women . [I]824-i have raved about [them]2575-so many women , sighed for [them]2575-so many women , painted [them]2575-so many women , and forgotten [them]2575-so many women . But [I]824-i never LOVED [a woman]403-a woman before ; [I]824-i never knew what womanhood meant to [a man]575-a man , until [I]824-i heard [your]824-i voice thrill through the stillness ' [I]824-i count each pearl . ' Ah , [beloved]2578-beloved , [I]824-i have learned to count pearls since then , precious hours in the past , long forgotten , now remembered , and at last understood . ' Each hour a pearl , each pearl a prayer , ' ay , a passionate plea that past and present may blend together into a perfect rosary , and that the future may hold no possibility of pain or parting . Oh , [Jane Jane]2579-jane jane ! Shall [I]824-i ever be able to make [you]2579-jane jane understand all how much Oh , [JANE]101-jane ! "[824-i]

[She]823-her was not sure just when [he]824-i had come so near ; but [he]824-i had dropped on one knee in front of [her]823-her , and , as [he]824-i uttered the last broken sentences , [he]824-i passed both [his]824-i arms around [her]823-her waist and pressed [his]824-i face into the soft lace at [her]823-her bosom . A sudden quietness came over [him]824-i . All struggling with explanations seemed hushed into the silence of complete comprehension an all - pervading , enveloping silence .

[Jane]101-jane neither moved nor spoke . It was so strangely sweet to have [him]824-i there this whirlwind of emotion come home to rest , in a great stillness , just above [her]101-jane quiet heart . Suddenly [she]101-jane realised that the blank of the last three days had not been the miss of the music , but [the miss of [HIM]824-i]825-the miss of him ; and as [she]101-jane realised this , [she]101-jane unconsciously put [her]101-jane arms about [him]824-i . Sensations unknown to [her]101-jane before , awoke and moved within [her]101-jane , a heavenly sense of aloofness from [the world]2266-the world , the loneliness of life all swept away by this dear fact just [he]824-i and [she]101-jane together . [Even]827-even as [she]101-jane thought it , felt it , [he]824-i lifted [his]824-i head , still holding [her]101-jane , and looking into [her]101-jane face , said : " [You]101-jane and [I]824-i together , [my]824-i own [my]824-i own . "[824-i]

But those beautiful shining eyes were more than [Jane]101-jane could bear . The sense of [her]101-jane plainness smote [her]101-jane , even in that moment ; and those adoring eyes seemed lights that revealed it . With no thought in [her]101-jane mind but to hide the outward part from [him]824-i who had suddenly come so close to the shrine within , [she]101-jane quickly put both hands behind [his]824-i head and pressed [his]824-i face down again , into the lace at [her]101-jane bosom . But , to [him]824-i , those dear firm hands holding [him]824-i close , by that sudden movement , seemed an acceptance of [himself]824-i and of all [he]824-i had to offer . For ten , twenty , thirty exquisite seconds , [his]824-i soul throbbed in silence and rapture beyond words . Then [he]824-i broke from the pressure of those restraining hands ; lifted [his]824-i head , and looked into [her]101-jane face once more .

" [[My]101-jane wife]2580-my wife ! "[101-jane] [he]824-i said .

Into [Jane]101-jane 's honest face came a look of startled wonder ; then a deep flush , seeming to draw all the blood , which had throbbed so strangely through [her]101-jane heart , into [her]101-jane cheeks , making them burn , and [her]101-jane heart die within [her]101-jane . [She]101-jane disengaged [herself]101-jane from [his]824-i hold , rose , and stood looking away to where the still waters of [the lake]2458-the lake gleamed silver in the moonlight .

[Garth Dalmain]111-garth stood beside [her]101-jane . [He]111-garth did not touch [her]101-jane , nor did [he]111-garth speak again . [He]111-garth felt sure [he]111-garth had won ; and [his]111-garth whole soul was filled with a gladness unspeakable . [His]111-garth spirit was content . The intense silence seemed more expressive than words . Any ordinary touch would have dimmed the sense of those moments when [her]101-jane hands had held [him]824-i to [her]101-jane . So [he]111-garth stood quite still and waited .

At last [Jane]101-jane spoke . " Do [you]111-garth mean that [you]111-garth wish to ask [me]111-garth to be to be THAT to [you]111-garth ? "[111-garth]

" Yes , [dear]2179-dear , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth answered , gently ; but in [his]111-garth voice vibrated the quiet of strong self - control . " At least [I]101-jane came out here intending to ask it of [you]2179-dear . But [I]101-jane can not ask it now , [beloved]2578-beloved . [I]101-jane ca n't ask [you]2179-dear TO BE what [you]2179-dear ARE already . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane slowly turned and looked at [him]111-garth . [She]101-jane had never seen anything so radiant as [his]111-garth face . But still those shining eyes smote [her]101-jane like swords . [She]101-jane longed to cover them with [her]101-jane hands ; or bid [him]111-garth look away over [the woods]2438-the woods and water , while [he]111-garth went on saying these sweet things to [her]101-jane . [She]101-jane put up one foot on the low parapet , leaned [her]101-jane elbow on [her]101-jane knee , and shielded [her]101-jane face with [her]101-jane hand . Then [she]101-jane answered [him]111-garth , trying to speak calmly .

" [You]111-garth have taken [me]101-jane absolutely by surprise , [Dal]116-dal . [I]101-jane knew [you]111-garth had been delightfully nice and attentive since the concert evening , and that [our]2584-our mutual understanding of music and pleasure in it , coupled with an increased intimacy brought about by [our]2584-our confidential conversation under the cedar , had resulted in an unusually close and delightful friendship . [I]101-jane honestly admit it seems to have it has meant more to [me]101-jane than any friendship has ever meant . But that was partly owing to [your]111-garth temperament , [Dal]116-dal , which tends to make [you]111-garth always the most vivid spot in one 's mental landscape . "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane paused .

" Well ? "[101-jane] said the quiet voice , with its deep undertone of gladness . " [You]111-garth know otherwise now . "[101-jane]

" [Dal]116-dal [you]111-garth have so startled and astonished [me]830-me . [I]830-me can not give [you]111-garth an answer to - night . [You]111-garth must let [me]830-me have until to - morrow to - morrow morning . "[830-me]

" But , [beloved]2578-beloved , "[830-me] [he]830-me said tenderly , moving a little nearer , " there is no more need for [you]2578-beloved to answer than [I]101-jane felt need to put a question . But [Jane]101-jane stood rigid .

" No , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . " [I]111-garth ca n't allow [you]830-me to take things for granted in this way . [You]111-garth took [me]111-garth by surprise , and [I]111-garth lost [my]111-garth head utterly unpardonably , [I]111-garth admit . But , [[my]111-garth dear boy]2293-my dear boy , marriage is a serious thing . Marriage is not a mere question of sentiment . It has to wear . It has to last . It must have a solid and dependable foundation , to stand the test and strain of daily life together . [I]111-garth know [so many married couples]2589-so many married couples intimately . [I]111-garth stay in [[their]2589-so many married couples homes]2590-their homes , and act sponsor to [[their]2589-so many married couples children]2591-their children ; with the result that [I]111-garth vowed never to risk it [myself]111-garth . And now [I]111-garth have let [you]832-you put this question , and [you]832-you must not wonder if [I]111-garth ask for twelve hours to think it over . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth took this silently . [He]111-garth sat down on the stone coping with [his]111-garth back to [the lake]2458-the lake and , leaning backward , tried to see [her]832-you face ; but the hand completely screened it . [He]111-garth crossed [his]111-garth knees and clasped both hands around them , rocking slightly backward and forward for a minute while mastering the impulse to speak or act violently . [He]111-garth strove to compose [his]111-garth mind by fixing it upon trivial details which chanced to catch [his]111-garth eye . [His]111-garth red socks showed clearly in the moonlight against the white paving of [the terrace]312-the terrace , and looked well with black patent - leather shoes . [He]111-garth resolved always to wear red silk socks in the evening , and wondered whether [Jane]101-jane would knit some for [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth counted the windows along the front of [the house]309-the house , noting which were [his]111-garth and which were [Jane]101-jane 's , and how many came between . At last [he]111-garth knew [he]111-garth could trust [himself]111-garth , and , leaning back , spoke very gently , [his]111-garth dark head almost touching the lace of [her]101-jane sleeve .

" Dearest tell [me]101-jane , did n't [you]101-jane feel just now "[101-jane]

Tears never came easily to [Jane]101-jane . But to - night [she]835-she had been called a name by which [she]835-she had never thought to be called ; and already [her]835-she honest heart was telling [her]835-she [she]835-she would never be called by it again . And large silent tears overflowed and fell upon [her]835-she hands and upon the lace at [her]835-she breast . For [the wife]837-the wife and [the mother in [her]835-she]838-the mother in her had been wakened and stirred , and the deeps of [her]835-she nature broke through the barriers of stern repression and almost masculine self - control , and refused to be driven back without the womanly tribute of tears .

And around [her]835-she feet lay the scattered petals of crushed rambler roses .

Presently [she]835-she passed [indoors]839-indoors . [The upper hall]840-the upper hall was filled with merry groups and resounded with " good - nights "[111-garth] as [the women]841-the women mounted the great staircase , pausing to fling back final repartees , or to confirm plans for the morrow .

[Garth Dalmain]111-garth was standing at the foot of the staircase , held in conversation by [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister and [[her]152-pauline lister aunt]543-her aunt , who had turned on the fourth step . [Garth]111-garth stood on one side , and [Jane]101-jane began to mount the stairs . [Jane]101-jane suddenly flushed crimson , and then was furious with [herself]101-jane for blushing , and hated the circumstances which made [her]101-jane feel and act so unlike [her]101-jane ordinary self . [Garth]111-garth was on the step below [them]854-them , handing [[Pauline]152-pauline lister 's aunt]855-pauline 's aunt a letter [she]855-pauline 's aunt had dropped .

" Good - night , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion , "[124-mrs. parker bangs] [he]111-garth said , and for one instant [his]111-garth eyes met [hers]101-jane , but [he]111-garth did not hold out [his]111-garth hand , or appear to see [hers]101-jane half extended .

[The three women]856-the three women mounted the staircase together , then went different ways . [Miss Lister]151-miss lister trailed away down [a passage to the right]857-a passage to the right , [[her]151-miss lister aunt]543-her aunt trotting in [her]151-miss lister wake .

" There 's been a tiff there , "[151-miss lister] said [Mrs. Parker Bangs]124-mrs. parker bangs .

" [Poor thing]2623-poor thing ! "[151-miss lister] said [Miss Lister]151-miss lister softly . " [I]543-her aunt like [her]2623-poor thing . [She]2623-poor thing 's [a real good sort]2624-a real good sort . [I]543-her aunt should have thought [she]2623-poor thing would have been more sensible than the rest of [us]856-the three women . "[543-her aunt]

" [A real plain sort]2625-a real plain sort , "[151-miss lister] said [[her]151-miss lister aunt]543-her aunt , ignoring the last sentence .

" Well , [she]2623-poor thing did n't make [her]2623-poor thing own face , "[151-miss lister] said [Miss Lister]151-miss lister generously .

" No , and [she]2623-poor thing do n't pay [other people]341-other people to make it for [her]2623-poor thing . [She]2623-poor thing 's what [Sir Walter Scott]185-sir walter scott calls : ' Nature in all its ruggedness . ' "[151-miss lister]

" [Dear aunt]2140-dear aunt , "[151-miss lister] remarked [Miss Lister]151-miss lister wearily , " [I]152-pauline lister wish [you]2140-dear aunt would n't trouble to quote the English classics to [me]152-pauline lister when [we]856-the three women are alone . It is pure waste of breath , because [you]2140-dear aunt see [I]152-pauline lister KNOW [you]2140-dear aunt have read them all . Here is [my]152-pauline lister door . Now come right in and make [yourself]2140-dear aunt comfy on that couch . [I]152-pauline lister am going to sit in this palatial arm - chair opposite , and do a little very needful explaining . [My]152-pauline lister ! How [they]2628-they fix one to the floor ! [These ancestral castles]2629-these ancestral castles are all right so far as they go , but [they]2629-these ancestral castles do n't know a thing about [rockers]2630-rockers . Now [I]152-pauline lister have a word or two to say about [Miss Champion]118-miss champion . [She]118-miss champion 's [a real good sort]2624-a real good sort , and [I]152-pauline lister like [her]118-miss champion . [She]118-miss champion 's not [a beauty]2632-a beauty ; but [she]118-miss champion has a fine figure , and [she]118-miss champion dresses right . [She]118-miss champion has heaps of money , and could have rarer pearls than [mine]152-pauline lister ; but [she]118-miss champion knows better than to put pearls on that brown skin . [I]152-pauline lister like [a woman who knows [her]118-miss champion limitations and is sensible over them]2633-a woman who knows her limitations and is sensible over them . All [the men]516-the men adore [her]118-miss champion , not for what [she]118-miss champion looks but for what [she]118-miss champion is , and , [my]152-pauline lister word , [aunt]2166-aunt , that 's what pays in the long run . That is what lasts . Ten years hence [the Honourable Jane]101-jane will still be what [she]101-jane is , and [I]152-pauline lister shall be trying to look what [I]152-pauline lister 'm not . As for [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , [he]111-garth has eyes for all of [us]2636-us and a heart for none . [His]111-garth pretty speeches and admiring looks do n't mean marriage , because [he]111-garth is [a man with an ideal of womanhood]2637-a man with an ideal of womanhood and [he]111-garth ca n't see [himself]111-garth marrying below it . If [the Sistine Madonna]186-the sistine madonna could step down off those clouds and hand [the infant]2638-the infant to [the young woman on [her]186-the sistine madonna left]2639-the young woman on her left , [he]111-garth might marry [HER]2639-the young woman on her left ; but even then [he]111-garth would be afraid [he]111-garth might see [some one]503-some one next day who did [her]2639-the young woman on her left hair more becomingly , or that [her]2639-the young woman on her left foot would not look so well on [his]111-garth Persian rugs as it does on that cloud . [He]111-garth wo n't marry money , because [he]111-garth has plenty of it . And even if [he]111-garth had n't , money made in candles would not appeal to [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth wo n't marry beauty , because [he]111-garth thinks too much about it . [He]111-garth adores so many lovely faces , that [he]111-garth is never sure for twenty - four hours which of [them]2641-them [he]111-garth admires most , bar the fact that , as in the case of fruit trees , the unattainable are usually the most desired . [He]111-garth wo n't marry goodness virtue worth whatever [you]2642-you choose to call the sterling qualities of character because in all these [the Honourable Jane Champion]101-jane is [his]111-garth ideal , and [she]101-jane is too sensible [a woman]403-a woman to tie such an epicure to [her]101-jane plain face . Besides , [she]101-jane considers [herself]101-jane [[his]111-garth grandmother]2644-his grandmother , and does n't require [him]111-garth to teach [her]101-jane to suck eggs . But [Garth Dalmain]111-garth , [poor boy]2645-poor boy , is so sublimely lacking in self - consciousness that [he]111-garth never questions whether [he]111-garth can win [his]111-garth ideal . [He]111-garth possesses [her]101-jane already in [his]111-garth soul , and it will be a fearful smack in the face when [she]101-jane says ' No , ' as [she]101-jane assuredly will do , for reasons aforesaid . These three days , while [he]111-garth has been playing around with [me]152-pauline lister , and [you]2646-you and [other dear match - making old donkeys]2647-other dear match - making old donkeys have gambolled about [us]2648-us , and made sure [we]2648-us were falling in love , [he]111-garth has been worshipping the ground [she]101-jane walks on , and counting the hours until [he]111-garth should see [her]101-jane walk on it again . [He]111-garth enjoyed being with [me]152-pauline lister more than with [the other girls]2649-the other girls , because [I]152-pauline lister understood , and helped [him]111-garth to work all conversations round to [her]101-jane , and [he]111-garth knew , when [she]101-jane arrived [here]2151-here , [I]152-pauline lister could be trusted to develop sudden anxiety about [you]2646-you , or have important letters to write , if [she]101-jane came in sight . But that is all there will ever be between [me]152-pauline lister and [Garth Dalmain]111-garth ; and if [you]2646-you had a really careful regard for [my]152-pauline lister young affections [you]2646-you would drop [your]2646-you false set on the marble wash - stand , or devise some other equally false excuse for [our]2651-our immediate departure for [town]364-town to - morrow . And now , [dear]2179-dear , do n't stay to argue ; because [I]152-pauline lister have said exactly all there is to say on the subject , and a little more . And try to toddle to bed without telling [me]152-pauline lister of which cute character in [Dickens]187-dickens [I]152-pauline lister remind [you]2646-you , because [I]152-pauline lister am cuter than any of [them]2654-them , and if [I]152-pauline lister stay in this tight frock another second [I]152-pauline lister ca n't answer for the consequences . Oui , [Josephine]188-josephine , entrez ! Good - night , [dear aunt]2140-dear aunt . Happy dreams ! "[152-pauline lister]

But after [[her]860-her maid]632-her maid had left [her]860-her , [Pauline]152-pauline lister switched off the electric light and , drawing back the curtain , stood for a long while at [her]152-pauline lister window , looking out at the peaceful English scene bathed in moonlight . At last [she]152-pauline lister murmured softly , leaning [her]152-pauline lister beautiful head against the window frame :

" [I]101-jane stated [your]2179-dear case well , but [you]2179-dear did n't quite deserve it , [Dal]116-dal . [You]2179-dear ought to have let [me]101-jane know about [Jane]101-jane , weeks ago . Anyway , it will stop the talk about [you]2179-dear and [me]101-jane . And as for [you]2179-dear , [dear]2179-dear , [you]2179-dear will go on sighing for the moon ; and when [you]2179-dear find the moon is unattainable , [you]2179-dear will not dream of seeking solace in more earthly lights not even [poppa]2657-poppa 's best sperm , "[101-jane] [she]152-pauline lister added , with a wistful little smile , for [Pauline]152-pauline lister 's fun sparkled in solitude as freely as in company , and as often at [her]152-pauline lister own expense as at that of [other people]341-other people , and [her]152-pauline lister brave American spirit would not admit , even to [herself]152-pauline lister , a serious hurt .

Meanwhile [Jane]101-jane had turned to the left and passed slowly to [[her]101-jane room]630-her room . [Garth]111-garth had not taken [her]101-jane half - proffered hand , and [she]101-jane knew perfectly well why . [He]111-garth would never again be content to clasp [her]101-jane hand in friendship . If [she]101-jane cut [him]111-garth off from the touch which meant absolute possession , [she]101-jane cut [herself]101-jane off from the contact of simple comradeship . [Garth]111-garth , to - night , was like [a royal tiger who had tasted blood]864-a royal tiger who had tasted blood . It seemed a queer simile , as [she]101-jane thought of [him]111-garth in [his]111-garth conventional evening clothes , correct in every line , well - groomed , smart almost to a fault . But out on [the terrace]312-the terrace with [him]111-garth [she]101-jane had realised , for the first time , the primal elements which go to the making of [a man]575-a man [a forceful determined , ruling man creation 's king]867-a forceful determined , ruling man creation 's king . [They]868-they echo of [primeval forests]869-primeval forests . The roar of the lion is in them , the fierceness of the tiger ; the instinct of dominant possession , which says : " [Mine]101-jane to have and hold , to fight for and enjoy ; and [I]101-jane slay [all comers]2436-all comers ! "[101-jane] [She]101-jane had felt it , and [her]101-jane own brave soul had understood it and responded to it , unafraid ; and been ready to mate with it , if only ah ! if only

But things could never be again as they had been before . If [she]101-jane meant to starve [her]101-jane tiger , steel bars must be between them for evermore . None of those sentimental suggestions of attempts to be a sort of unsatisfactory cross between [sister]802-sister and [friend]871-friend would do for [the man whose head [she]101-jane had unconsciously held against [her]101-jane breast]872-the man whose head she had unconsciously held against her breast . [Jane]101-jane knew this . [He]111-garth had kept [himself]111-garth magnificently in hand after [she]101-jane put [him]111-garth from [her]101-jane , but [she]101-jane knew [he]111-garth was only giving [her]101-jane breathing space . [He]111-garth still considered [her]101-jane [his]111-garth own , and [his]111-garth very certainty of the near future had given [him]111-garth that gentle patience in the present . But even now , while [her]101-jane answer pended , [he]111-garth would not take [her]101-jane hand in friendship . [Jane]101-jane closed [her]101-jane door and locked it . [She]101-jane must face this problem of the future , with all else locked out excepting [herself]101-jane and [him]111-garth . Ah ! if [she]101-jane could but lock [herself]101-jane out and think only of [him]111-garth and of [his]111-garth love , as beautiful , perfect gifts laid at [her]101-jane feet , that [she]101-jane might draw them up into [her]101-jane empty arms and clasp [them]873-them there for evermore . Just for a little while [she]101-jane would do this . One hour of realisation was [her]101-jane right . Afterwards [she]101-jane must bring [HERSELF]101-jane into the problem , [her]101-jane possibilities ; [her]101-jane limitations ; [herself]101-jane , in [her]101-jane relation to [him]111-garth in the future ; in the effect marriage with [her]101-jane would be likely to have upon [him]111-garth . What it might mean to [her]101-jane did not consciously enter into [her]101-jane calculations . [Jane]101-jane was self - conscious , with the intense self - consciousness of all reserved natures , but [she]101-jane was not selfish .

At first , then , [she]101-jane left [[her]101-jane room]630-her room in darkness , and , groping [her]101-jane way to the curtains , drew them back , threw up the sash , and , drawing a chair to the window , sat down , leaning [her]101-jane elbows on the sill and [her]101-jane chin in [her]101-jane hands , and looked down upon [the terrace]312-the terrace , still bathed in moonlight . [Her]101-jane window was almost opposite the place where [she]101-jane and [Garth]111-garth had talked . [She]101-jane could see the stone lion and the vase full of scarlet geraniums . [She]101-jane could locate the exact spot where [she]101-jane was sitting when [he]111-garth Memory awoke , vibrant .

Then [Jane]101-jane allowed [herself]101-jane the most wonderful mental experience of [her]101-jane life . [She]101-jane was [a woman of purpose and decision]876-a woman of purpose and decision . [She]101-jane had said [she]101-jane had a right to that hour , and [she]101-jane took it to the full . In soul [she]101-jane met [[her]101-jane tiger]877-her tiger and mated with [him]111-garth , unafraid . [He]111-garth had not asked whether [she]101-jane loved [him]111-garth or not , and [she]101-jane did not need to ask [herself]101-jane . [She]101-jane surrendered [her]101-jane proud liberty , and tenderly , humbly , wistfully , yet with all the strength of [her]101-jane strong nature , promised to love , honour , and obey [him]111-garth . [She]101-jane met the adoration of [his]111-garth splendid eyes without a tremor . [She]101-jane had locked [her]101-jane body out . [She]101-jane was alone with [her]101-jane soul ; and [her]101-jane soul was all - beautiful perfect for [him]111-garth .

The loneliness of years slipped from [her]101-jane . Life became rich and purposeful . [He]111-garth needed [her]101-jane always , and [she]101-jane was always there and always able to meet [his]111-garth need . " Are [you]111-garth content , [[my]111-garth beloved]2659-my beloved ? "[111-garth] [she]101-jane asked over and over ; and [Garth]111-garth 's joyous voice , with the ring of perpetual youth in it , always answered : " Perfectly content . "[101-jane] And [Jane]101-jane smiled into the night , and in the depths of [her]101-jane calm eyes dawned a knowledge hitherto unknown , and in [her]101-jane tender smile trembled , with unspeakable sweetness , an understanding of the secret of [a woman]403-a woman 's truest bliss . " [He]111-garth is [mine]111-garth and [I]101-jane am [his]111-garth . And because [he]111-garth is [mine]111-garth , [[my]101-jane beloved]2659-my beloved is safe ; and because [I]101-jane am [his]111-garth , [he]111-garth is content . "[101-jane]

Thus [she]101-jane gave [herself]101-jane completely ; gathering [him]111-garth into the shelter of [her]101-jane love ; and [her]101-jane generous heart expanded to the greatness of the gift . Then [the mother]879-the mother in [her]101-jane awoke and realised how much of the maternal flows into the love of [a true woman]880-a true woman when [she]879-the mother understands how largely the child - nature predominates in [the man in love]881-the man in love , and how the very strength of [his]111-garth need of [her]101-jane reduces to unaccustomed weakness the strong nature to which [she]101-jane has become essential .

[Jane]101-jane pressed [her]101-jane hands upon [her]101-jane breast . " [Garth]111-garth , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane whispered , " [Garth]111-garth , [I]101-jane UNDERSTAND . [[My]101-jane own poor boy]2661-my own poor boy , it was so hard to [you]111-garth to be sent away just then . But [you]111-garth had had all all [you]111-garth wanted , in those few wonderful moments , and nothing can rob [you]111-garth of that fact . And [you]111-garth have made [me]101-jane SO yours that , whatever the future brings for [you]111-garth and [me]101-jane , no other face will ever be hidden here . It is [yours]111-garth , and [I]101-jane am [yours]111-garth to - night , and henceforward , forever . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane leaned [her]101-jane forehead on the window - sill . The moonlight fell on the heavy coils of [her]101-jane brown hair . The scent of the magnolia blooms rose in fragrance around [her]101-jane . The song of a nightingale purled and thrilled in an adjacent wood . The lonely years of the past , the perplexing moments of the present , the uncertain vistas of the future , all rolled away . [She]101-jane sailed with [Garth]111-garth upon [a golden ocean far removed from the shores of time]882-a golden ocean far removed from the shores of time . For love is eternal ; and the birth of love frees the spirit from all limitations of the flesh .

A clock in [the distant village]883-the distant village struck midnight . The twelve strokes floated up to [Jane]101-jane 's window across [the moonlit park]884-the moonlit park . Time was once more . [Her]101-jane freed spirit resumed the burden of the body .

A new day had begun , the day upon which [she]101-jane had promised [her]101-jane answer to [Garth]111-garth . The next time that clock struck twelve [she]101-jane would be standing with [him]111-garth in [the church]2432-the church , and [her]101-jane answer must be ready .

[She]101-jane turned from the window without closing it , drew the curtains closely across , switched on the electric light over the writing - table , took off [her]101-jane evening gown , hung up bodice and skirt in [the wardrobe]886-the wardrobe , resolutely locking the door upon them . Then [she]101-jane slipped on a sage - green wrapper , which [she]101-jane had lately purchased at [a bazaar]887-a bazaar because [every one else]888-every one else fled from it , and [the old lady whose handiwork it was]889-the old lady whose handiwork it was seemed so disappointed , and , drawing a chair near the writing - table , took out [her]101-jane diary , unlocked the heavy clasp , and began to read . [She]101-jane turned the pages slowly , pausing here and there , until [she]101-jane came to those [she]101-jane sought . Over them [she]101-jane pondered long , [her]101-jane head in [her]101-jane hands . They contained a very full account of [her]101-jane conversation with [Garth]111-garth on the afternoon of the day of the concert at [Overdene]1-overdene ; and the lines upon which [she]101-jane specially dwelt were these : " [His]111-garth face was transfigured .... Goodness and inspiration shone from it , making it as the face of [an angel]2322-an angel .... [I]101-jane never thought [him]111-garth ugly again . Child though [I]101-jane was , [I]101-jane could differentiate even then between ugliness and plainness . [I]101-jane have associated [his]111-garth face ever since with the wondrous beauty of [his]111-garth soul . When [he]111-garth sat down , at the close of [his]111-garth address , [I]101-jane no longer thought [him]111-garth a complicated form of chimpanzee . [I]101-jane remembered the divine halo of [his]111-garth smile . Of course it was not the sort of face one COULD have wanted to live with , or to have day after day opposite one at table , but then [one]474-one was not called to that sort of discipline , which would have been martyrdom to [me]101-jane . And [he]111-garth has always stood to [my]101-jane mind since as a proof of the truth that goodness is never ugly , and that divine love and aspiration , shining through the plainest features , may redeem them , temporarily , into beauty ; and permanently , into a thing one loves to remember . "[101-jane]

At first [Jane]101-jane read the entire passage . Then [her]101-jane mind focussed itself upon one sentence : " Of course it was not the sort of face [one COULD have wanted to live with]2664-one could have wanted to live with , or to have day after day opposite one at table , ... which would have been martyrdom to [me]111-garth . "[111-garth]

At length [Jane]101-jane arose , turned on all the lights over the dressing - table , particularly two bright ones on either side of the mirror , and , sitting down before it , faced [herself]101-jane honestly .

When the village clock struck one , [Garth Dalmain]111-garth stood at [his]111-garth window taking a final look at the night which had meant so much to [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth remembered , with an amused smile , how , to help [himself]111-garth to calmness , [he]111-garth had sat on [the terrace]312-the terrace and thought of [his]111-garth socks , and then had counted [the windows between [his]111-garth and [Jane]101-jane 's]891-the windows between his and jane 's . There were [five of [them]891-the windows between his and jane 's]892-five of them . [He]111-garth knew [her]101-jane window by the magnolia tree and the seat beneath [it]893-it where [he]111-garth had chanced to sit , not knowing [she]101-jane was above [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth leaned far out and looked towards [it]893-it now . The curtains were drawn , but there appeared still to be a light behind them . Even as [he]111-garth watched , it went out .

[He]111-garth looked down at [the terrace]312-the terrace . [He]111-garth could see the stone lion and the vase of scarlet geraniums . [He]111-garth could locate the exact spot where [she]101-jane was sitting when [he]111-garth

Then [he]111-garth dropped upon [his]111-garth knees beside the window and looked up into the starry sky .

[[Garth]111-garth 's mother]895-garth 's mother had lived long enough to teach [him]111-garth the holy secret of [her]895-garth 's mother sweet patience and endurance . In moments of deep feeling , words from [[his]111-garth mother]452-his mother 's Bible came to [his]111-garth lips more readily than expressions of [his]111-garth own thought . Now , looking upward , [he]111-garth repeated softly and reverently : " ' Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above , and cometh down from [the Father of lights]2310-the father of lights , with whom is no variableness , neither shadow of turning . ' And oh , [Father]189-father , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth added , " keep [us]2666-us in the light [she]895-garth 's mother and [I.]111-garth May there be in [us]2666-us , as there is in [Thee]2667-thee , no variableness , neither shadow which is cast by turning . "[111-garth]

Then [he]111-garth rose to [his]111-garth feet and looked across once more to the stone lion and the broad coping . [His]111-garth soul sang within [him]111-garth , and [he]111-garth folded [his]111-garth arms across [his]111-garth chest . " [[My]111-garth wife]2580-my wife ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " Oh ! [[my]111-garth wife]2580-my wife ! "[111-garth]

And , as the village clock struck one , [Jane]101-jane arrived at [her]101-jane decision .

Slowly [she]101-jane rose , and turned off all the lights ; then , groping [her]101-jane way to the bed , fell upon [her]101-jane knees beside it , and broke into a passion of desperate , silent weeping .

CHAPTER XI

[GARTH]111-garth FINDS [THE CROSS

[The village church on [the green]760-the green]759-the village church on the green]897-the cross the village church on the green was bathed in sunshine as [Jane]101-jane emerged from the cool shade of [the park]305-the park . The clock proclaimed the hour half - past eleven , and [Jane]101-jane did not hasten , knowing [she]101-jane was not expected until twelve . The windows of [the church]2432-the church were open , and the massive oaken doors stood ajar .

[Jane]101-jane paused beneath [the ivy - covered porch]902-the ivy - covered porch and stood listening . The tones of the organ reached [her]101-jane as from an immense distance , and yet with an all - pervading nearness . The sound was disassociated from hands and feet . The organ seemed breathing , and its breath was music .

[Jane]101-jane pushed the heavy door further open , and even at that moment it occurred to [her]101-jane that [the freckled boy with a red head]903-the freckled boy with a red head , and [Garth]111-garth 's slim proportions , had evidently passed easily through an aperture which refused ingress to [her]101-jane more massive figure . [She]101-jane pushed the door further open , and went in .

Instantly a stillness entered into [her]101-jane soul . The sense of unseen presences , often so strongly felt on entering [an empty church]904-an empty church alone , the impress left upon old walls and rafters by the worshipping minds of centuries , hushed the insistent beating of [her]101-jane own perplexity , and for a few moments [she]101-jane forgot the errand which brought [her]101-jane there , and bowed [her]101-jane head in unison with the worship of ages .

[Garth]111-garth was playing the " Veni , Creator Spiritus "[111-garth] to [Attwood]26-attwood 's perfect setting ; and , as [Jane]101-jane walked noiselessly up to [the chancel]905-the chancel , [he]111-garth began to sing the words of the second verse . [He]111-garth sang them softly , but [his]111-garth beautifully modulated barytone carried well , and every syllable reached [her]101-jane .

" Enable with perpetual light The dulness of [our]2670-our blinded sight ; Anoint and cheer [our]2670-our soiled face With the abundance of [Thy]2671-thou grace ; Keep far [our]2670-our foes ; give peace at [home]381-home ; Where [Thou]2671-thou art Guide , no ill can come . "[906-themselves] Then the organ swelled into full power , pealing out the theme of the last verse without its words , and allowing those [he]111-garth had sung to repeat [themselves]906-themselves over and over in [Jane]101-jane 's mind : " Where [Thou]2671-thou art [Guide]190-guide , no ill can come . "[111-garth] Had [she]101-jane not prayed for guidance ? Then surely all would be well .

[She]101-jane paused at the entrance to [the chancel]905-the chancel . [Garth]111-garth had returned to the second verse , and was singing again , to a waldflute accompaniment , " Enable with perpetual light . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane seated [herself]101-jane in one of [the old oak stalls]908-the old oak stalls and looked around [her]101-jane . The brilliant sunshine from without entered through the stained - glass windows , mellowed into golden beams of soft amber light , with here and there a shaft of crimson . What a beautiful expression perpetual light ! As [Garth]111-garth sang it , each syllable seemed to pierce the silence like a ray of purest sunlight . " The dulness of "[111-garth] [Jane]101-jane could just see the top of [his]111-garth dark head over the heavy brocade of the organ curtain . [She]101-jane dreaded the moment when [he]111-garth should turn , and those vivid eyes should catch sight of [her]101-jane " [our]2673-our blinded sight . "[111-garth] How would [he]111-garth take what [she]101-jane must say ? Would [she]101-jane have strength to come through a long hard scene ? Would [he]111-garth be tragically heart - broken ? " Anoint and cheer [our]2673-our soiled face "[111-garth] Would [he]111-garth argue , and insist , and override [her]101-jane judgment ? " With the abundance of [Thy]2674-thy grace "[101-jane] Could [she]101-jane oppose [his]111-garth fierce strength , if [he]111-garth chose to exert it ? Would [they]909-they either of [them]909-they come through so hard a time without wounding [each other]573-each other terribly ? " Keep far [[our]2673-our foes]2675-our foes ; give peace at [home]381-home "[101-jane] Oh ! what could [she]101-jane say ? What would [he]111-garth say ? How should [she]101-jane answer ? What reason could [she]101-jane give for [her]101-jane refusal which [Garth]111-garth would ever take as final ? " Where [Thou]2677-thou art [Guide]2678-guide , no ill can come . "[111-garth]

And then , after a few soft , impromptu chords ; the theme changed .

[Jane]101-jane 's heart stood still . [Garth]111-garth was playing " The Rosary . "[111-garth] [He]111-garth did not sing it ; but the soft insistence of the organ pipes seemed to press the words into the air , as no voice could have done . [Memory]191-memory 's pearls , in all the purity of their gleaming preciousness , were counted one by one by the flute and dulciana ; and the sadder tones of the waldflute proclaimed the finding of the cross . It all held a new meaning for [Jane]101-jane , who looked helplessly round , as if seeking some way of escape from the sad sweetness of sound which filled [the little church]911-the little church .

Suddenly it ceased . [Garth]111-garth stood up , turned , and saw [her]101-jane . The glory of a great joy leaped into [his]111-garth face .

" All right , [Jimmy]192-jimmy , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said ; " that will do for this morning . And here is a bright sixpence , because [you]192-jimmy have managed the blowing so well . Hullo ! It 's a shilling ! Never mind . [You]192-jimmy shall have it because it is such a glorious day . There never was such a day , [Jimmy]192-jimmy ; and [I]111-garth want [you]192-jimmy to be happy also . Now run off quickly , and shut the church door behind [you]192-jimmy , [[my]111-garth boy]2679-my boy . "[111-garth]

Ah ! how [his]111-garth voice , with its ring of buoyant gladness , shook [her]101-jane soul .

[The red - headed boy , rather grubby , with a whole pepper - pot of freckles , but a beaming face of pleasure]912-the red - headed boy , rather grubby , with a whole pepper - pot of freckles , but a beaming face of pleasure , came out from behind the organ , clattered down [a side aisle]913-a side aisle ; dropped [his]111-garth shilling on the way and had to find it ; but at last went out , the heavy door closing behind [him]111-garth with a resounding clang .

[Garth]111-garth had remained standing beside the organ , quite motionless , without looking at [Jane]101-jane , and now that [they]914-they were absolutely alone in [the church]2432-the church , [he]111-garth still stood and waited a few moments . To [Jane]101-jane those moments seemed days , weeks , years , an eternity . Then [he]111-garth came out into the centre of [the chancel]905-the chancel , [his]111-garth head erect , [his]111-garth eyes shining , [his]111-garth whole bearing that of a conqueror sure of [his]111-garth victory . [He]111-garth walked down to the quaintly carved oaken screen and , passing beneath it , stood at the step . Then [he]111-garth signed to [Jane]101-jane to come and stand beside [him]111-garth .

" Here , [dearest]2680-dearest , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said ; " let it be here . "[111-garth]

[Jane]101-jane came to [him]111-garth , and for a moment [they]914-they stood together , looking up [the chancel]905-the chancel . [It]905-the chancel was darker than the rest of [the church]2432-the church , being lighted only by three narrow stained - glass windows , gems of colour and of significance . The centre window , immediately over the communion table , represented the Saviour of [the world]2266-the world , dying upon the cross . [They]914-they gazed at it in reverent silence . Then [Garth]111-garth turned to [Jane]101-jane .

" [[My]111-garth beloved]2659-my beloved , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said , " it is a sacred Presence and a sacred place . But [no place]2682-no place could be too sacred for that which [we]914-they have to say to [each other]573-each other , and the Holy Presence , in which [we]914-they both believe , is here to bless and ratify it . [I]101-jane am waiting for [your]101-jane answer . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane cleared [her]101-jane throat and put [her]101-jane trembling hands into the large pockets of [her]101-jane tweed coat .

" [Dal]116-dal , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said ; " [my]111-garth answer is a question . How old are [you]111-garth ? "[111-garth]

[She]101-jane felt [his]111-garth start of intense surprise . [She]101-jane saw the light of expectant joy fade from [his]111-garth face . But [he]111-garth replied , after only a momentary hesitation : " [I]101-jane thought [you]101-jane knew , [dearest]2680-dearest . [I]101-jane am twenty - seven . "[101-jane]

" Well , "[101-jane] said [Jane]101-jane slowly and deliberately , " [I]111-garth am thirty ; and [I]111-garth look thirty - five , and feel forty . [You]111-garth are twenty - seven , [Dal]116-dal , and [you]111-garth look nineteen , and often feel nine . [I]111-garth have been thinking it over , and [you]111-garth know [I]111-garth can not marry [a mere boy]2685-a mere boy . "[111-garth]

Silence absolute .

In sheer terror [Jane]101-jane forced [herself]101-jane to look at [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth was white to the lips . [His]111-garth face was very stern and calm a strange , stony calmness . There was not much youth in it just then . " ANOINT AND CHEER [OUR]920-the silent church SOILED FACE "[111-garth] [The silent church]920-the silent church seemed to wail the words in bewildered agony .

At last [he]111-garth spoke . " [I]111-garth had not thought of [myself]111-garth , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said slowly . " [I]111-garth can not explain how it comes to pass , but [I]111-garth have not thought of [myself]111-garth at all , since [my]111-garth mind has been full of [you]111-garth . Therefore [I]111-garth had not realised how little there is in [me]111-garth that [you]111-garth could care for . [I]111-garth believed [you]111-garth had felt as [I]111-garth did , that [we]2686-we were just [each other]573-each other 's . "[111-garth] For a moment [he]111-garth put out [his]111-garth hand as if [he]111-garth would have touched [her]921-you . Then it dropped heavily to [his]111-garth side . " [You]921-you are quite right , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [You]921-you could not marry [any one whom [you]921-you consider [a mere boy]2685-a mere boy]2688-any one whom you consider a mere boy . "[111-garth]

[He]111-garth turned from [her]921-you and faced up [the chancel]905-the chancel . For the space of a long silent minute [he]111-garth looked at the window over the holy table , where hung [the suffering Christ]923-the suffering christ . Then [he]111-garth bowed [his]111-garth head . " [I]101-jane accept the cross , "[101-jane] [he]111-garth said , and , turning , walked quietly down [the aisle]924-the aisle . [The church]2432-the church door opened , closed behind [him]111-garth with a heavy clang , and [Jane]101-jane was alone .

[She]101-jane stumbled back to the seat [she]101-jane had left , and fell upon [her]101-jane knees .

" O , [[my]111-garth God]2282-my god , "[111-garth] [she]101-jane cried , ' send [him]926-him back to [me]0-i , oh , send [him]926-him back ! ... Oh , [Garth]111-garth ! It is [I]0-i who am plain and unattractive and unworthy , not [you]111-garth . Oh , [Garth]111-garth come back ! come back ! come back ! ... [I]0-i will trust and not be afraid ... Oh , [my]0-i own Dear come back ! "[101-jane]

[She]101-jane listened , with straining ears . [She]101-jane waited , until every nerve of [her]101-jane body ached with suspense . [She]101-jane decided what [she]101-jane would say when the heavy door reopened and [she]101-jane saw [Garth]111-garth standing in a shaft of sunlight . [She]101-jane tried to remember [the VENI]193-the veni , but the hollow clang of the door had silenced even memory 's echo of that haunting music . So [she]101-jane waited silently , and as [she]101-jane waited the silence grew and seemed to enclose [her]101-jane within cruel , relentless walls which opened only to allow [her]101-jane glimpses into the vista of future lonely years . Just once more [she]101-jane broke that silence . " Oh , [darling]2691-darling , come back ! [I]101-jane WILL RISK IT , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said . But no step drew near , and , kneeling with [her]101-jane face buried in [her]101-jane clasped hands , [Jane]101-jane suddenly realised that [Garth Dalmain]111-garth had accepted [her]101-jane decision as final and irrevocable , and would not return .

How long [she]101-jane knelt there after realising this , [she]101-jane never knew . But at last comfort came to [her]101-jane . [She]101-jane felt [she]101-jane had done right . A few hours of present anguish were better than years of future disillusion . [Her]101-jane own life would be sadly empty , and losing this newly found joy was costing [her]101-jane more than [she]101-jane had expected ; but [she]101-jane honestly believed ' [she]101-jane had done rightly towards [him]111-garth , and what did [her]101-jane own pain matter ? " Thus comfort came to [Jane]101-jane .[111-garth]

At last [she]101-jane rose and passed out of [the silent church]920-the silent church into the breezy sunshine .

Near [the park gates]928-the park gates [a little knot of excited boys]929-a little knot of excited boys were preparing to fly a kite . [Jimmy]192-jimmy , [the hero of the hour]930-the hero of the hour , [the centre of attraction]931-the centre of attraction , proved to be [the proud possessor of this new kite]932-the proud possessor of this new kite . [Jimmy]192-jimmy was finding the day glorious indeed , and was being happy . " Happy ALSO , "[101-jane] [Garth]111-garth had said . And [Jane]101-jane 's eyes filled with tears , as [she]101-jane remembered the word and the tone in which it was spoken .

" There goes [[my]101-jane poor boy]2692-my poor boy 's shilling , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said to [herself]101-jane sadly , as the kite mounted and soared above [the common]2595-the common ; " but , alas , where is [his]2692-my poor boy joy ? "[101-jane]

As [she]101-jane passed up [the avenue]934-the avenue [a dog - cart]935-a dog - cart was driven swiftly down [it]934-the avenue . [Garth Dalmain]111-garth drove [it]935-a dog - cart ; behind [him]111-garth [a groom]936-a groom and a portmanteau . [He]111-garth lifted [his]111-garth hat as [he]111-garth passed [her]101-jane , but looked straight before [him]111-garth . In a moment [he]111-garth was gone . [Had Jane]101-jane wanted to stop [him]111-garth [she]101-jane could not have done so . But [she]101-jane did not want to stop [him]111-garth . [She]101-jane felt absolutely satisfied that [she]101-jane had done the right thing , and done it at greater cost to [herself]101-jane than to [him]111-garth . [He]111-garth would eventually ah , perhaps before so very long find another to be to [him]111-garth all , and more than all , [he]111-garth had believed [she]101-jane could be . But [she]101-jane ? The dull ache at [her]101-jane bosom reminded [her]101-jane of [her]101-jane own words the night before , whispered in the secret of [[her]101-jane chamber]937-her chamber to [him]111-garth who , alas , was not there to hear : " Whatever the future brings for [you]101-jane and [me]152-pauline lister , no other face will ever be hidden [here]2151-here . "[152-pauline lister] And , in this first hour of the coming lonely years , [she]101-jane knew [them]938-them to be true .

In [the hall]367-the hall [she]101-jane met [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister .

" Is that [you]101-jane , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion ? "[152-pauline lister] said [Pauline]152-pauline lister . " Well now , have [you]101-jane heard of [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth ? [He]111-garth has had to go to [town]364-town unexpectedly , on [the 1.15 train]2695-the 1.15 train ; and [aunt]2166-aunt has dropped [her]2166-aunt false teeth on [her]2166-aunt marble wash - stand and must get to [the dentist]2697-the dentist right away . So [we]2698-we go to [town]364-town on the 2.30 . It 's [an uncertain world]2700-an uncertain world . It complicates [one]474-one 's plans , when [they]474-one have to depend on [other people]341-other people 's teeth . But [I]943-i would sooner break false teeth than true hearts , any day . [One]474-one can get the former mended , but [I]943-i guess [no one]2059-no one can mend the latter . [We]2698-we are lunching early in [[our]2698-we rooms]2705-our rooms ; so [I]943-i wish [you]942-her good - by , [Miss Champion]118-miss champion . "[943-i]

CHAPTER XII

[THE DOCTOR]940-the doctor 'S [PRESCRIPTION

The Honourable Jane Champion]101-jane stood on [the summit of [the Great Pyramid]27-the great pyramid]941-the summit of the great pyramid and looked around [her]942-her . [The four exhausted Arabs]194-the four exhausted arabs whose exertions , combined with [her]942-her own activity , had placed [her]942-her there , dropped in the picturesque attitudes into which an Arab falls by nature . [They]943-i had hoisted [the Honourable Jane]101-jane 's eleven stone ten from the bottom to the top in record time , and now lay around , proud of [their]943-i achievement and sure of [their]943-i " backsheesh . "[946-a voice behind]

The whole thing had gone as if by clock - work . [Two mahogany - coloured , finely proportioned fellows]944-two mahogany - coloured , finely proportioned fellows , in scanty white garments , sprang with the ease of antelopes to the top of a high step , turning to reach down eagerly and seize [Jane]101-jane 's upstretched hands . [One]195-one remained behind , unseen but indispensable , to lend timely aid at exactly the right moment . Then came the apparently impossible task for [Jane]101-jane , of placing the sole of [her]101-jane foot on the edge of a stone four feet above the one upon which [she]101-jane was standing . It seemed rather like stepping up on to [the drawing - room mantelpiece]945-the drawing - room mantelpiece . But encouraged by cries of " Eiwa ! Eiwa ! "[947-two voices above] [she]101-jane did it ; when instantly [a voice behind]946-a voice behind said , " Tyeb ! "[947-two voices above] [two voices above]947-two voices above shouted , " Keteer ! "[101-jane] the grip on [her]101-jane hands tightened , [the Arab]948-the arab behind hoisted , and [Jane]101-jane had stepped up , with an ease which surprised [herself]101-jane . As a matter of fact , under those circumstances the impossible thing would have been not to have stepped up .

[Arab number four]949-arab number four was water - carrier , and offered water from a gourd at intervals ; and once , when [Jane]101-jane had to cry halt for a few minutes ' breathing space , [Schehati]196-schehati , handsomest of all , and [leader of [the enterprise]951-the enterprise]950-leader of the enterprise , offered to recite English Shakespeare - poetry . This proved to be :

" [Jack]197-jack - an - [Jill]198-jill Went [uppy hill]2706-uppy hill , To fetchy paily water ; [Jack]197-jack fell down - an Broke [his]197-jack crown - an [Jill]198-jill came tumbling after . "[199-ali] [Jane]101-jane had laughed ; and [Schehati]196-schehati , encouraged by the success of [his]950-leader of the enterprise attempt to edify and amuse , used lines of the immortal nursery epic as signals for united action during the remainder of the climb . Therefore [Jane]101-jane mounted one step to the fact that [Jack]197-jack fell down , and scaled the next to information as to the serious nature of [his]197-jack injuries , and at the third , [Schehati]196-schehati , bending over , confidentially mentioned in [her]101-jane ear , while [Ali]199-ali shoved behind , that " [Jill]198-jill came tumbling after . "[200-horner]

The familiar words , heard under such novel circumstances , took on fresh meaning . [Jane]101-jane commenced speculating as to whether the downfall of [Jack]197-jack need necessarily have caused so complete a loss of self - control and equilibrium on the part of [Jill]198-jill . Would [she]101-jane not have proved [her]101-jane devotion better by bringing the mutual pail safely to [the bottom of [the hill]953-the hill]952-the bottom of the hill , and there attending to the wounds of [[her]101-jane fallen hero]954-her fallen hero ? [Jane]101-jane , in [her]101-jane time , had witnessed the tragic downfall of [various delightful jacks]955-various delightful jacks , and had [herself]101-jane ministered tenderly to [their]955-various delightful jacks broken crowns ; for in each case [the Jill]956-the jill had remained on [the top of [the hill]953-the hill]957-the top of the hill , flirting with [that objectionable person of the name of [Horner]200-horner , whose cool , calculating way of setting to work so unlike [poor Jack]197-jack 's headlong method]959-that objectionable person of the name of horner , whose cool , calculating way of setting to work so unlike poor jack 's headlong method invariably secured [him]200-horner the plum ; upon which [he]200-horner remarked " What [a good boy]2707-a good boy am [I]196-schehati ! "[196-schehati] and was usually taken at [his]200-horner own smug valuation . But [Jane]101-jane 's entire sympathy on these occasions was with [the defeated lover]960-the defeated lover , and [more than one Jack]961-more than one jack was now on [his]200-horner feet again , bravely facing life , because that kind hand had been held out to [him]200-horner as [he]200-horner lay in [his]200-horner valley of humiliation , and that comprehending sympathy had proved balm to [his]200-horner broken crown .

" [Dickery]201-dickery , [dickery]2708-dickery , dock ! "[196-schehati] chanted [Schehati]196-schehati solemnly , as [he]200-horner hauled again ; " [Moses]202-moses ran up the clock . The clock struck ' one ' "[196-schehati]

THE CLOCK STRUCK " ONE "[196-schehati] ? It was nearly three years since that night at [Shenstone]16-shenstone when the clock had struck " one , "[975-the rest] and [Jane]101-jane had arrived at [her]101-jane decision , the decision which precipitated [her]101-jane Jack from [his]200-horner Pisgah of future promise . And yet no . [He]200-horner had not fallen before the blow . [He]200-horner had taken it erect , and [his]200-horner light step had been even firmer than usual as [he]200-horner walked down [the church]2432-the church and left [her]101-jane , after quietly and deliberately accepting [her]101-jane decision . It was [Jane]101-jane [herself]101-jane , left alone , who fell hopelessly over the pail . [She]101-jane shivered even now when [she]101-jane remembered how its icy waters drenched [her]101-jane heart . Ah , what would have happened if [Garth]111-garth had come back in answer to [her]101-jane cry during those first moments of intolerable suffering and loneliness ? But [Garth]111-garth was not [the sort of man who , when a door has been shut upon [him]111-garth]963-the sort of man who , when a door has been shut upon him , waits on the mat outside , hoping to be recalled . When [she]101-jane put [him]111-garth from [her]101-jane , and [he]111-garth realised that [she]101-jane meant it [he]111-garth passed completely out of [her]101-jane life . [He]111-garth was at [the railway station]2614-the railway station by the time [she]101-jane reached [the house]309-the house , and from that day to this [they]966-they had never met . [Garth]111-garth evidently considered the avoidance of meetings to be [his]111-garth responsibility , and [he]111-garth never failed [her]101-jane in this . Once or twice [she]101-jane went on a visit to [houses where [she]101-jane knew [him]111-garth to be staying]967-houses where she knew him to be staying . [He]111-garth always happened to have left that morning , if [she]101-jane arrived in time for luncheon ; or by [an early afternoon train]968-an early afternoon train , if [she]101-jane was due for tea . [He]111-garth never timed it so that there should be tragic passings of each other , with set faces , at [the railway stations]969-the railway stations ; or a formal word of greeting as [she]101-jane arrived and [he]111-garth departed , just enough to awaken [all the slumbering pain and set people]970-all the slumbering pain and set people wondering . [Jane]101-jane remembered with shame that this was the sort of picturesque tragedy [she]101-jane would have expected from [Garth Dalmain]111-garth . But [the man who had surprised [her]101-jane by [his]111-garth dignified acquiescence in [her]101-jane decision]971-the man who had surprised her by his dignified acquiescence in her decision , continued to surprise [her]101-jane by the strength with which [he]111-garth silently accepted it as final and kept out of [her]101-jane way . [Jane]101-jane had not probed the depth of the wound [she]101-jane had inflicted .

Never once was [his]111-garth departure connected , in the minds of [others]410-others , with [her]101-jane arrival . There was always some excellent and perfectly natural reason why [he]111-garth had been obliged to leave , and [he]111-garth was openly talked of and regretted , and [Jane]101-jane heard all the latest " Dal stories , "[152-pauline lister] and found [herself]101-jane surrounded by the atmosphere of [his]111-garth exotic , beauty - loving nature . And there was usually [a girl always the loveliest of [the party]579-the party]973-a girl always the loveliest of the party confidentially pointed out to [Jane]101-jane , by [the rest]975-the rest , as a certainty , if only [Dal]116-dal had had another twenty - four hours of [her]101-jane society . But [the girl]976-the girl [herself]976-the girl would appear quite heart - whole , only very full of an evidently delightful friendship , expressing all [Dal]116-dal 's ideas on art and colour , as [her]976-the girl own , and confidently happy in an assured sense of [her]976-the girl own loveliness and charm and power to please . Never did [he]111-garth leave behind [him]111-garth traces which [the woman who loved [him]111-garth]977-the woman who loved him regretted to find . But [he]111-garth was always gone irrevocably gone . [Garth Dalmain]111-garth was not [the sort of man to wait on the door - mat of [a woman]403-a woman 's indecision]978-the sort of man to wait on the door - mat of a woman 's indecision .

Neither did [this Jack of [hers]977-the woman who loved him]980-this jack of hers break [his]111-garth crown . [His]111-garth portrait of [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister , painted six months after the Shenstone visit , had proved the finest bit of work [he]111-garth had as yet accomplished . [He]111-garth had painted [the lovely American]981-the lovely american , in creamy white satin , standing on a dark oak staircase , one hand resting on the balustrade , the other , full of yellow roses , held out towards [an unseen friend below]982-an unseen friend below . Behind and above [her]981-the lovely american shone a stained - glass window , centuries old , the arms , crest , and mottoes of [the noble family to whom [the place]2081-the place]983-the noble family to whom the place belonged , shining thereon in rose - coloured and golden glass . [He]111-garth had wonderfully caught the charm and vivacity of [the girl]976-the girl . [She]976-the girl was gaily up - to - date , and frankly [American]203-american , from the crown of [her]976-the girl queenly little head , to the point of [her]976-the girl satin shoe ; and the suggestiveness of placing [her]976-the girl in surroundings which breathed an atmosphere of the best traditions of [[England]28-england 's ancient ancestral homes]986-england 's ancient ancestral homes , the fearless wedding of [the new world]987-the new world with [the old]988-the old , the putting of this sparkling gem from the new into the beautiful mellow setting of the old and there showing it at its best , all this was the making of the picture . [People]533-people smiled , and said [the painter]990-the painter had done on canvas what [he]990-the painter shortly intended doing in reality ; but the tie between [artist]991-artist and [sitter]992-sitter never grew into anything closer than a pleasant friendship , and it was [the noble owner of the staircase]993-the noble owner of the staircase and window who eventually persuaded [Miss Lister]151-miss lister to remain in surroundings which suited [her]151-miss lister so admirably .

One story about that portrait [Jane]101-jane had heard discussed more than once in circles where both were known . [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister had come to the first sittings wearing [her]152-pauline lister beautiful string of pearls , and [Garth]111-garth had painted them wonderfully , spending hours over the delicate perfecting of each separate gleaming drop . Suddenly one day [he]111-garth seized [his]111-garth palette - knife , scraped the whole necklace off the canvas with a stroke and , declared [she]152-pauline lister must wear [her]152-pauline lister rose - topazes in order to carry out [his]111-garth scheme of colour . [She]152-pauline lister was wearing [her]152-pauline lister rose - topazes when [Jane]101-jane saw the picture in [the Academy]535-the academy , and very lovely they looked on the delicate whiteness of [her]152-pauline lister neck . But [people who had seen [Garth]111-garth 's painting of the pearls]995-people who had seen garth 's painting of the pearls maintained that that scrape of the palette - knife had destroyed work which would have been the talk of the year . And [Pauline Lister]152-pauline lister , just after it had happened , was reported to have said , with a shrug of [her]152-pauline lister pretty shoulders : " Schemes of colour are all very well . But [he]111-garth scraped [my]111-garth pearls off the canvas because [some one who came in]2709-some one who came in hummed a tune while looking at the picture . [I]111-garth would be obliged if [people who walk around [the studio]2711-the studio while [I]111-garth am being painted]2710-people who walk around the studio while i am being painted will in future refrain from humming tunes . [I]111-garth do n't want [him]111-garth to scoop off [my]111-garth topazes and call for [my]111-garth emeralds . Also [I]111-garth feel like offering a reward for the discovery of that tune . [I]111-garth want to know what it has to do with [my]111-garth scheme of colour , anyway . "[111-garth]

When [Jane]101-jane heard the story , [she]101-jane was spending a few days with [the Brands]15-the brands in [Wimpole Street]29-wimpole street . It was told at tea , in [[Lady Brand]143-lady brand 's pretty boudoir]996-lady brand 's pretty boudoir . [The duchess]304-the duchess 's Concert , at which [Garth]111-garth had heard [her]101-jane sing THE ROSARY , was a thing of the past . Nearly a year had elapsed since [their]998-their final parting , and this was the very first thought or word or sign of [his]111-garth remembrance , which directly or indirectly , had come [her]101-jane way . [She]101-jane could not doubt that the tune hummed had been [THE ROSARY]127-simpson .

" The hours [I]111-garth spent with [thee]101-jane , [dear heart]2392-dear heart , Are as a string of pearls to [me]111-garth ; [I]111-garth count them over , every one , apart . "[111-garth] [She]101-jane seemed to hear [Garth]111-garth 's voice on [the terrace]312-the terrace , as [she]101-jane heard it in those first startled moments of realising the gift which was being laid at [her]101-jane feet " [I]101-jane have learned to count pearls , [beloved]2578-beloved . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane 's heart was growing cold and frozen in its emptiness . This incident of [the studio]2711-the studio warmed and woke it for the moment , and with the waking came sharp pain . When [the visitors]1001-the visitors had left , and [Lady Brand]143-lady brand had gone to [the nursery]1002-the nursery , [she]101-jane walked over to the piano , sat down , and softly played the accompaniment of " The Rosary . "[101-jane] The fine unexpected chords , full of discords working into harmony , seemed to suit [her]101-jane mood and [her]101-jane memories .

Suddenly a voice behind [her]101-jane said : " Sing it , [Jane]101-jane . "[940-the doctor] [She]101-jane turned quickly . " What has been the matter for months ? "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane took [her]101-jane hands off the keys , and swung round impulsively .

[I]940-the doctor would do the same again ; at least at least , [I]940-the doctor hope [I]940-the doctor would . "[940-the doctor]

It came .

" [Boy]2714-boy [I]940-the doctor gave up something , which was more than life itself to [me]940-the doctor , for the sake of another , and [I]940-the doctor ca n't get over it . [I]940-the doctor know [I]940-the doctor did right , and yet [I]940-the doctor ca n't get over it . "[940-the doctor]

" Good ! Now , [[my]940-the doctor dear girl]2718-my dear girl , here is a prescription for [you]2718-my dear girl . Go abroad . "[144-flower]
