CHAPTER XXVIII

IN [THE STUDIO]2711-the studio

[Jane]101-jane mounted to [the studio]2711-the studio ; unlocked the door , and , entering , closed it after [her]101-jane .

The evening sun shone through a western window , imparting an added richness to the silk screens and hangings ; the mauve wistaria of a Japanese embroidery ; or the golden dragon of [China]85-china on a deep purple ground , wound up in its own interminable tail , and showing rampant claws in unexpected places .

Several times already [Jane]101-jane had been into [[Garth]111-garth 's studio]1748-garth 's studio , but always to fetch something for which [he]111-garth waited eagerly below ; and [she]101-jane had never felt free to linger . [Margery]147-margery had a duplicate key ; for [she]101-jane [herself]101-jane went up every day to open the windows , dust tenderly all special treasures ; and keep it exactly as [its owner]1503-its owner had liked it kept , when [his]1503-its owner quick eyes could look around it . But this key was always on [[Margery]147-margery 's bunch]1750-margery 's bunch ; and [Jane]101-jane did not like to ask admission , and risk a possible refusal .

Now , however , [she]101-jane could take [her]101-jane own time ; and [she]101-jane seated [herself]101-jane in one of the low and very deep wicker lounge - chairs , comfortably upholstered ; so exactly fitting [her]101-jane proportions , and supporting arms , knees , and head , just rightly , that it seemed as if all other chairs would in future appear inadequate , owing to the absolute perfection of this one . Ah , to be just that to [[her]101-jane beloved]1751-her beloved ! To so fully meet [his]111-garth need , at every point , that [her]101-jane presence should be to [him]111-garth always a source of strength , and rest , and consolation .

[She]101-jane looked around [the room]424-the room . It was so like [Garth]111-garth ; every detail perfect ; every shade of colour enhancing another , and being enhanced by it . The arrangements for regulating the light , both from roof and windows ; the easels of all kinds and sizes ; clean bareness , where space , and freedom from dust , were required ; the luxurious comfort round the fireplace , and in nooks and corners ; all were so perfect . And the plain brown wall - paper , of that beautiful quiet shade which has in it no red , and no yellow ; a clear nut - brown . On an easel near the further window stood an unfinished painting ; palette and brushes beside it , just as [Garth]111-garth had left them when [he]111-garth went out on that morning , nearly three months ago ; and , vaulting over a gate to protect a little animal from unnecessary pain , was plunged [himself]111-garth into such utter loss and anguish .

[Jane]101-jane rose , and took stock of all [his]111-garth quaint treasures on the mantelpiece . Especially [her]101-jane mind was held and fascinated by a stout little bear in brass , sitting solidly yet jauntily on [its]1753-its haunches , its front paws clasping a brazen pole ; its head turned sideways ; its small , beady , eyes , looking straight before it . The chain , from its neck to the pole denoted captivity and possible fierceness . [Jane]101-jane had no doubt its head would lift , and its body prove a receptacle for matches ; but [she]101-jane felt equally certain that , should [she]101-jane lift its head and look , no matches would be within it . [This little bear]1754-this little bear was unmistakably [Early Victorian]275-early victorian ; [a friend of childhood]1755-a friend of childhood 's days ; and would not be put to common uses . [She]101-jane lifted the head . The body was empty . [She]101-jane replaced it gently on the mantelpiece , and realised that [she]101-jane was deliberately postponing an ordeal which must be faced .

[Deryck]107-deryck had told [her]101-jane of [Garth]111-garth 's pictures of [the One Woman]3577-the one woman . [Garth]111-garth , [himself]111-garth , had now told [her]101-jane even more . But the time had come when [she]101-jane must see them for [herself]101-jane . It was useless to postpone the moment . [She]101-jane looked towards the yellow screen .

Then [she]101-jane walked , over to the western window , and threw it wide open . The sun was dipping gently towards [the purple hills]2357-the purple hills . The deep blue of the sky began to pale , as a hint of lovely rose crept into it . [Jane]101-jane looked heavenward and , thrusting [her]101-jane hands deeply into [her]101-jane pockets , spoke aloud . " Before [God]145-god "[101-jane] [she]101-jane said , " in case [I]1768-i am never able to say or think it again , [I]1768-i will say it now [I]1768-i BELIEVE [I]1768-i WAS RIGHT . [I]1768-i considered [Garth]111-garth 's future happiness , and [I]1768-i considered [my]1768-i own . [I]1768-i decided as [I]1768-i did for both [our]3927-our sakes , at terrible cost to present joy . But , before [God]145-god , [I]1768-i believed [I]1768-i was right ; and [I]1768-i BELIEVE IT STILL . "[1768-i]

[Jane]101-jane never said it again .

CHAPTER XXIX

[JANE]101-jane LOOKS INTO LOVE 'S MIRROR

Behind the yellow screen , [Jane]101-jane found a great confusion of canvases , and unmistakable evidence of [the blind hands which had groped about in a vain search]1758-the blind hands which had groped about in a vain search , and then made fruitless endeavours to sort and rearrange . Very tenderly , [Jane]101-jane picked up each canvas from the fallen heap ; turning it the right way up , and standing it with its face to the wall . Beautiful work , was there ; some of it finished ; some , incomplete . One or two faces [she]101-jane knew , looked out at [her]101-jane in [their]1759-their pictured loveliness . But the canvases [she]101-jane sought were not there .

[She]101-jane straightened [herself]101-jane , and looked around . In a further corner , partly concealed by a Cairo screen , stood another pile . [Jane]101-jane went to [them]1760-them .

Almost immediately [she]101-jane found the two [she]101-jane wanted ; larger than the rest , and distinguishable at a glance by the soft black gown of [the central figure]1761-the central figure .

Without giving [them]1760-them more than a passing look , [she]101-jane carried [them]1760-them over to the western window , and placed them in a good light . Then [she]101-jane drew up the chair in which [she]101-jane had been sitting ; took the little brass bear in [her]101-jane left hand , as a talisman to help [her]101-jane through what lay before [her]101-jane ; turned the second picture with its face to the easel ; and sat down to the quiet contemplation of the first .

The noble figure of [a woman , nobly painted]1762-a woman , nobly painted , was the first impression which leapt from eye to brain . Yes , [nobility]1763-nobility came first , in stately pose , in uplifted brow , in breadth of dignity . Then as [you]1764-you marked [the grandly massive figure]1765-the grandly massive figure , too well - proportioned to be cumbersome , but large and full , and amply developed ; the length of limb ; the firmly planted feet ; the large capable hands , [you]1764-you realised the second impression conveyed by the picture , to be strength ; strength to do ; strength to be ; strength to continue . Then [you]1764-you looked into the face . And there [you]1764-you were confronted with a great surprise . The third thought expressed by the picture was Love love , of [the highest , holiest , most ideal , kind]1766-the highest , holiest , most ideal , kind ; yet , withal , of the most tenderly human order ; and [you]1764-you found it in that face .

It was a large face , well proportioned to the figure . It had no pretensions whatever to ordinary beauty . The features were good ; there was not an ugly line about them ; and yet , each one just missed the beautiful ; and the general effect was of a good - looking plainness ; unadorned , unconcealed , and unashamed . But the longer [you]1764-you looked , the more desirable grew the face ; the less [you]1764-you noticed its negations ; the more [you]1764-you admired its honesty , its purity , its immense strength of purpose ; its noble simplicity . [You]1764-you took in all these outward details ; [you]1764-you looked away for a moment , to consider them ; [you]1764-you looked back to verify them ; and then the miracle happened . Into the face had stolen the " light that never was on [sea]3928-sea or [land]3929-land . "[101-jane] It shone from the quiet grey eyes , as , over the head of [the man who knelt before [her]101-jane]1767-the man who knelt before her , [they]1768-i looked out of the picture with an expression of the sublime surrender of [a woman]403-a woman 's whole soul to an emotion which , though it sways and masters [her]101-jane , yet gives [her]101-jane the power to be more truly [herself]101-jane than ever before . The startled joy in [them]1768-i ; the marvel at a mystery not yet understood ; the passionate tenderness ; and yet the almost divine compassion for the unrestrained violence of feeling , which had flung [the man]1158-the man to [his]1158-the man knees , and driven [him]1158-the man to the haven of [her]101-jane breast ; the yearning to soothe , and give , and content ; all these were blended into a look of such exquisite sweetness , that it brought tears to the eyes of [the beholder]1771-the beholder .

[The woman]400-the woman was seated on a broad marble parapet . [She]400-the woman looked straight before [her]400-the woman . [Her]400-the woman knees came well forward , and the long curve of the train of [her]400-the woman black gown filled the foreground on the right . On the left , slightly to one side of [her]400-the woman , knelt [a man]575-a man , [a tall slight figure in evening dress , [his]1158-the man arms thrown forward around [her]400-the woman waist]1774-a tall slight figure in evening dress , his arms thrown forward around her waist ; [his]1158-the man face completely hidden in the soft lace at [her]400-the woman bosom ; only the back of [his]1158-the man sleek dark head , visible . And yet [the whole figure]1775-the whole figure denoted a passion of tense emotion . [She]400-the woman had gathered [him]1158-the man to [her]400-the woman with what [you]1776-you knew must have been an exquisite gesture , combining the utter self - surrender of [the woman]400-the woman , with the tender throb of maternal solicitude ; and now [her]400-the woman hands were clasped behind [his]1158-the man head , holding [him]1158-the man closely to [her]400-the woman . Not a word was being spoken . The hidden face was obviously silent ; and [her]400-the woman firm lips above [his]1158-the man dark head were folded in a line of calm self - control ; though about them hovered the dawning of a smile of bliss ineffable .

A crimson rambler rose climbing some woodwork faintly indicated on the left , and hanging in a glowing mass from the top left - hand corner , supplied the only vivid colour in the picture .

But , from taking in these minor details , the eye returned to that calm tender face , alight with love ; to those strong capable hands , now learning for the first time to put forth the protective passion of [a woman]403-a woman 's tenderness ; and the mind whispered the only possible name for that picture : [The Wife]837-the wife .

[Jane]101-jane gazed at it long , in silence . Had [Garth]111-garth 's little bear been anything less solid than Early Victorian brass ; it must have bent and broken under the strong pressure of those clenched hands .

[She]101-jane could not doubt , for a moment , that [she]101-jane looked upon [herself]101-jane ; but , oh , merciful heavens ! how unlike the reflected self of [her]101-jane own mirror ! Once or twice as [she]101-jane looked , [her]101-jane mind refused to work , and [she]101-jane simply gazed blankly at the minor details of the picture . But then again , the expression of the grey eyes drew [her]101-jane , recalling so vividly every feeling [she]101-jane had experienced when that dear head had come so unexpectedly to its resting - place upon [her]101-jane bosom . " It is true , "[101-jane] [she]101-jane whispered ; and again : " Yes ; it is true . [I]400-the woman can not deny it . It is as [I]400-the woman felt ; it must be as [I]400-the woman looked . "[400-the woman]

And then , suddenly ; [she]400-the woman fell upon [her]400-the woman knees before the picture . " Oh , [[my]1782-the same woman , seated as before God]2282-my god ! Is that as [I]1782-the same woman , seated as before looked ? And the next thing that happened was [[my]1782-the same woman , seated as before boy]2679-my boy lifting [his]2679-my boy shining eyes and gazing at [me]1782-the same woman , seated as before in the moonlight . Is THIS what [he]2679-my boy saw ? Did [I]1782-the same woman , seated as before look SO ? And did [the woman who looked so]3932-the woman who looked so ; and who , looking so , pressed [his]2679-my boy head down again upon [her]3932-the woman who looked so breast , refuse next day to marry [him]2679-my boy , on the grounds of [his]2679-my boy youth , and [her]3932-the woman who looked so superiority ? ... Oh , [Garth]111-garth , [Garth]111-garth ! ... O [God]145-god , help [him]2679-my boy to understand ! ... help [him]2679-my boy to forgive [me]1782-the same woman , seated as before ! "[1782-the same woman , seated as before]

In [the work - room just below]1780-the work - room just below , [Maggie]147-margery [the housemaid]1393-the housemaid was singing as [she]147-margery sewed . The sound floated through the open window , each syllable distinct in the clear Scotch voice , and reached [Jane]101-jane where [she]101-jane knelt . [Her]101-jane mind , stunned to blankness by its pain , took eager hold upon the words of [Maggie]147-margery 's hymn . And they were these .

" O Love , that will not let [me]101-jane go , [I]101-jane rest [my]101-jane weary soul in [Thee]3933-thee ; [I]101-jane give [Thee]3933-thee back the life [I]101-jane owe , That in [Thine ocean]86-thine ocean depths its flow May richer , fuller be . "[101-jane] " O Light , that followest all [my]400-the woman way , [I]400-the woman yield [my]400-the woman flick'ring torch to [Thee]3933-thee ; [My]400-the woman heart restores its borrowed ray , That in [Thy]3933-thee sunshine 's blaze its day May brighter , fairer be . "[400-the woman] [Jane]101-jane took the second picture , and placed it in front of the first .

[The same woman , seated as before]1782-the same woman , seated as before ; but [the man]1158-the man was not there ; and in [her]1782-the same woman , seated as before arms , its tiny dark head pillowed against the fulness of [her]1782-the same woman , seated as before breast , lay [a little child]1784-a little child . [The woman]400-the woman did not look over that small head , but bent above it , and gazed into the baby face .

The crimson rambler had grown right across the picture , and formed a glowing arch above [mother]2246-mother and [child]1787-child . A majesty of tenderness was in the large figure of [the mother]879-the mother . The face , as regarded contour and features , was no less plain ; but again it was transfigured , by the mother - love thereon depicted . [You]1789-you knew " [The Wife]837-the wife "[3935-the " mere boy] had more than fulfilled [her]400-the woman abundant promise . [The wife]837-the wife was there in fullest realisation ; and , added to wifehood , the wonder of motherhood . All mysteries were explained ; all joys experienced ; and the smile on [her]1782-the same woman , seated as before calm lips , bespoke ineffable content .

A rambler rose had burst above [them]1791-them , and fallen in a shower of crimson petals upon [mother]2246-mother and [child]1787-child . The baby - fingers clasped tightly the soft lace at [her]1782-the same woman , seated as before bosom . A petal had fallen upon the tiny wrist . [She]400-the woman had lifted [her]400-the woman hand to remove it ; and , catching the baby - eyes , so dark and shining , paused for a moment , and smiled .

[Jane]101-jane , watching [them]1791-them , fell to desperate weeping . [The " mere boy]3935-the " mere boy "[1794-his] had understood [her]101-jane potential possibilities of motherhood far better than [she]101-jane understood them [herself]101-jane . Having had one glimpse of [her]101-jane as " [The Wife]837-the wife , "[101-jane] [his]1794-his mind had leaped on , and seen [her]101-jane as " [The Mother]879-the mother . "[400-the woman] And again [she]400-the woman was forced to say : " It is true yes ; it is true . "[400-the woman]

And then [she]400-the woman recalled the old line of cruel reasoning :

" It was not the sort of face [one]474-one would have wanted to see always in front of one at table . "[101-jane] Was this the sort of face this , as [Garth]111-garth had painted [it]1795-it , after a supposed year of marriage ? Would [any man]2113-any man weary of it , or wish to turn away [his]2113-any man eyes ?

[Jane]101-jane took one more long look . Then [she]101-jane dropped the little bear , and buried [her]101-jane face in [her]101-jane hands ; while a hot blush crept up to the very roots of [her]101-jane hair , and tingled to [her]101-jane finger - tips .

Below , the fresh young voice was singing again .

" O Joy , that seekest [me]101-jane through pain , [I]101-jane can not close [my]101-jane heart to [Thee]3939-thee ; [I]101-jane trace the rainbow through the rain , And feel the promise is not vain That morn shall tearless be . "[101-jane] After a while [Jane]101-jane whispered : " Oh , [[my]101-jane darling]3940-my darling , forgive [me]101-jane . [I]101-jane was altogether wrong . [I]101-jane will confess ; and , [God]145-god helping [me]101-jane , [I]101-jane will explain ; and , oh , [[my]101-jane darling]3940-my darling , [you]3940-my darling will forgive [me]101-jane ? "[101-jane]

Once more [she]101-jane lifted [her]101-jane head and looked at the picture . A few stray petals of the crimson rambler lay upon the ground ; reminding [her]101-jane of those crushed roses , which , falling from [her]101-jane breast , lay scattered on the terrace at [Shenstone]16-shenstone , emblem of the joyous hopes and glory of love which [her]101-jane decision of that night had laid in the dust of disillusion . But crowning this picture , in rich clusters of abundant bloom , grew the rambler rose . And through the open window came the final verse of [Maggie]147-margery 's hymn .

" O Cross , that liftest up [my]101-jane head , [I]101-jane dare not ask to fly from [Thee]3942-thee ; [I]101-jane lay in dust life 's glory dead , And from the ground there blossoms red Life that shall endless be . "[101-jane] [Jane]101-jane went to the western window , and stood , with [her]101-jane arms stretched above [her]101-jane , looking out upon the radiance of the sunset . The sky blazed into gold and crimson at the horizon ; gradually as the eye lifted , paling to primrose , flecked with rosy clouds ; and , overhead , deep blue fathomless , boundless , blue .

[Jane]101-jane gazed at the golden battlements above [the purple hills]2357-the purple hills , and repeated , half aloud : " And [the city]3943-the city was of pure gold ; and had no need of the sun , neither of the moon to shine in it : for the glory of [God]145-god did lighten it . And there shall be no more death ; neither sorrow , nor crying , neither shall there be any more pain : for the former things are passed away . "[276-truly garth]

Ah , how much had passed away since [she]101-jane stood at that western window , not an hour before . All life seemed readjusted ; [its]1798-its outlook altered ; its perspective changed . [Truly Garth]276-truly garth had " gone behind [his]276-truly garth blindness . "[101-jane]

[Jane]101-jane raised [her]101-jane eyes to the blue ; and a smile of unspeakable anticipation parted [her]101-jane lips . " Life , that shall endless be , "[228-nurse rosemary] [she]101-jane murmured . Then , turning , found [the little bear]1799-the little bear , and restored [him]1799-the little bear to [his]1799-the little bear place upon the mantelpiece ; put back the chair ; closed the western window ; and , picking up the two canvases , left [the studio]2711-the studio , and made [her]101-jane way carefully [downstairs]3217-downstairs .

CHAPTER XXX

" [THE LADY PORTRAYED]3944-the lady portrayed "[101-jane]

" It has taken [you]101-jane long , [Miss Gray]233-miss gray . [I]228-nurse rosemary nearly sent [Simpson]230-simpson up , to find out what had happened . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" [I]111-garth am glad [you]111-garth did not do that , [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth . [Simpson]230-simpson would have found [me]111-garth weeping on the studio floor ; and to ask [his]230-simpson assistance under those circumstances , would have been more humbling than inquiring after the fly in the soup ! "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth turned quickly in [his]111-garth chair . [The artist - ear]1802-the artist - ear had caught the tone which meant comprehension of [his]111-garth work .

" Weeping ! "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " Why ? "[228-nurse rosemary]

" Because , "[228-nurse rosemary] answered [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , " [I]111-garth have been entranced . These pictures are so exquisite . They stir one 's deepest depths . And yet they are so pathetic ah , SO pathetic ; because [you]111-garth have made [a plain woman , beautiful]3945-a plain woman , beautiful . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth rose to [his]111-garth feet , and turned upon [her]228-nurse rosemary a face which would have blazed , had it not been sightless .

" A WHAT ? "[228-nurse rosemary] [he]111-garth exclaimed .

" [A plain woman]3946-a plain woman , "[228-nurse rosemary] repeated [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , quietly . " Surely [you]111-garth realised [your]111-garth model to be that . And therein lies the wonder of the pictures . [You]111-garth have so beautified [her]3946-a plain woman by wifehood , and glorified [her]3946-a plain woman by motherhood , that the longer one looks the more [one]474-one forgets [her]3946-a plain woman plainness ; seeing [her]3946-a plain woman as loving and loved ; lovable , and therefore lovely . It is a triumph of art . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth sat down , [his]111-garth hands clasped before [him]111-garth .

" It is a triumph of truth , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [I]228-nurse rosemary painted what [I]228-nurse rosemary saw . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" [You]228-nurse rosemary painted [her]3946-a plain woman soul , "[228-nurse rosemary] said [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , " and it illuminated [her]3946-a plain woman plain face . "[111-garth]

" [I]111-garth SAW [her]3946-a plain woman soul , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , almost in a whisper ; " and that vision was so radiant that it illumined [my]228-nurse rosemary dark life . The remembrance lightens [my]228-nurse rosemary darkness , even now . "[228-nurse rosemary]

A very tender silence fell in [the library]3143-the library .

The twilight deepened .

Then [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary spoke , very low . " [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , [I]111-garth have a request to make of [you]111-garth . [I]111-garth want to beg [you]111-garth not to destroy these pictures . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth lifted [his]111-garth head . " [I]111-garth must destroy them , [child]1787-child , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said . " [I]228-nurse rosemary can not risk [their]3949-their being seen by [people who would recognise [my]228-nurse rosemary the [the lady]3361-the lady portrayed]3950-people who would recognise my the the lady portrayed . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" At all events , there is [one person who must see them , before they are destroyed]3952-one person who must see them , before they are destroyed . "[111-garth]

" And that is ? "[228-nurse rosemary] queried [Garth]111-garth .

" [The lady]3361-the lady portrayed , "[228-nurse rosemary] said [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , bravely .

" How do [you]111-garth know [she]3361-the lady has not seen [them]3949-their ? "[228-nurse rosemary]

" Has [she]3361-the lady ? "[111-garth] inquired [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary .

" No , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , shortly ; " and [she]3361-the lady never will . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" [She]3361-the lady must . "[111-garth]

Something in the tone of quiet insistence struck [Garth]111-garth .

" Why ? "[111-garth] [he]111-garth asked ; and listened with interest for the answer .

" Because of all it would mean to [a woman who knows [herself]3954-a woman who knows herself plain plain]3954-a woman who knows herself plain , to see [herself]3954-a woman who knows herself plain thus beautified . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth sat very still for a few moments . Then : " [A woman who knows [herself]3954-a woman who knows herself plain plain]3954-a woman who knows herself plain ? "[228-nurse rosemary] [he]111-garth repeated , with interrogative amazement in [his]111-garth voice .

" Yes , "[228-nurse rosemary] proceeded [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , encouraged . " Do [you]111-garth suppose , for a moment , that [that lady]3956-that lady 's mirror has ever shown [her]3956-that lady a reflection in any way approaching what [you]111-garth have made [her]3956-that lady in these pictures ? When [we]3957-we stand before [our]3957-we looking - glasses , [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , scowling anxiously at hats and bows , and partings , [we]3957-we usually look [our]3957-we very worst ; and [that lady]3956-that lady , at [her]3956-that lady very worst , would be of a most discouraging plainness . "[228-nurse rosemary]

[Garth]111-garth sat perfectly silent .

" Depend upon it , "[1804-she] continued [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , ' [she]1804-she never sees [herself]1804-she as ' [The Wife]837-the wife ' ' [The Mother]879-the mother . ' Is [she]1804-she [a wife]2295-a wife ? " .[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth hesitated only the fraction of a second . " Yes , "[228-nurse rosemary] [he]111-garth said , very quietly .

[Jane]101-jane 's hands flew to [her]101-jane breast . [Her]101-jane heart must be held down , or [he]111-garth would hear it throbbing .

[Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary 's voice had in it only a slight tremor , when [she]228-nurse rosemary spoke again .

" Is [she]1804-she [a mother]2794-a mother ? "[111-garth]

" No , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . " [I]228-nurse rosemary painted what might have been . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" If ? "[111-garth]

" If it HAD been , "[228-nurse rosemary] replied [Garth]111-garth , curtly .

[Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary felt rebuked . " [Dear Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , "[228-nurse rosemary] [she]228-nurse rosemary said , humbly ; " [I]111-garth realise how officious [I]111-garth must seem to [you]111-garth , with all these questions , and suggestions . But [you]111-garth must blame the hold these wonderful paintings of [yours]111-garth have taken on [my]111-garth mind . Oh , they are beautiful beautiful ! "[111-garth]

" Ah , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , the keen pleasure of [the artist]531-the artist springing up once more . " [Miss Gray]233-miss gray , [I]228-nurse rosemary have somewhat forgotten them . Have [you]233-miss gray them here ? That is right . Put them up before [you]233-miss gray , and describe them to [me]228-nurse rosemary . Let [me]228-nurse rosemary hear how they struck [you]233-miss gray , as pictures . "[228-nurse rosemary] [Jane]101-jane rose , and went to the window . [She]101-jane threw it open ; and as [she]101-jane breathed in the fresh air , breathed out a passionate prayer that [her]101-jane nerve , [her]101-jane voice , [her]101-jane self - control might not fail [her]101-jane , in this critical hour . [She]101-jane [herself]101-jane had been convicted by [Garth]111-garth 's pictures . Now [she]101-jane must convince [Garth]111-garth , by [her]101-jane description of them . [He]111-garth must be made to believe in the love [he]111-garth had depicted .

Then [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary sat down ; and , in the gentle , unemotional voice , which was quite [her]228-nurse rosemary own , described to the eager ears of [the blind artist]1809-the blind artist , exactly what [Jane]101-jane had seen in [the studio]2711-the studio .

It was perfectly done . It was mercilessly done . All the desperate , hopeless , hunger for [Jane]101-jane , awoke in [Garth]111-garth ; the maddening knowledge that [she]101-jane had been [his]111-garth , and yet not [his]111-garth ; that , had [he]111-garth pressed for [her]101-jane answer that evening , it could not have been a refusal ; that the cold calculations of later hours , had no place in those moments of ecstasy . Yet [he]111-garth lost [her]101-jane lost [her]101-jane ! Why ? Ah , why ? Was there any possible reason other than the one [she]101-jane gave ?

[Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary 's quiet voice went on , regardless of [his]111-garth writhings . But [she]228-nurse rosemary was drawing to a close . " And it is such a beautiful crimson rambler , [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , "[228-nurse rosemary] [she]228-nurse rosemary said . " [I]111-garth like the idea of its being small and in bud , in the first picture ; and blooming in full glory , in the second . "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth pulled [himself]111-garth together and smiled . [He]111-garth must not give way before [this girl]1811-this girl .

" Yes , "[111-garth] [he]111-garth said ; " [I]228-nurse rosemary am glad [you]1811-this girl noticed that . And , look here . [We]3960-we will not destroy them at once . Now [they]3961-they are found , there is no hurry . [I]228-nurse rosemary am afraid [I]228-nurse rosemary am giving [you]1811-this girl a lot of trouble ; but will [you]1811-this girl ask for some large sheets of brown paper , and make a package , and write upon it : ' Not to be opened , ' and tell [Margery]147-margery to put them back in [the studio]2711-the studio . Then , when [I]228-nurse rosemary want them , at any time , [I]228-nurse rosemary shall have no difficulty in identifying them . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" [I]228-nurse rosemary am so glad , "[228-nurse rosemary] said [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary . " Then perhaps [the plain lady]3963-the plain lady "[111-garth]

" [I]111-garth can not have [her]3963-the plain lady spoken of so , "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth , hotly . " [I]228-nurse rosemary do not know what [she]3963-the plain lady thought of [herself]3963-the plain lady [I]228-nurse rosemary doubt if [she]3963-the plain lady ever gave a thought to self at all . [I]228-nurse rosemary do not know what [you]1811-this girl would have thought of [her]3963-the plain lady . [I]228-nurse rosemary can only tell [you]1811-this girl that , to [me]228-nurse rosemary , [hers]3963-the plain lady is the one face which is visible in [my]228-nurse rosemary darkness . All the loveliness [I]228-nurse rosemary have painted , all the beauty [I]228-nurse rosemary have admired , fades from [my]228-nurse rosemary mental vision , as wreaths of mist ; flutters from memory 's sight , as autumn leaves . [Her]3963-the plain lady face alone abides ; calm , holy , tender , beautiful , it is always before [me]228-nurse rosemary . And it pains [me]228-nurse rosemary that one who has only seen [her]3963-the plain lady as [MY]228-nurse rosemary hand depicted [her]3963-the plain lady should speak of [her]3963-the plain lady as plain . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" Forgive [me]228-nurse rosemary , "[228-nurse rosemary] said [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary , humbly . " [I]111-garth did not mean to pain [you]1811-this girl , [sir]3118-sir . And , to show [you]1811-this girl what [your]1811-this girl pictures have done for [me]111-garth , may [I]111-garth tell [you]1811-this girl a resolution [I]111-garth made in [the studio]2711-the studio ? [I]111-garth can not miss what they depict the sweetest joys of life for want of the courage to confess [myself]111-garth wrong ; pocket [my]111-garth pride ; and be frank and humble . [I]111-garth am going to write a full confession to [[my]111-garth young man]3800-my young man , as to [my]111-garth share of the misunderstanding which has parted [us]3967-us . Do [you]1811-this girl think [he]3800-my young man will understand ? Do [you]1811-this girl think [he]3800-my young man will forgive ? "[111-garth]

[Garth]111-garth smiled . [He]111-garth tried to call up an image of a pretty troubled face , framed in a fluffy setting of soft fair hair . It harmonised so little with the voice ; but it undoubtedly was [Nurse Rosemary Gray]228-nurse rosemary , as [others]410-others saw [her]228-nurse rosemary .

" [He]3800-my young man will be [a brute]3968-a brute if [he]3800-my young man does n't , [child]1787-child , "[101-jane] [he]111-garth said .

CHAPTER XXXI

IN [LIGHTER VEIN

Dinner]87-lighter vein dinner that evening , the first at [their]1813-their small round table , was a great success . [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary 's plans all worked well ; and [Garth]111-garth delighted in arrangements which made [him]111-garth feel less helpless .

The strain of the afternoon brought its reaction of merriment . A little judicious questioning drew forth further stories of [the duchess]304-the duchess and [[her]304-the duchess pets]1815-her pets ; and [Miss Champion]118-miss champion 's name came in with a frequency which [they]1813-their both enjoyed .

It was a curious experience for [Jane]101-jane , to hear [herself]101-jane described in [Garth]111-garth 's vivid word - painting . Until that fatal evening at [Shenstone]16-shenstone , [she]101-jane had been remarkably free from self - consciousness ; and [she]101-jane had no idea that [she]101-jane had a way of looking straight into [people]533-people 's eyes when [she]101-jane talked to [them]533-people , and that that was what muddled up " the silly little minds of women who say [they]533-people are afraid of [her]101-jane , and that [she]101-jane makes [them]533-people nervous ! [You]3970-you see [she]101-jane looks right into [their]533-people shallow shuffling little souls , full of conceited thoughts about [themselves]533-people , and nasty ill - natured thoughts about [her]101-jane ; and no wonder [they]533-people grow panic - stricken , and flee ; and talk of [her]101-jane as ' [that formidable Miss Champion]118-miss champion . ' [I]228-nurse rosemary never found [her]101-jane formidable ; but , when [I]228-nurse rosemary had the chance of a real talk with [her]101-jane , [I]228-nurse rosemary used to be thankful [I]228-nurse rosemary had nothing of which to be ashamed . [Those]101-jane clear eyes touched bottom every time , as [our]3971-our kindred over the water so expressively put it . "[228-nurse rosemary]

Neither had [Jane]101-jane any idea that [she]101-jane always talked with a poker , if possible ; building up the fire while [she]101-jane built up [her]101-jane own argument ; or attacking it vigorously , while [she]101-jane demolished [[her]101-jane opponent]1817-her opponent 's ; that [she]101-jane stirred the fire with [her]101-jane toe , but [her]101-jane very smart boots never seemed any the worse ; that when pondering a difficult problem , [she]101-jane usually stood holding [her]101-jane chin in [her]101-jane right hand , until [she]101-jane had found the solution . All these small characteristics [Garth]111-garth described with vivid touch , and dwelt upon with a tenacity of remembrance , which astonished [Jane]101-jane , and revealed [him]111-garth , in [his]111-garth relation to [herself]101-jane three years before , in a new light .

[His]111-garth love for [her]101-jane had been so suddenly disclosed , and had at once had to be considered as a thing to be either accepted or put away ; so that when [she]101-jane decided to put it away , it seemed not to have had time to become in any sense part of [her]101-jane life . [She]101-jane had viewed it ; realised all it might have meant ; and put it from [her]101-jane .

But now [she]101-jane understood how different it had been for [Garth]111-garth . During the week which preceded [his]111-garth declaration , [he]111-garth had realised , to the full , the meaning of [their]1818-their growing intimacy ; and , as [his]111-garth certainty increased , [he]111-garth had more and more woven [her]101-jane into [his]111-garth life ; [his]111-garth vivid imagination causing [her]101-jane to appear as [[his]111-garth beloved]1819-his beloved from the first ; loved and wanted , when as yet [they]1818-their were merely [acquaintances]1820-acquaintances ; [kindred spirits]1821-kindred spirits ; [friends]2139-friends .

To find [herself]101-jane thus shrined in [his]111-garth heart and memory was infinitely touching to [Jane]101-jane ; and seemed to promise , with sweet certainty , that it would not be difficult to come [home]381-home [there]2228-there to abide , when once all barriers between [them]1818-their were removed .

After dinner , [Garth]111-garth sat long at the piano , filling [the room]424-the room with harmony . Once or twice the theme of The Rosary crept in , and [Jane]101-jane listened anxiously for its development ; but almost immediately it gave way to something else . It seemed rather to haunt the other melodies , than to be actually there itself .

When [Garth]111-garth left the piano , and , guided by the purple cord , reached [his]111-garth chair , [Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary said gently " [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , can [you]111-garth spare [me]111-garth for a few days at the end of this week ? "[111-garth]

" Oh , why ? "[111-garth] said [Garth]111-garth . " To go where ? And for how long ? Ah , [I]228-nurse rosemary know [I]228-nurse rosemary ought to say : ' Certainly ! Delighted ! ' after all [your]111-garth goodness to [me]228-nurse rosemary . But [I]228-nurse rosemary really can not ! [You]111-garth do n't know what life was without [you]111-garth , when [you]111-garth week - ended ! That week - end seemed months , even though [Brand]107-deryck was [here]2151-here . It is [your]111-garth own fault for making [yourself]111-garth so indispensable . "[228-nurse rosemary]

[Nurse Rosemary]228-nurse rosemary smiled . " [I]228-nurse rosemary daresay [I]228-nurse rosemary shall not be away for long , "[228-nurse rosemary] [she]228-nurse rosemary said . " That is , if [you]111-garth want [me]111-garth , [I]111-garth can return . But , [Mr. Dalmain]111-garth , [I]111-garth intend to - night to write that letter of which [I]111-garth told [you]111-garth . [I]111-garth shall post it to - morrow . [I]111-garth must follow it up almost immediately . [I]111-garth must be with [him]111-garth when [he]111-garth receives it , or soon afterwards . [I]111-garth think [I]111-garth hope [he]111-garth will want [me]111-garth at once . This is Monday . May [I]111-garth go on Thursday ? "[111-garth]

[Poor Garth]111-garth looked blankly dismayed .

" Do [nurses]3029-nurses , as a rule , leave [[their]3029-nurses patients]3271-their patients , and rush off to [[their]3029-nurses young men]3975-their young men in order to find out how [they]3029-nurses have liked [their]3029-nurses letters ? "[228-nurse rosemary] [he]111-garth inquired , in mock protest .

" [I]228-nurse rosemary shall wire to [Brand]107-deryck . "[228-nurse rosemary]

" [He]107-deryck will send [you]228-nurse rosemary [a more efficient and more dependable person]3977-a more efficient and more dependable person . "[111-garth]

" Oh [you]228-nurse rosemary wicked little thing ! "[111-garth] cried [Garth]111-garth . " Do n't call [me]228-nurse rosemary ' [sir]3118-sir ' ! " [Little Dicky Brand]162-dicky summed up [Mrs. Do]278-mrs. do - and - don't rather well , "[111-garth] pursued [Garth]111-garth . " [She]3985-a certain little lady of our acquaintance was calling at [Wimpole Street]29-wimpole street , on [Lady Brand]143-lady brand 's ' at [home]381-home ' day . " Now if [she]3956-that lady had asked [ME]0-i if [I]0-i was coming to [[HER]3956-that lady party]3997-her party , [I]0-i should have said : "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i ; [I]0-i am . " It is very trying when [people]533-people only THINK about important things , such as [little girls]3999-little girls and parties ; because [their]533-people thinking never amounts to much . But [Mummie]280-mummie asks [them]4003-seven ladies whether it is raining , or whether [they]4003-seven ladies think it has been raining , or is going to rain ; and when [they]4003-seven ladies have told [her]280-mummie , [she]280-mummie hurries away and asks [somebody else]3463-somebody else . " [I]1828-the bishop said : "[1828-the bishop] If [you]0-i DO , perhaps [you]0-i will tell [me]0-i . " But [she]4007-the thinking lady thought [she]4007-the thinking lady had to go , quite in a hurry . So [I]1833-i saw [her]4007-the thinking lady off ; and then asked [the Bishop]1828-the bishop alone . [Bishops]4012-bishops are [most satisfactory kind of people]4013-most satisfactory kind of people ; because [they]4012-bishops are quite sure about everything ; and [you]4014-you feel safe in quoting [them]4012-bishops to [Nurse]2339-nurse . [Nurse]228-nurse rosemary told [Marsdon]282-marsdon that [this one]4016-this one is in ' sheep 's clothing , "[1833-i] because [he]1828-the bishop wears a gold cross . " And [mother]2246-mother seemed as shocked as if [father]4004-father and [I]228-nurse rosemary had spoken in [church]1832-church , instead of just as [we]1830-our came out . When [Jane]101-jane had locked the letter - bag earlier that evening , and handed it to [Simpson]230-simpson , [she]101-jane had slipped in two letters of [her]101-jane own . One was addressed to
